"My sons, set forth! Search for, and enquire about Yusuf and his brother, and despair not about Allah's great favour; indeed, but for the rejecters will not despair about Allah's mercy."

So when they came before him and said, "O Master, a great grief has seized our family; we have with us only a little amount; measure us in full and give us as a charity; verily, Allah gives goodly reward to those who give charity."
He said, "Do you know what you did to Yusuf and his brother when you were ignorant?"

They said, "Really are you, Yusuf?" Said he, "Yes, I am Yusuf, and he is my brother- Allah has indeed bestowed Mercy upon us. Those who fear God, and observe patience- Allah, surely will not waste the reward of the good-doers."
They said, "By Allah, though we have sinned against you, Allah has indeed preferred you over us."
He said, "This day there is no charge against you; may Allah forgive you, and He is the Most Merciful of the merciful ones."
"Take this, my shirt and put it on my father's face, and he will regain sight; and, bring all your kindred to me."415
And when the caravan parted, their father said, "Certainly I sense the smell of Yusuf, but I doubt you call me dotard."
Said they, "By Allah! You are in your false sense as ever."
Then, when the bringer of good news put it on his face, he regained his sight. He said, "Did I not say to you, I know from Allah that which you do not know?"416
They said, "Our father, seek forgiveness for us for our sins; surely, we had wronged."
He said, "I will seek forgiveness for you from my God; surely, He is Forgiving, Merciful."
When they came in, to Yusuf, he preserved his father and mother with him and said, "If Allah wills, enter the city of Misr without fear."

And he raised his parents upon the Throne of wisdom; and, the others too fell in prostration. He said, "O my father, this is the truth of my earlier dream; my God made it true. And after He had delivered me out of prison- and, after Shaitan caused division between my brothers and me, He had surely bestowed a great favour upon me by bringing you from the village. Verily, my God is Most Gentle in what He wills; indeed, He is All-Knowing, Wise."

"My God, You have indeed given me the Kingdom, and taught me the secret hadiths; O the Creator of the heavens and earth, You are my Saviour now and forever; receive me unto You while I am in peace with You; and, join me with the righteous."
This is of the secrets, unseen; We reveal it to you, and you were not among them when they concertedly devised their evil plots."
And however earnest may ye be, most among men will not believe.
And you do not ask them wages for it; it is but a clear conscience, unto all.
And how many a portent in the heavens and earth! But they pass by them, slighting.
And most of them believed not in Allah except with partners unto Him.
Are they fearless of the punishment of Allah surrounding them or that their end shall come to them of a sudden when they are not aware?
Say: "This is my way; I am calling you to Allah; I and those who follow me are on clear Signs. Allah is most Pure, and I am not of them who set up partners to Allah."

And We sent before you none but the men of their towns - We inspired them; and, have they not gone about the earth and seen how the ends of the people before them were? Do you not understand that the final abode shall be the best for those who fear God?
And when the messengers thought they were indeed belied and all hopes were lost, Our help came to them; then whom We saved whom We willed - Our punishment will not be averted from the people, unjust.

Indeed in their revelations are the Signs for the Knowing - This is not hadiths, conjured, but testifies everything before them, and it explains every affair and the straight path and mercy for the believing people.
A L M R417 - These are the Signs of the Book, clear. And it is the Truth revealed to you from your God; yet, most of mankind do not believe.

Allah is He who raised the heavens without a pillar, and you see it; then He set His kingdom upon it; and, He has the sun and the moon under His order, and all of them move by His rules, and for a period determined- and that He decides their affairs. He explains the Signs such that you may affirm that you shall meet your God.

And He, it is who made the earth bountiful and placed firmly therein mountains and made rivers; and, in it, He created in pairs every kind of fruit; and, He covers the night with the day - indeed, herein is the Sign for those who reflect.

And on the earth are adjoined lands with gardens of grapevines, fields sown, and the date-palms of single or multiple stems. Though they have the same water source, the fruits of some excel that of the others; indeed, in it are clear Signs to the thoughtful.

And if you are surprised, the astonishing thing is that they say, "Will we surely be into a new life after we are dust?" They reject their God; they have shackles on their necks and are the inhabitants of hell wherein they abide.

And they hasten you on the evil before the good, and before them are the punishing examples. And indeed, your God is relenting towards people for their sins, and your God certainly is severe in retribution.
And the rejecters say about you, "Should not be a Sign sent down upon him from His God?" You are only a warner! And for every person, a Guide!
Allah knows what every female bear in her womb, and its shrinking and expansion; and with Him is a measure for everything.
He is the Knower of the secrets, and that is plain. He is Most Exalted, Most High.
It is the same whether any of you keep your speech secret or open; and, he who lurks in the darkness of night, or he who walks in the shine of the day.

Unto him are protectors who go forth before and behind by Allah's command; Allah indeed changes not the people's position, unless they change their nature. And when Allah intends ill for a people, there is none to avert it - and, for them, there is no Helper but He.
It is He who shows you the lightning that causes fear and hope and creates the laden clouds.
And the thunder glorifies His purity, and the angels also fear Him with awe; and, He sends down thunderbolts by which He strikes whom He wills; yet, they dispute about Allah while He is All-Mighty.

To Him is the right call; whoever calls besides Him shall not answer them, and it is like the one who spreads out his both hands for the water to reach his mouth - it will not get to the mouth; and, the prayer of the non-believers is but in error.
And all who are in the heavens and the earth obey only Allah willingly or unwillingly, as do their shadows in the morning and evening.

Say, "Who is the God for the heavens and the earth?" Say, "He is Allah!" Say, "Do you take protectors besides Him? They cannot do good or harm in aught to themselves." Say, "Are the blind and the seer, same? Or is the darkness and the light the same? Or have that which they had associated created anything like what Allah had created? If so, they might have doubted concerning 'the Creation'." Say, "Allah creates all things, and He is the Controller."

He sends down rain from the sky; then the streams run to their measures, and the floods carry the swelling foam. Such foams do float when you melt things under fire to make ornaments and other things; thus, Allah distinguishes between the Truth and evil; the dirty foam gets blown away, and all that is beneficial to man settle down in the earth - Allah thus exemplifies.

There is a goodly reward for those who follow their God, and as for those who do not follow Him, even if they possess all on the earth and own the like of it with it, they would wish to offer them for their ransom; their reckoning will be terrible, and their abode will be hell - an evil resting!
Will he who sees what is sent down upon you by your God as the Truth, like a blind? Indeed, only the thoughtful shall have the wisdom.
They fulfil their promise to Allah, and they will not break their words and promises.
And those who preserve which Allah has commanded to keep up. And they will fear their God and will be afraid of the severe reckoning.

And they will forbear for their God's pleasure and will stand firm for Him; and, they will give from what We have provided them, secretly and openly, and will avert evil with the good; theirs is the sequel of the goodly home.
In the eternal paradises - them, their fathers, their spouses and their generations - those who lived to their God's satisfaction shall enter it. And the angels will enter unto them from every gate.
"May you have Peace for your forbearance - excellent indeed is your final home."
And woe to those who break their word after the covenant with Allah, create divisions while Allah commands the joining, and who cause corruption on the land - evil is their abode.
Allah expands the provisions to whom He will, and also in just measures. Yet they rejoice only in this life - but the worldly life is low to the final eternal home.
And the rejecters say, "Should it not be that a Sign from his God sent down upon him?" Say, "Surely Allah leaves astray whom He will, and He guides who turn to Him."
They are those who believed, and their hearts gain peace when they remember Allah; know that Allah's remembrance makes hearts remain in peace."
Those who believe and do good, to them are blessings and a beautiful abode.

Thus did We send you to a people. And people indeed, have gone by before them - to clarify what We inspired in you; but they reject the Bountiful Himself. Say, "He is my God; there is no God but He; I rely on Him, and unto Him is the return."

Surely, the Quran - through with it the mountains are moved, or the earth is rent asunder or the dead, made to speak - yet, all affairs rest with Allah. So do the believers not know that had Allah willed, He would have guided all humanity? Misfortunes hover over the rejecters for what they do, or it will settle close by their abodes, and Allah's promise will come to pass. Allah, indeed, will not fail in promise.
And indeed before you, the messengers were mocked at, and I gave respite to the rejecters, and then I seized them. Therefore, how was My punishment?

Is it not He who is watchful of everything each one is earning? Yet, they ascribe partners to Allah. Say, "Name them! Or do you inform Him what He does not know on the earth? Or they are mere words?" Nay, but decked out fair to the disbelievers is their devising; they are barred from the Straight Path. who so Allah leaves astray, and none shall bring Him to the Path.
To them is chastisement in this world, and the chastisement in the Hereafter is even harsher - there is none to save them from Allah.

Those who fear Allah, the nature of the promised Paradise is - beneath it, the rivers would flow; its provisions and shadows are eternal; it is the end-home for those who fear; and, the end of the unbelievers is fire.

And to whom We have given the Book rejoice at what is sent down upon you. Still, a party of the people reject portions of it. Say, "I am but commanded to seek only from Allah and associate not anything to Him; I only call unto Him; and, to Him is My return."
Such, in Arabic - We have revealed with clear explanation. So, after the wisdom you have got, if you follow their desires, you will find neither a protector nor a helper from Allah.
And verily, We had sent messengers before you, and We gave them wives and descendants. And, not a messenger reveals a Sign from Allah but by His leave, for each period is a witness.
Allah effaces what He wills, and establishes; and, with Him is the source of ordinance.418
And whether We make you see some of Our promises to them or We call you to Us - upon you is deliverance, and Ours, the reckoning.
Do they not see that We are shortening the earth by its  wealth? And Allah is the judge, and no one changes His decree. And He is swift at reckoning.
And those before them too were devising; yet, all the plannings are with Allah, and He knows what each one earns; and, the disbelievers would soon know who deserves the best abode.
And the disbelievers say, "You are not a messenger." Say, "Allah suffices me as a witness between you and me, and those who know the Book."
ALR - The wisdom, We revealed to you that you might bring the people from darkness to light by the leave of their God. Unto the path of the Mighty, Praised One.419
Allah - to Him belongs all that is in the skies and the earth, but those who deny, suffer a woefully severe punishment.
They love the worldly life more than the life ultimate, and they prevent from the path of Allah, wishing to make it crooked; they are in far away error.
And We sent not a messenger to his people but who spoke their language to be well informed. Allah sends astray whom He wills and guides whom He wills. He is Mighty, Wise.
Surely We sent Musa with Our Signs saying, "Bring your people from the darkness to the light, and remind them of the days of Allah." Indeed, in it are the Signs for the patient, grateful.

And Musa said to his people, "Remember the Mercy of Allah upon you when He saved you from the people of Firaun. They oppressed you cruelly, killed your sons, and let the females to their endurance; therein was a great trial from your God."
And when your God said, "If you show thanks, I will surely increase you, but if you turn away, My punishment is indeed terrible."
And Musa said, "Even when you and all on earth come together in evil - surely Allah is Absolute, Glorified."

Has not the history of the people of Nuh, Aad and Samud before you, and that of the people who followed them come to you? None knows about them except Allah; and, their messengers brought them clear proofs, but they took their hands to their mouths and said, "We certainly deny that which you are sent with, and we are in serious doubt concerning to what you call us."420

Their messengers said, "Do you doubt Allah who created the skies and the earth? He calls you to salvation, giving you a reprieve for a stated time." They said, "You are not but a human, like us - and, do you wish to prevent us from what our forefathers were worshipping? If so, bring us clear Signs."

Their messengers who came to them said, "We are, but humans like you, and Allah showers His Grace upon whom He will of His slaves - and, we are not to bring any Sign unto you except by the leave of Allah. And whoever believes, may he trust Allah alone."
And what is with us that we do not rely on Allah? Indeed, He guided us in our affairs; we will surely endure your oppression. Let the trusting trust in Allah.
And the rejecters said to their messengers: Surely we would throw you out of our land, or you should return to our ways. And remember when their God said, " Verily, We will destroy the evildoers."
"Certainly We will make you inherit this land after them; this, for those who fear before Me, and for those who fear My warning."
So they turned to Allah, and every froward tyrant met his disaster.
After him is the hell - and he will be given oozing pus for drinking.
He will swallow it in sips, yet it will not go past his throat with ease, and death will come to him from all sides, but he is not to die; and, still beyond him is even evil punishment.

The parable of those who deny their God: their deeds are like ashes; on a day of a storm, the fury of the wind has swept away the ashes; and they will not have a hold on whatever they had earned - that is the far-error.
Have you not seen that Allah had created the heavens and the earth in truth? If He wills, He will cast you away and bring up a new creation.
And it is not a matter for Allah.

And all will stand before Allah; those who were weak would say to the arrogant ones, "Verily, we were your followers; now can you avert aught from Allah's punishment?" They will say, "If Allah guides us, we will show it to you; whether we cry or keep quiet, it is the same for us; we have no other go."

And when the decree comes, Shaitan will say, "Surely Allah had given you a true promise - I too gave you the promise, but I wronged you. I called you, and you accepted my call, but for this, I haven't had any authority over you; therefore, do not curse me but curse yourself. I am not your helper, neither are you, my helper. I disown you, associating me with Allah before - surely, the wicked will suffer a severe punishment."
And whoever believes and does good will be given paradises, beneath which the rivers flow, and by their God's leave they will abide therein - their reward therein is "Peace be upon you."
Beheld not thee, how Allah coins a similitude? A goodly saying is a goodly tree; its roots are set firm, its branches reaching into heaven.
The tree gives its fruits all the time by the leave of God. Allah gives such examples so that man reminisces.421
And the example of evil words is an evil tree pulled out from the earth's surface, and it has no lasting.
Whoever believes, Allah makes them firm both in this world and at the end with a firm word, and Allah sends the wrongdoers astray. And Allah does what He wills.
Have you not seen those who changed Allah's Blessings by disbelief and led their people to dwell in the abode of perdition?
Burning hell - a wretched place to dwell.
And they associate to Him to lead astray from the path of Allah. Say, "Enjoy a little; then surely your abode is hell."
Say to My believing bondsmen, "Surrender to your God before a day arrives wherein there will be no bargaining, nor friendliness, and give out of what We have provided them, secretly and openly."

Allah is He, who created the heavens and the earth; then He brought down the rain from the sky wherewith He produced varieties of fruits as your food, and by His leave He caused the ships to run in the sea under your control; and, He gave you control over the rivers.
It is He who subjected you, the sun and the moon, that they moved in their orbits in perfect order. And He subjected to you the night and the day.
And He gave you everything from what you have heard of Him, and you will run out of count if you reckon His blessings on you; verily, man is transgressing, thankless.
And when Ibrahim said: "My God, make this town free from fear, protect my people and me, from worshipping the idols."
"God, surely these have caused many into the path of error; so whoever follows me, he is of me and whoever turns away from me - surely You are Most Forgiving, Merciful."

"Our God, surely I have settled my following in no man's valley, by Your sacred house - Our God, to establish them in Your way; so, make the hearts of a party of the people to lean on to them and provide them of the fruits that they might be thankful."
"Our God, surely You are the Knower of our secrets and openness; and, nothing is hidden to Allah what is in the sky and the earth."
All glory be to Allah; He gave me Ismail and Ishaq in my old age; surely, my God grants the call.
"God, make me and my following as those who establish Your Way; our God, accept my call!"
"Our God, forgive me and my parents and the believers on the Day of Reckoning."
And think not that Allah is unmindful of what the unjust do; it is delayed for them only for the day their eyes will be still and stare.
They will be running with their heads raised, their eyes will not return to them, and their souls will be void.

So admonish the people of the day before such punishment comes upon them. Then the transgressors would say: "Our God, give us a respite; we will accept your call, and we shall follow the messengers." "What! weren't you wont to swear, your end will not come?"422
And you dwelt in the dwellings of those who wronged themselves, and We did show to you how We dealt with them. And We showed you the examples.
They were consistently plotting which plots shall even efface the mountains, yet their plottings are with Allah.
So never think Allah will fail in His promise to His messengers; surely Allah is Mighty, Avenging.
And on the day when this earth is changed to a different land, and when the skies are changed, they will come forth before Allah, the One, Supreme Command.
And on that day, you will find all the guilty chained together.
And their clothing would be of molten tar; and, the fire would cover their faces.
So, Allah shall justly recompense for what they used to earn; verily, Allah is swift in reckoning.
That they are warned with this and that they know, "God is One!" That is the proclamation to humanity so that the knowledge would know.
ALR - These are the Signs of the Book and a manifest Quran.423
The rejecters would wish that they should have surrendered to their God.
Leave them to eat and enjoy; their indulgence has diverted them, but soon they will know.
And never did We destroy a town before the decree was made known.
No people can outstrip their term, nor can they lag.
And they say, "O you upon whom the revelation is sent; you are surely a madman".
"If you are truthful, should you not have brought us, angels, with you?"
We do not send down the angels but with Truth; then they will not be respited.
Surely We sent down the manifest wisdom, and indeed, We are its guardian.424
And indeed, We sent many before you to various communities.
But never a messenger came to them, but they did mock him.
Thus do We make it enter into the hearts of the criminals.
They will not believe in this, and that has been the way of those before them.
Even if We open up a gate to them from the heavens and they kept climbing up.425
They would indeed say: "Our eyes have been dazzled; nay, we are folk bewitched."
And We set constellations in space and made it beauteous for the beholders.
And We protected them from every evil shaitan, cursed.426
Except he who hears by stealth- a blazing flare will pursue him.427
And We expanded the earth and cherished it with mountains; and we caused every produce in it, each with a measure.428
And in it, We have made every provision for you and to whom you will not provide.429
And not the treasures of every provision is but with us, and We send it not down but with a measure known.430
And We send the breeze of laden clouds; then We cause the rain to descend from the heavens wherewith We provide you to drink, and you are not to store it.
And indeed it is We who give life and cause death, and We are the Inheritor.
And We indeed know who the first among you are, and We surely know who lag.
And surely your God will gather them. He indeed is Wise, The Knowing.
And We indeed created man from sounding black clay, moulded.
And before, We created Jinn from the blaze of fire.
And when your God said to the angels, "Indeed I am going to create human beings from sounding black clay."
"So when I perfect him and elevate him with My Ruh, surrender to him!"431
So, all the angels surrendered.
Except Iblis- he stayed away from surrendering.
He said, "O Iblis, why haven't you joined with those who surrendered?"
He said, "I am not to surrender to the human who You created from the sounding black clay."
Said He, "Then get out of this; indeed you are accursed!"
"Upon you shall rest the curse till the Day of Reckoning."
Iblis said, "O my God, grant me respite till the day of resurrection."432
Said He, "Indeed, you are of the respited ones."
"Until the Hour determined, comes."
"My God, since you left me astray, I will entice them all, making this earth glamorous."
"Except Your pure-hearted servants among them."
Said He, "This path is the straight path to Me."
"Surely you have no authority over My servants, except who followed you in error."
And, "Surely, hell is the promised place for them all."
"It has seven gates; each gate is meant for a people, set for it."
Surely, God-fearing will be in the paradises and fountains.
"Enter in it fearlessly, peaceful."
"And We will remove animosities from their breasts. They will be seated on the thrones facing one another as brethren."
Fatigue will not touch them in it, and they will not be expelled from there.
Say to My servants: "I am indeed the most Forgiving, Loving.
"And indeed, My punishment will be severely painful."
And narrate to them about the guests of Ibrahim.
When they came to him and said, "Peace!" He said, "We fear you!"
They said, "Fear not; we give glad tidings about a child, endowed with wisdom."
He said, "Do you give me glad tidings at this old age? Of what then is your good news?"
They said, "Verily, we gave you the good news; so, do not despair."
He said, "Who will despair of the Mercy of His God, save those who are astray?"433
He said, "And what is your task O, ye Messengers?"
They said, "We are sent to a people, transgressing."
"Except the followers of Lut, indeed We will save them all."
"Except his wife; We have decreed that she certainly stayed back."
And when the messengers came to the folk of Lut,
He said, "You seem to be strangers!"
They said, "Nay, we have brought to you that which they doubt."
And, "We have brought you the truth, and we indeed are truthful."
"So, set forth, in a watch of the night with your folk, and follow behind them; none of you shall even turn to see, and continue on to wither you are commanded."
And We revealed to him this decree: they are to be uprooted in the early morning.
And the people of the city came rejoicing;
He said, "Surely these are my guests; so put me not to shame."
And, "Fear Allah; disgrace me not."
They said, "Did we not forbid you from the world?"
He said, "Here are my daughters if you would be doing!"
"By your life! surely they are blindly wandering in their intoxication."
So thunder seized them at sunrise.
And We turned it uppermost nethermost, and We rained on it stones of baked clay.
Surely in it are manifest signs for those who ponder.
And surely, it is right on the highway.
Behold! Therein is the Sign for the believers.
And those who lived in the flourishing gardens were transgressing ones.
So we avenged them; both are on the highways, open to see.
And the people of the 'mountain rocks' too were belying their prophets.
And We gave them Our Signs, but they were neglecting them.
And out of the mountains they hewed out edifices, well secured.
Yet they were seized by the blast in the early morning.
And all that they were wont to count as gain, availed them nothing.
And We have not created the heavens and the earth, and in between but in truth. And, the Hour is bound to arrive; so, forgive them with gracious forgiveness.
Your God indeed is All-Creator, All-Knowing.
And We have certainly given you the pondering of the Seven and the Mighty Quran.
Stretch not your eyes at We have allowed on certain classes of them, nor grieve over them; yet, have mercy upon the believers.
Say, "Indeed I am a plain warner."
Just as We sent down upon the splitters,
Upon the splitters of this Quran too.
So, by your God, surely We will question them all.
About what they used to do.
So, declare openly what you are commanded, and ignore the idolators.
Indeed, We suffice you against the mockers.
They set up God besides Allah, but soon they will come to know.
And indeed, We know your heart is straitened at what they say.
So exalt your God's praise and be of those who surrendered.
And look up to your God, until, comes to you the certainty.
Allah's command has come. So hasten not about it. He is Most Pure, Most High from all that they associate with Him.
He sends down the messengers from the angels with revelation upon whom He will of His servants saying, "Give the warning that there is no God but I, so, fear Me!"
He has created the heavens and the earth in truth; Most High is He, above that they associate.
He created man from a mere drop; yet, behold! He is an open enemy.
And He created the cattle for you whence is the warmth and much more benefits, and of which you eat.
And there is a beauty in them for you when you bring them in and as you take them out.
And they carry your loads to distant places- impossible for you to travel but with extreme difficulty. Indeed, your God is Merciful, Loving.
And the horses, mules and asses for you to ride and as an ornament; and, He creates what you know not.
And with Allah is the way straight, and there are ways, wrong; and if He wills, indeed, He would guide you all aright.
He brings the rain from the sky wherefrom is your drink, and the grasslands on which you send your cattle to pasture.
In addition to that, He causes the crops and the olives and the date palms to grow for you. And grapevines and all kinds of fruits. Lo! Herein is indeed a sign for those who give thought.
And it is He who made subservient to you, the night and the day - and the sun and moon. And by His command, the stars. Again herein indeed are the signs for those who ponder.
And whatever He has created on the earth is of diverse hues; this is a definite sign for those who reflect.

And to feed you of the sea, the tender meat, and to bring forth from it the ornaments to deck you with, it is He who subjected it to you. And you see the ship cleaving through it, to seek His bounties and to show thanks to Him, He made it subservient to you.
And He erected mountains firm on the earth lest it shakes with you, and to lead your ways, the rivers and the passages.
And they find their paths by the signs; and, the stars.
Is He who Creates as that that does not create? Will you not think?
And if you count the bounties of Allah, you will run out of numbers; indeed, Allah is Forgiving, Merciful.
And Allah knows what you hide and what you reveal.
And unto whom they cry beside Allah created nought, but are themselves created.
Dead, not alive. And they know not when they will be raised.
Your God is One God! So whoever disbelieves in the hereafter, their breasts are denying, and they are haughty.
Doubt not! Allah knows what they hide and what they make manifest; indeed, He does not love the proud.
And when said to them, "What has your God sent down?" They say, "Stories of the ancients."
Let them bear their entire burden on the Hour and the burden of those whom they misled arrogantly. Know that evil is that they carry!
Those who were before them did plot, but Allah effaced their tower, and their ceilings toppled on them. The torment struck them from the directions they never perceived.

Then, on the Hour, He would disgrace them and say, "Where are My 'partners' concerning whom ye disputed?" And those who had wisdom would say, "Indeed, This Day, upon the rejecters, are the disgrace and the torment."
The angels would capture their souls while they wrong themselves, but they would submit and say, "We have not been doing any wrong at all." Nay, Allah indeed, is the Knower of what you used to do.
"So, enter the gates of hell and abide therein; what an evil abode for the proud!"

And when the pious were asked, "What did your God send down?" They said, "The Good!" Whoever does a beautiful deed, for them is a handsome reward in this world and will be much better in the end; whoever fears God, the most graceful indeed is the House."
They will enter the paradises eternal beneath which the rivers flow, and they will have there all they wished for; such is Allah's reward for the God-fearing.
Whose souls the angels take while they are goodly would say, "Peace be upon you! Enter the paradise for that you were doing."
Do they expect, but the angels shall come upon them, or your God's command descend upon them? So did those before them; Allah did not harm them, but they harmed themselves.
So their evil came upon them, and that which they mocked surrounded them.

And the idolators say, "If Allah had willed our ancestors or we would not have worshipped anything other than Him. And, but by His leave, we would not have forbidden anything." Thus did those before them; so is there anything upon the messengers except to reveal clearly?

And We indeed sent messengers to every community saying, "Call upon Allah alone, and turn away from shaitans." So, of them are whom Allah guided, and of them are who had been cast astray. And, go about the land and behold that had happened to those who belied.
However hard you wish that they took to the straight path, Allah will not guide whom He had left astray; there is no helper to them.
And they firmly swear by Allah, "Allah will not raise the dead!" Nay, the Word is firm, yet most men understand not.
To make plain to them about that which they disputed, and that the unbelievers would know they were the liars;-
It is Our Word: When We intend a thing, We say to it, "Be! and it is."

And whoever forsook their places of living after oppression for Allah's sake, indeed to them, We give a beautiful abode in this world; and if they knew, the reward in the hereafter would be much more graceful.
They are those who endure and put their trust in their God.
And those whom We sent with Our revelation before, are none but males; so if you do not know, seek from those who are thoughtful.
We sent down upon you the clear reminder, to make them ponder that which is blessed for humanity with clear Signs, and as Inspiration.
Are they without fear that Allah will not make the earth swallow them up for their evil plots or that the punishment will come upon them from nowhere?
Or that He will not seize them while on their travels? So you will in no way fail Him.
Or that He will not take them even as they were fearful of it? Your God indeed is Relenting, Merciful.
Beheld them not aught Allah had created? Their shadows bow to the right and the left, surrendering to Allah.
And all that is in the heavens and the earth, the creations and the angels bow surrendering to Allah- and they are not proud.
They fear their God above them, and they do what they are commanded.
And Allah says: Make not two Gods, He is One God; so, fear Me alone.
Unto Him is what in the heavens and the earth are, and our obeisance shall ever be unto Him; and, do you fear that which are not Allah?
And whatever good you possess, it is from Allah, and when you suffer distress, unto Him, ye cry.
Then when He removes the distress from you, behold, a section of you set up partners to God.
To deny what We have given them - "enjoy then, soon you will know."
And they set aside a part of what We have given them to that they do not know; and by Allah, indeed, you will be questioned about the lies you invented.
And they assign daughters to Allah; Glory be to Him - and they desire for them
And when one of them receives the tidings of a female, his face becomes gloomy with anger.
He hides him from his people for the disgrace of a good tiding for him. Should he keep it with shame or bury it in the dust? How evil they decide!
Whoever disbelieves in the hereafter, the evil is of them, and Allah's is most High; and He is Mighty, Wise.

And if Allah were to punish men for their sins, He would not leave a single creature on earth; but, He reprieves them for a term determined - and when their time arrives they will neither prepone it nor will they postpone by a moment.
And they assign to Allah that which they do not wish for themselves, and their tongues lie that they will certainly receive good; fire awaits them, and no doubt they will be thrust into it.
By Allah, We have sent to the people before you, yet Shaitan made fair-seeming to them their deeds - so this day, he is their close ally and to them is a painful torment.
And not We revealed this Book to you except to clarify to them, things in which they dispute. That is the Guidance and a Mercy for those who believe.
And Allah brings rain from the sky giving therewith life to the earth after it is dead, and in it indeed are the Signs for those who have ears.
And indeed in the cattle are the Signs for you, and from their bellies between the dung and the blood, We bring forth milk pure, palatable for the drinkers.
And you make the fruit juices from the palms and the vines, and delicious food. Indeed, herein is a sign for people who ponder.
And your God gave inspiration to the Bee - "Make hives in the mountains, in the trees and the high ceilings."

Then absorb from all kinds of fruits and enter in by your God's easy way; comes forth out of their bellies, a drink of diverse hues, soothing to humankind; indeed, in this is a sign for those who ponder.
And it is Allah who created you, then causes you to die. And, there are the very old among you, living like not knowing at all, after possessing it. Indeed Allah is All-Knowing, All-Mighty.

And Allah has favoured some above some others in wealth. Those who are thus wealthy do not give to those who are close and righteous for them and make them equals therein with them. What! Do they refuse Allah's Blessings?

And Allah has created for you life-partners from among you, and from your partners, He gave you your descendants and grandchildren - and gives you a goodly provision; yet, do they then believe in the falsities, rejecting Allah's favours?
And besides Allah, they call upon those who possess not a thing for them in the heavens or the earth, powerless.
So give no examples for Allah, for indeed, Allah knows, and you know not.

Allah gives an example: A slave, having no power over whatever provision the other one possesses, and the other, to whom We have given goodly provisions from Us, of which he spends secretly and openly. Will they both be equal? All Praise be to Allah, yet most know not.

And Allah sets forth a parable of two men: one of them is dumb, having no authority over anything, and he is a burden to his master. He brings no good wherever he is sent. Is he equal to him who bids justice and is on a straight path?
And to Allah belongs the secrets of the heavens and earth434. So, the Hour is not but like the blinking of the eyes or even nearer. Indeed, Allah is Powerful over all things.
And Allah brings you forth from your mothers' wombs when aught you know, and then He gave you the hearing, the sight and the heart so that you may be thankful.
Behold not they, the birds held in the sky by His command? None but Allah has them. Assuredly, in it are the signs for those who believe.

And, Allah has made your houses your peaceful abode and made light your camping from the hides of livestock while on your journey and encampment, and He gave you their wool, fur and hairs as apparels and comfort for a period.

And, Allah gave you shades from His creations, shelters in the mountains, and clothing to protect you from the heat; and, made for your shields to save you from your violence. Thus He completed His favour on you that you may surrender.435
But if they turn away, what is upon you is a plain conveyance.
They know well the benevolence of Allah, but they reject it. And, most of them are people rejecting.
And on the day when We raise a witness from each community, the rejecters will not be allowed, nor will they be given a chance.
And when the wicked ones see the punishment, it will not be lessened for them, nor will they be reprieved.

And when those who set up associates to God see those that they associated, would say, "Our God, these are whom we associated; we were calling upon these besides you. But they would shoot back at them and say, "Surely you are liars!"
And on that day, they will offer surrender to God, and whatever they falsely invented would disappear from them.
Whoever rejects and causes hindrance in the path of Allah - for their mischievous deeds; We would increase on them the torment upon the torment.

And on that day, We will raise a witness from their community and bring you as a witness against them. We have sent down to you this Book which clarifies everything. And, a Guidance, and a Mercy, and a glad tiding to those who seek Peace.
Verily, Allah enjoins us towards justice and good deeds, giving to nearer ones; and, forbids lewdness, abomination and wickedness; and He gives you glad tidings perchance ye may give thought.
And fulfil your swearing, in the Name of Allah and break not your promises confirmed, after making Allah a witness over you. And Allah is Watcher over all that ye do.

And be not like she who shredded her firmly twisted spun to fibres; and, make not your oaths to deceive between you because a party is more numerous than another party. For Allah only tries you thereby. And indeed, He will inform you clearly on the Hour, that whereon you were at variance.
And had Allah willed He would have made you a single nation, yet He leaves astray whom He wills and guides whom He wills. And you will indeed be questioned concerning what you have done.
And make not your oaths a deceit between you, lest you will lose your foothold; and, you will taste the evil for your obstructing the path of Allah; yours will be a severe torment.
And do not exchange the covenant of Allah for meanness; indeed, what is with Allah for you is the best, if ye did but know.
All that you possess will vanish, but what is with Allah, will abide; and whoever endures, We will indeed give them a beautiful reward for the best they did.
Believing male or female, whoever is righteous, We shall assuredly give them a goodly life, and We will provide them with a grand reward for the best they used to do.
And when you recite Quran, seek refuge in Allah from the accursed shaitan.
Indeed, he has no power over those who believe and put their trust in God.
His power is only over those who make him an ally and ascribe partners to Him.
When We adapt the Sign of a verse explicitly to another verse, they say, "Indeed, you are an inventor!" And Allah knows what He reveals, yet most of them know not.436
Say: the angel pure, brought it down from your God in truth, to strengthen the believers, and a guide, and a glad tiding to those who wish peace.
And verily, We know them saying, "Undoubtedly, it is a man who teaches him!" But his tongue is foreign, referring to whom they say, while this being in clear Arabic.
Surely, Allah will not guide him who would not believe in Allah's Signs, and for them is a painful torment.
Those who forge are only those who would not believe in Allah's Signs, and they are the forgers!

Whoever rejects Allah after believing in Him save who is forced to that and whose heart is content in faith; but, whosoever heart has increased in rejection, upon them is the wrath of Allah, and to them is a painful torment.
For, indeed they love this world greater than the hereafter; and, Allah will certainly not guide the disbelieving people.
Allah has sealed their hearts, their hearing and their sight; and, such are they who were negligent.
Indeed, they shall be the losers in the hereafter.
Then Allah indeed, is with those who after their trial, left their homes, fighting a just war, and who endured; certainly, thereafter your God is All-Forgiving, All-Merciful.
On the day when each soul would contend, will be fully recompensed for what they did; and they will not be wronged.

And Allah cites parable of a nation: the dwellers in it were peaceful and without fear; its provisions came-in, in abundance from every place; but they were ingrate to Allah's bounties and were unjust in their deeds; so, Allah made them wear the garment of hunger and fear that they earned.
And indeed, to them came a messenger from among them; but they belied him; so, distress seized them while they were unjust.
So, eat of the pure and lawful provisions; and be grateful to Allah's favour if you worship Him.

What He has forbidden to you is that which was dead, blood, and swine flesh, and upon which the invocation besides Allah is made - but if anyone is forced while he has no intention of rebelling or committing sin, then Allah indeed is Forgiving, Merciful.
And say not like what your tongues lie such as, 'this is lawful, and this is forbidden'; indeed, who so forge against Allah, will not succeed.
A very mean pleasure, and for them is chastisement severe.
And We have forbidden to the Jews that We had clarified to you before; We wronged them not, but they wronged themselves.
Then, indeed your God - to who so repents and amends after wrongdoing in ignorance- then certainly, your God is Returning, Merciful.
Verily Ibrahim was a guide, abiding and devoted to Allah; and, he was not of the idolators.
Grateful for His grace; He has chosen him and guided him to the straight path.
And We gave him in this world beauteous things and indeed, in the hereafter he will be among the righteous.
Then We inspired you to follow 'the righteousness of Ibrahim, in truth,' and he was not of the idolators.
The 'forbidden day' was ordained only upon those at variance thereon. And indeed, your God will judge between them on the day of reckoning as to their conflict.
Call to your God's path with wisdom and by beautiful explanation, and discuss with them in the best way. Indeed, your God- He knows well who strayed from His way, and He knows who is guided.
And if you punish, punish them with the like of that wherewith you were harmed; but, if you are patient, indeed, it is better for the patient.
And be patient. Yet, your patience is not but by the help of Allah - grieve not over them nor be straitened for that they plot.
Allah is with those who fear Him and those who do good deeds.

The Most Pure is He who took His servant to the destination of the established truth, on a night while he was absorbed in a divine state of inspiration; and, We have blessed it with abounds all about - thus to show Our Signs to him; indeed, He is All Hearing, Seeing.437
And We gave Musa, the Book, and made it as the Guidance to the descendants of Israel: Make not protectors besides Me. 438
The descendants of those whom We have borne aboard the ship with Nuh! Verily he was a grateful servant.439
And in the Book, to the descendants of Israel We have said, "Surely twice will you cause corruption in the land, and in arrogance and transgression, shall exceed."
So when the first of the two promises came, We caused Our servants of mighty power descend on you, and they had entered the privacies of your houses - and it was a promise fulfilled.440
Then We switched the tide of victory on you over them; and, We reinforced you with wealth and children, and made you a formidable strength.

If you do good, you do good unto you, and if you do evil, it is for you. And, to cloud your faces with gloom as the second promise comes to pass, shall they enter the houses to destroy totally whatever they come-on  as had happened when they entered in the first instance;-
It may be that your God shows mercy on you; and, if you return, We return too, and for the disbelievers, We have made hell as a prison.
Indeed, this Quran guides them to the most righteous and the glad tidings - a great reward to the believing good-doers.
And whoever disbelieves the hereafter, for them. We have prepared a chastising punishment.
And man prays for evil as he prays for his good; lo, man is ever hasty.

And We made the night and day two Signs; then we made the Sign of darkness clear and made bright the Sign of light that you might seek your God's grace - to determine the periods and to observe, and that We have clearly explained all affairs.
And We have hung each man's deed on his neck, and We will reveal the witnesses on the Day of Reckoning which he will receive openly.
"Read thy book! Thy soul suffices this day as a reckoner against thee."

Whoever takes to the guidance, he guides himself for his good; and, whoever takes to the evil path, he casts evil upon himself; no bearer of burden will bear the burden of another, and We will not punish until a messenger is sent.
And if We wish to destroy a town, We will charge its fiery people - and they will exceed high; then upon the town comes true, the word - and, We annihilate it.
How many a nation have We destroyed since Nuh! And your God suffices as the Knower of the evils and as a Watcher over His bondmen.
Whoever desires this world's life; We will hasten upon whom We will that We fix; then We assign to him, the hell; they will enter it condemned, cursed.
And We accept the just efforts of the believing who are wishful of the hereafter.
To them, and the others are, from your God's grace; and, your God's grace is not denied at all.
Behold, how We have raised in degrees some over the others! Yet, the rank in the hereafter is much greater and more glorious.
Take not a god besides Allah; you will become of the condemned and cast away.

And your God has decreed, 'call not except Him, and kindness to parents'; and, utter not "Ugh!" in aversion towards them when one or both of them have indeed become aged with you; nor repulse them; and speak to them words, compassionate.
And mercifully lower upon them both, the wings of compassion. And say, "My God, show Mercy upon them both as they brought me up when I was a child."
Your God knows well what you have in your hearts; if you are good-hearted, indeed to those who often seek forgiveness, He is Most Forgiving.
And give privilege to them, who are near relation, and to those who are needy and strive in the straight path; but expend not for pride.
Those who spend for pride, are surely shaitan's brethren; and shaitan is ever ungrateful to his God.
But if you are to ignore them while you await, seeking the mercy of Allah, speak only kind words to them.
And fold not tight your hands around your neck; and spread not out wide your hands; if you do you will become disrespected and aggrieved.
Surely your God bestows in ampleness to who He wishes; and in a measure. Surely He Knows well His servants, Sees well.
And kill not your children fearing poverty; it is We who provide for them and for you; to kill them indeed is a grave sin.
And do not get near to adultery; it is indeed sinful to mind and a path evil to the core.

And when Allah has forbidden, kill not any one but for just reason; and if someone has been killed unjustly, verily We have given authority to his heir; but exceed not in killing. Verily, he is favoured.
And do not approach the properties of the orphan until he reaches maturity, without just reasons; and fulfil your promises; surely the promises will be questioned.
And when you measure, measure fully; and measure wholeheartedly - this is good and in the end will be most beautiful.
And pursue not that of which you have no knowledge - surely the hearing, and the sight and the heart - each will be questioned.
And walk not on the earth with egotism; surely you cannot rend the earth nor can you reach the mountainous heights.
The evil of all these is hateful to your God.
And all these are the wisdom of your God's inspiration upon you; so make not a god other than Allah; you will be cast into hell, censured and banished.
Has your God given you males while He took females of the angels? Abominable indeed, are your words!
And certainly in this Quran We have given clear explanations for them to understand; yet, it increased not in them but aversion.
Say: if there were other deities with Him, as they say, surely they would have sought to the owner of the Throne, a way.
He is Most Pure; and He is Most High above what they forge against Him.
Those in the seven heavens and in the earth glorify His praise; and there is not a thing that does not glorify His Purity; yet you will not know their glorifying. Verily He is Forbearing, Forgiving.
And if you recite the Quran, We draw a veil invisible441 between you and those who disbelieve in the life to come.
And We have put coverings upon their hearts so that they shall not understand it; and cause deafness in their ears; and when you mention your God alone in Quran, they turn their backs in aversion.
We know well their intention when they hear you speak, and that they say to themselves, their mischiefs in their private conversation that 'you only follow a man bewitched'.
See442 what similes they strike for you! so they had gone astray; and they will not be able for the straight path.
And they say, "Will we be really raised up as a new creation after we are bones and dust?"
Say: "Become rock or iron!"

"Or what you have in your hearts as the biggest creation; they will say, 'who shall raise us?' say, "It is Him, who created you in the first place." Then they slant their heads to you and say, "When is it?" Say, "Perhaps very soon!"
On the day of resurrection, ye will glorify His Praises and ye will think ye tarried but a short while.
And say to my servants they say only livelier443 things; certainly shaitan will provoke strife between them; indeed shaitan is a manifest foe to man.
Your God best knows you; if He so will, He would show you mercy, or if He so will, He would punish you. And We have not sent you to be a guardian444 over them.
And your God is well knowing of whoever is in the heavens and in the earth; and verily We had placed some prophets in degrees higher over some others. And We gave 'Zabur' to Dawood.
Say: "try calling those whom you think other than Him; they have no powers to relieve you from distress or turn them away.
Those whom they call- them, even the nearest are keeping up doing good things for Allah, expecting His Mercy and fearing His punishment. Surely the punishment of your God is ever to be feared.
And it is not that We destroy not any town or torment them with a severe punishment, before the Final Hour. It is in the Book, inscribed.

And naught prevented Us from sending the Signs except the elders who belied them. And We gave the people of Samud, a she-camel as a visible sign; but they did her wrong. And We shall not send Signs but as warning signals.

And when We said: your God certainly encompasses men and We made not the vision We showed you and the cursed timber mentioned in Quran except as a trial unto the human kind; and We warn them. But this aggravated them not except in their aggression, great.
And when We said to the angels, "Obey Adam!", except Iblis, obeyed. He said, "Do I have to obey him who You have created from clay?"
Said he, "Did You see him whom You have dignified over me? If you defer my end till the end I will certainly lead astray his descendants, except a few."
Said He, "Get away! If there are among them who would follow you - surely hell will be your recompense, an ample recompense."

"And beguile them whom you can by your noise; and assault them with your steed-warriors and soldiers; and become companions in their wealth and in their children; and give them promises. Lo! shaitan promises them nothing but deceit."
Indeed you have no power at all against my servants; and your God suffices as Protector.
Your God sails the ship on the sea that you may seek His bounties; surely He is Most Compassionate towards you.
And in the sea when a calamity touches you, all those you were calling upon besides Him will vanish; but when He saves and brings you to the shore, you turn away - and man is ever ingrate.
Then are you fearless that He will not bury you in a part of the land, or He will not rain stones upon you? Then you will not find a protector.
Or, are you fearless that you shall not be taken back to the sea and that He sends fierce tempest on you and drowns you for your rejection? Then, for you against Us, you will not find a helper.
And We certainly honoured the descendants of Adam; and We carried them in the land and in the sea; and gave them from the good provisions and exalted them above all My creations.
The Day when We call forth every people with their leaders - to whoever his record was given in his right hand, they will read their records; and they will not be dealt with a whit unjustly.
And whoso is blind here, then he shall be blind in the hereafter and is far astray from the right path.
And they tried hard to turn you away from what We inspired to you, that you might forge against Us another; and then they would have surely taken you as a friend.
And had We not strengthened you, you would have somewhat inclined to them.
Then, We would have made you taste double in the life and double in the death; then you will not find for you a helper against Us.445
And indeed they were near to startling you that you should emigrate; lo! they shall not survive but for a while after you.
Surely, this has been the practise concerning Our messengers We had sent before you; and in Our way, you shall not see a change.446
Stand firm in the remembrance of Allah from the setting of the sun to the darkness of the night and The Quran, at waking up - surely, the awakening is witness to Quran.447
And glorify God for the Wish you possess, in part of night. May your God raise you to the Sanctum, glorified.
And say, "My God, make me enter with dignity and exit with dignity; and help me by the grant of Your Wisdom."
And say, "The Truth has come; and the falsehood has perished. Surely the falsehood shall perish."
And We have revealed in Quran that which is goodly availing for the believers. But to the rejecters, it has not increased but loss.
And when We bless man with pleasantness, he turns away and distances himself; and when an adversity befalls him, he despairs.
Say: each follows his way; and only your God knows who is righteous.
And they ask you concerning Ruh. Say the Ruh is by the command of my God; and not but a portion of the wisdom is bestowed upon you.
And if We wish We would surely remove the inspiration We have revealed to you; then you will not find an advocate against Us.
But for the Mercy of your God; surely His Mercy is immense upon you.
Say, "It is impossible to bring the like of this Quran even if mankind and the jinn gathered together, and some helping some other, to bring the like of it."
Surely in this Quran, We have explained to man the examples from everything; yet most men refuse all but disbelief.
And they say, "We are not to believe you until you cause a spring to gush forth from the earth for us.
"Or you shall possess a garden of date-palms and grapes and make rivers gush through them all.
"Or until you break the skies into pieces and you cause it to fall on us; or you bring Allah and the angels directly before us.

"Or you have a mansion of gold; or you shall climb up the sky and unless you bring for us a book to read, we shall not believe even your climbing up." Say, "Most Pure is my God; am I anything but a man, - a messenger?"
And when the Guidance came to mankind, nothing made them disbelieve except that they said, 'Is it a man that Allah has sent as messenger?'
Say, "If angels themselves were living peacefully on the earth, surely We would have sent down an angel as a messenger, from the sky."
Say, "Allah suffices as a witness between you and me; surely He is ever a Seer, Knower of His slaves."

And whoever Allah conducts, he is guided; and whoever He leaves astray, you will not find a helper for them except Him; and We will gather them on the last day, dragging them upon their faces as blind, deaf and dumb; their shelter is hell; whenever it abates We increase the flame for them.
Their recompense is that for what they said belying Our Signs: 'wilt we be raised again after we are reduced to bones and dust, as a new creation?'

Do they not understand Allah is surely Able to create them anew when He could create the heavens and the earth? And He has fixed for them a period determined about which there is no doubt; yet, the wrong doers refuse anything save disbelief.
Say, "Even if you possess the abundance from my God, you will restrict them lest it would be spent - and man is ever stingy.
And indeed, We gave Musa nine clear Signs - and enquire the descendants of Israel when he came to them: then Firaun said to him, "Musa! I certainly deem thee, one bewitched."
He said, "You know well these were not sent down except by God, who created the heavens and the earth as Signs. Firaun! certainly I feel you are bound to be destroyed!"
So he decided to drive them away from the land; but We drowned him and all those who were with him.
And We said after him, to the descendants of Israel, "Dwell in that nation! And when the promise of the Hour arrives We will gather you a rabble."448
And We sent it down with the Truth and with the Truth has it descended; and We have not sent you but as a harbinger of Truth and as a warner.
And in order that you shall reveal this Quran gradually to the people, We divided it; and We sent it down progressively.
Say: "Believe it or reject it; indeed if it is recited to them who were endowed with wisdom before, will fall on their faces in complete surrender."
And they will say, "Exalted is our God and indeed the promise of our God is fulfilled!"
And they will upon their faces in tears; and it will increase them in humility.

Call Him, "Allah or The Most Beneficent!" Whichsoever ye may cry to Him with, there are Beautiful Attributes for Him. And cry not to Him ebulliently, nor call on Him in despair; but seek a mid course.449
And say, "All Praise be to Allah!" He has no descendants, nor has associate in His Kingdom, nor has weaknesses nor in need of a helper; and magnify Him with all magnificence.
Praise be unto Allah, Who has sent down The Book without a flaw upon His servant.
Determined - to warn of a severe retribution from Him; and to give glad tidings of a beautiful reward to the believing good doers.
Abide therein forever-
And to warn them who say, "Allah has a son!"
To them or to their fathers: they have no knowledge about it; very sinful are the words that come out of their mouths; they say nothing but lies.
If they belie this 'Hadith - the Truth', it may be that you would destroy yourself in grief!
To ascertain who among them are the best in deed, We certainly made everything in the earth most decorative to it.
Again, We certainly would make it a soil, barren.
Or have you wondered at Our Signs thinking of the companions in that cave and of the covenant?
When the youngsters took to the cave for shelter, said: "Our God! Bestow on us Thy Benevolence and set our affairs aright for us!"
So We rested their ears in the cave for many a numbered year.
Then We raised them up that We make evident which of the two parties knew best the period of their stay.
We narrate their history to you in truth; they were indeed youths and believed in their God - and We increased them in Guidance.
And We made their hearts firm when they mounted and said, "Our God is the God of the heavens and the earth and we will never call as God other than He - if so then we had spoken an enormity."
"These, our people, had taken gods besides Him; should they not bring clear proofs over them? Who is worse sinner than he, who invents against Allah a lie?"
"And secure ye, in the cave forsaking them and their deities which are not Allah; your God will provide you from His Benevolence and will make cosy your affairs for you."

And you would have seen when the sun rose, it450 inclines away towards the right from their cave; and when it sets, it moves past on their left. And they were in a vast space therein. This is of the Signs of Allah. Whoever Allah guides, is guided; and whoso He leaves astray, there is not a helper nor a guide, never for him.

And you would think them to be wide awake though they were asleep; and We turn them on to the right and to the left and their dog has stretched out its paws on the threshold; if you see them close, you would have withdrawn in flight and fright and been filled with terror of them.

And thus We raised them up that they might ask of each other. One of them said, "How long have you been here?" They said, "We stayed for a day, or a part of a day." Then were told: "Your God alone knows how long had you tarried; so send one of you into the city, with this silver coin; let him carefully look for the purest food and bring a supply thereof; and may he be careful that he shall not reveal about you to anyone.
For if they knew you, they will stone you or turn you back to their cult; and never would you succeed then, ever.

And to make them know that Allah's words are verily truthful and certainly there is no doubt about the Hereafter, - We revealed thus, about them. When they said, "Who were they?" Said they, "Construct a memorial over them! Their God knows them best." In this, whosoever's argument prevailed, said: "Surely we shall raise a Mosque over them."

They say: 'three - the fourth is their dog'; 'five - and the sixth is their dog'- guessing at random. And again they say: 'seven - and the eighth is their dog' - say, "My God, alone knows their number; but for a few no one shall know them." So enter not into dispute about them except that which is known to the world. And seek not opinion concerning them from anyone.
And say not about anything, "I indeed will do that tomorrow!"451
"Except if Allah wishes!" If you forget, then remember your God and say, 'My God will Guide me to the Way easier than this!"
And they tarried in the cave nine added to three hundred years.452

Say: Allah knows best about their tarrying; it is unto Him what is unseen in the heavens and in the earth - He is the Seeing, Hearing. And there is no one to help them but He; and makes not a partner with Him in His Sovereignty.
And recite that which is inspired to you from your God, of the Book; there is none to change His word and you shall not find refuge besides Him.

And observe patience with those seeking their God's pleasure, remembering Him morning and evening; and turn not away your attention from them towards the worldly attractions - and take not to his ways whose hearts We had turned away from remembering Us; for his works had transgressed because he was desirous.

And say, "The Truth from your God - let whoso wish, believe it; let whoso wish reject it." surely We have prepared fire for the unjust; fire will surround them; and if they seek help they will be given to drink as of molten brass; it will char the faces - what an evil drink and a wretched resting.
Certainly We shall not waste the reward of those who indeed believe and do good deeds.

For them is the paradise, the eternal dwelling beneath which rivers flow; therein they will be adorned with golden ornaments; and their attires will be of golden-green silky 'Sunthus and Isthabrak'; them, reclining upon elevated thrones - glorious is their reward and beauteous is the resting place.453
And say to them the examples of two men: To one of them We gave them two gardens of grape vines; and surrounded them with date palms; and between the two We set cultivation.
Both the gardens were yielding their fruits, restricting not anything of it; and We caused gushing forth of water spring amidst them.
And he had fruits - but he proudly picked up arguments with his friend, said: "I am more in wealth than you; and stronger in respect of men."
And he entered his garden wronging himself - he said, "I do not think, this would ever perish."
"And, I do not think the Hour will ever come; and if I were to be returned to my God, I would indeed find a better place than this."
His friend said to him, "Do you disbelieve in Him, Who created you from mud and from a drop and then Who perfected you as a man?"
But Allah, He is my God; and I will not associate any one to my God.
"And when you entered your garden, though ye might see me lesser than you in wealth and people, should you not have said, 'By Allah's will, all powers are not but with Allah?'"
"It may be that my God should give me a better garden than yours and that He should send thunderbolt from the sky and make it a slope of dust."
"Or, it may be that its water had totally been sucked in so as to not to be found again."

And his produces were destroyed; then he began to wring his hands for all that he had spent upon it for they had fallen down upon their roots - he said, "Would that I had not associated partners to my God!"
And he had not a people to help him besides Allah; and was helpless.
To help him there is with Allah, the True. He is the best in the reward and the best in the decision.

And set forth to them the similitude of the life of this world as the water We send down from the sky; the vegetations of the earth mingles with it; then they become dry  stubble and the winds scatter them; and Allah has power over all things.
Wealth and children are enticements of this world; but the everlasting good deeds are better with your God for reward and for hope.
And one day We will destroy the mountains and you will see the land levelled plain; and We will gather them, leaving not a single soul behind them.
And they will be brought before your God in ranks: 'as We created you for the first time, you have returned to Us now; but you were thinking We shall not bring this promised day for you';-

And the Book will be placed; and you will see the guilty fear struck at what they see therein. And they will say, "Woe! What is this record? Small or big nothing is left in it without a detail"; and they will see all they did, placed before them. Yet your God shall not wrong anyone.

And when We said to the angels, "Obey Adam!" Except Iblis, all obeyed; he was of the Jinn; he rebelled against the command of his God. So will you take then he and his descendants besides Me as protectors? But then they are your enemies; wretched is the exchange, for the arrogant.
I have not made them witnesses to the creation of the heavens and the earth nor to their own creation; nor had I taken the misleaders as helpers.
And the day when he would say, 'call them those whom you claimed equal to Me'. They will call them; but they would not answer them and We will make between them a barrier.
And the criminals will see the fire and will know they are to fall into it; and they will not find a way of escape.
And We have indeed turned about for men in this Quran every kind of similitude; but man is in all things most disputatious.

And when the Guidance comes, nothing prevents man from accepting it and seeking forgiveness from their God except that what came upon those before, shall come to them; or that their torment shall come face to face with them.

And who is more unjust than he who slights aside them, after his God's clear admonition and forgets what his two hands have wrought? Certainly We have veiled their hearts from perceiving this and have caused deafness in their ears; therefore, if you call them to the right path, they will not be guided to it- ever.
And your God is Relenting, Merciful. If He were to catch them for what they earn, He would have hastened their agony; but they have a tryst - they will find no escape other than it.
And We destroyed the people of the city while they were unjust for We have given a tryst, for their destruction.
And when Musa said to his servant, "I will not stop until I reach the point where the two seas meet, though I go on for years."454
But when they reached the meeting point, they forgot their fish; it took its way into the sea as in a tunnel.455
So, when they crossed that place, he said to his page, "Bring us our breakfast; we surely have fatigued in this, our journey."
He said, "Did you notice, while we were on the rock? Certainly I have forgotten the fish; none but shaitan made me forget, saying about it; further, it made its way into the sea by a marvel."
He said, "That is what we were looking for!" and followed back on their footsteps.
They saw one of our servants - to him, We had granted favours from Us and We had taught him Wisdom from Us.456
Musa said to him, "May I follow you so that you would teach me of the right path, you were taught?"
He said, "Certainly you will not be able to bear with me."
And, "How can you bear with that about which you have no knowledge?"457
He said, "If Allah wills - you will see me bearing with you; and not gainsaying in aught!"
He said, "If you are to follow me, you shall not ask me about anything till I myself narrate it to you."458
Then they proceeded, till they took a boat; he made a hole in it. He said, "Did you put a hole in it to drown the passengers in it? Surely you had done an evil act?"
He said, "Did I not tell, surely you will not be able to bear with me?"
He said, "Do not take me to task for what I forgot and make not my affair difficult for me."
Then they went on until both met a lad whom he killed. He said, "Would you kill a pure soul for other than a soul? You have indeed done a grave thing!"
He said, "Did I not say to you, you cannot bear with me?"
He said, "After this if I ask you of anything, then keep me not as companion. Surely you have received from me due excuse."

Then they proceeded on their journey and came to the people of a village; they asked food from its people, but they refused to give them food; thereat, they found a wall about to collapse, and he set it erect. He said, "Oh, had you wished, you could have demanded a wage from them."459
He said, "This is parting between you and me; and I will explain to you concerning things you were not able to tolerate."
"The boat - it belonged to certain poor people working at sea; I purposed to make it look damaged for, behind them was a king who forcibly takes away the boats."
"And the lad - his parents are believers and we feared that he would impose on them insolence and disbelief."
"So we wished that their God shall bless them with one better than him in purity and nearer to Mercy."

"And the wall - it belongs to two orphans of that town beneath which is a treasure belonging to them; and their father was a good man; your God wished that when they come of age, they should bring forth the treasure as a mercy from your God. I did these not of my own bidding; - this is the interpretation of what you were not able to endure with me."
And they ask you of Zulqarnain. Say: I will narrate to you a small part about him.
Verily We gave him comfort on this earth; and We gave him the way to anything.
And he proceeded on a way.

When he travelled until sunset, he found 'it' disappearing in a pool of muddy water and found a people thereabout. We said, "O Zulqarnain! you may either punish them or show the way beautiful for them."460
He said, "Whoever does wrong we will punish them; then he will be brought forth to his God and He will punish him with a severe punishment."
But whoever believes and does good, to him is the beautiful reward; and We will bid him the lightest of Our command.
Then he proceeded on a way.
Until he reached a place at dawn and he saw it shining upon a people; we have not made a shade between them and the sun.
Thus it was! And We had full knowledge of all that he had.461
Then he proceeded on a way.
When he reached between two mountains, he found upon their hither side a folk, who could not understand a thing.
They said, "O Zulqarnain, surely Yajuj and Majuj cause disquiet on the land; so, shall we offer you a wage so that you could build a shield between us and them?"
He said, "What my God has endowed me with is much greater; so help me with your might and I will build a shield between you and them."
Bring me ingots of iron! And when it is piled up between the two cliffs, he said, "Blow!" When it became fire, he said, "Bring me molten brass, that I will pour over it."
So they were not able to climb it up or unable to punch holes through it.
He said, "This is nothing but a mercy from my God; but when my God's word come to pass, He would blow even this to dusts. And my God's word is true."
And on that day, We will let some of them surge against others; then Our word will be blown whereupon We will gather them as one.
And on that day We will spread the hell before the disbelievers.
They upon whose eyes were the veils against remembering Me; and were disabled to hear.
Do the disbelievers think they could take My servants as their protector beside Me? Verily, We have prepared hell as lodging for the disbelievers.
Say, "Shall I inform you who will be the greatest losers by their deeds?"
It is they who think they are doing great works here while their efforts are hopeless in this life.
They reject their God's Signs and their meeting Him; all their deeds have become null and they will have no dignity in the future.
That is their reward - hell, for they rejected My Signs and took My messengers in mockery.
Verily, the paradise of Firdhose will be the abode for those who believed and stayed righteous.
They will abide therein forever and wish not any other abode.
Say: "If the sea were ink for the words of my God, the sea would be spent before the words of my God are spent; and even if you bring the like thereof to help."
Say: "Verily I am a human like you; I have been inspired that your God is One - so whoso of you hopes to meet his God, let him stay righteous and associate no partners in the worship of his God."
Kaf, Ha, Yae, Ain, Saad - K, H, Y, A, S.462
This is the Wisdom favoured upon His servant Zachariah, by your God.
When he called upon his God in a subdued voice;
He said, "My God, surely, my bones have worn out and my hairs have become grey; my God! never was I deprived of your grace in anything I called on You."
"And I certainly fear about my relatives after me; and my wife is sterile; so grant me an heir from You."
"And he will be a heir to me and a heir to the descendants of Yaqub; and my God, make him well acceptable." 463
"O Zachariah! surely We give you a good tiding of a son named Yahya. We have not given anyone this name before."
He said, "O my God, how shall I have a son when my wife is sterile and when I have become fragilely old."
He said: Thus said your God! "It is easy to Me; before when you were of nothing I created you!"
He said, "O my God, give me a Sign!" He said, "Your Sign is that you shall not be able to speak to people for three nights while you are healthy."
So he came out to his people from the room; then he signalled to them to praise the purity of God, morning and evening.
"O Yahya, hold fast the Book!" and We gave him the Wisdom, even as a child.
And from Us he possessed mercy and purity; and he was fearing of Allah.
And he was good to his parents; not boastful, neither rebellious.
So, 'Peace' shall be upon him the day he is born, the day he dies and the day he is raised again, alive.464
And remember in this scripture about Maryam. When she secluded herself from her people, to the east-;465
She took a veil apart from them - then We sent to her Our Ruh who presented himself before her as a perfect man.
She said, "Surely I seek refuge in the Most Abundant, from you - if you fear God;-
He said, "Verily I am but a messenger from your God to give you tiding of a pure son."
She said, "How can I have a child when no man had ever touched me and while I am not unchaste?"
He said, Your God says,"Thus!", "Easy is this for me; and We will make him a Sign for the mankind and as a blessing from Us; and this is an event decreed."
Then she conceived him and she withdrew with him, to a distant place.
Then she drew herself near to a date-palm as she felt the feeling of delivery. She said, "Would that I were dead, long forgotten!"
From beneath her, he said, "Worry not; verily your God has created a rivulet below you."
And draw near the branch of this date palm and shake it; it will drop ripe fruits upon you.
So eat and drink and have solace; and if you happen to see any one, say to them: I have vowed to fast to the Most Bountiful and that I am shall not talk to anyone this day.
Then she came with the child to her folks. They said, "O Maryam, surely you have brought a thing of wonder."
"O sister of Harun, your father was not astray and your mother was not unchaste!"
She signalled them to the child. They said, "How can we speak to a child in the cradle?"
He said, "Verily I am a servant of Allah; He has given me the Wisdom and has made me a Prophet."
"And He has made me blessed wheresoever I am; and has enjoined upon me that all my life I shall surrender my will to God and extend for purity."
"And to extend gratitude to my mother - and He has not made me an arrogant evil."
"Upon me be 'Peace': the day I was born, the day I will die and the day I am resurrected."
He is the son of Maryam, Esa, the word of truth about which they suspect.
It is needless that Allah should take a son unto Him; He is Most Pure. And when He intends a thing, He says to it, "Be!" and it is!466
