And surely Allah is my God and your God; so call unto Him and it is the path straight.
Yet, the people among them differed; so woe to those who were denying the scene of the awful day.
How clear will they see and hear on the day they come to Us! Yet, the unjust today are in clear error.
Surely We will inherit the world and those upon it and their return is unto Us.468
And remember Ibrahim in the Revelation. Indeed he was truthful and a Prophet.469
When he said to his father, "My father! why do you call upon that which neither hear, nor see and nor avail you aught?"
"My father, indeed has come to me the Wisdom that which has not come to you; so follow me and I will guide you to the right path."
"My father, worship not shaitan; shaitan indeed is disobedient to the Most Beneficent."
"My father, I fear some torment from the Most Beneficent will smite thee indeed, so that you become a companion of shaitan."
He said, "Are you rejecting my deities? Ibrahim, if you do not stay clear, surely I will stone you; so be off, forever away."
He said, "May peace be upon you; and I will seek forgiveness for you from my God; surely He is ever gracious to me."
And, "I withdraw from you and that which you worship besides Allah; I will seek from my God, haply I am not unblest from whatever I had asked of my God."
So when he stayed away from them and those they worshipped besides Allah, We gifted him Ishaq and Yaqub and We made them each, prophet.
And We gifted them from Our Mercy and We assigned to them a honour and true renown.
And remember also Musa in the Revelation. Surely he was devoted; and was a messenger, a prophet.
And We called out to the 'righteous from the Thur!' And We drew him nigh in communion.470
And We gifted him from Our grace his brother Harun, as a prophet.
And remember Ismail in the Revelation. Indeed he was truthful to his word; and he was a messenger, a prophet.
And he enjoined upon his folks that they shall obey the Will of God and spend of the pure things; and he was most agreeable to his God.
And remember Idris in the Revelation. He was indeed truthful and a prophet.
And We raised him to a high.

They are the prophets of the descendants of Adam, of those whom We embarked upon with Nuh, of Ibrahim, of the descendants of Israel and of those whom We had chosen and guided in righteousness - upon them Allah showered His blessings; when the Signs of the Most Beneficent are exemplified to them, they would fall prostrate with tears.
And after them their descendants took hold of their offices; they made the worship a ritual and practised their desires in it. So soon they will meet evil.471
Except those who repent and believe and stay aright will enter the heaven; they will not be lessened in aught.
And the Most Beneficent promised the heavens of 'ADHNU' to His bondsmen even as they could not perceive them; surely His promise will happen.
They would not hear anything unworthy except 'Peace' therein; and in the mornings and in the evenings they will have their needs in full.
We will make the God fearing of our servants inherit such paradise.
And we will never descend without the command of your God; to Him is what is before us, what is after us and what is between that - and your God is not forgetful.
God! to the heavens and to the earth and to all that are in between; so call on Him alone and seek patience from Him, serving Him. Do you find one equal to Him?
And man says: "What! if I die, wilt it be that I wilt be raised up alive?"
"Should not man think, We created him before, when he was naught?"
So, by your God, We will surely gather them and the shaitans; then We will present them around the hell on their knees.
Then verily, We will separate from every sect all of those who were insolent against the Most Beneficent.472
Then verily We know the leader who befits burned therein, first.473
And none of you, there is, but he shall pass over it; this is your God's decree.474
But We will deliver whosoever were God fearing, leaving the wrong doers therein, on their knees.
And when Our signs are espoused to them, the rejecters amidst the believers say, "Whose living standards are better and whose assembly is fairer of the two of us?"
But how many a generation more powerful with beautiful presentations have We destroyed before them?

Say, "The Most Benevolent surely has prolonged the life-span for those who are astray, until they shall see their promised fate or the Hereafter; and they shall know whose house is the most evil? Whose might is the weakest?"
And those who are aright, Allah increases them in guidance; and with your God the best reward and the best abiding is for the lasting good deeds.
Did you see him who rejecting Our Signs says, "I shall indeed be given wealth and people"?
Has he penetrated to the unseen? Or has he a pact with the Most Benevolent?
Nay! We shall record his say and We shall add and add to his torment.
And We shall record all his talks; and he shall come to Us singly.
They had taken to them gods other than Allah that they might be for them a might.
Nay. They would deny their worshiping them and become opponents unto them.
Do you not see that We have sent shaitans to ever induce the disbelievers?
So hasten not for them; We count for them a count.
On the day, when We assemble all the God fearing to Us, the Most Benevolent;
And will drive the perpetrators toward the hell, thirsty.
No one shall have the authority to intercede except those who were in pact with the Most Benevolent.475
And they say, "The Benevolent has taken a son unto Him."476
Surely you have brought forth something hideous.
At it, the heavens are well nigh to the rent of it, the earth to cleave asunder and the mountains are near to crashing to dusts.477
That they attribute a son unto the Most Benevolent;
And it is not worthy for The Benevolent that He should have a son.
None is there in the heavens and earth but he comes as a slave to the Benevolent.
Verily He encompasses them all and has counts of them in exactness.
And on the Hour they would come to Him, alone.
Indeed, the Benevolent will cause affection for those who were believers and righteous.
So We have made easy this, in your language that therewith you may give glad tidings to the God fearing and to therewith warn those who dispute it.
And how many a generation have We destroyed before them! Do you see any one of them? Or do you hear even a whisper of them?
Tha Ha478
We have not sent down this Quran upon you for you to suffer difficulty.
But a reminder to those who fear.
It has been sent down from the Creator of the earth and the high heavens.
The Most Benevolent, established Himself upon the Throne.
To Him what is in the heavens, what is on the earth, what is in between and what is in the depth of the earth.
And if you cry aloud! Surely He knows the secrets and the Unseen.
Allah! There is none to call upon but He and to Him are the most beautiful Names.
And did you receive the 'Hadith' of Musa?479
He saw a light and said to his family, "Stay here; surely I saw a light - either there may be a brand for you or find some guidance at the fire."480
And when he came to it, he was called: O Musa!
"Surely I am your God; put off your shoes; indeed you are upon the blessed valley, 'Thuwa'."
"Surely I am Allah; there is no God but Me. So call upon Me and stay constant in My remembrance."
"Verily the Hour of recompense is to arrive to each for their deeds; yet I wish to keep it secret."
"Let not one who believes it not but follows his desires deviate you away from it, lest thou perish!"
"Musa, what is in your right hand?"
He said, "This is my staff; I lean upon it; I tug down leaves for my sheep and there are certain benefits to me from it."
Said He, "Musa, cast it down!"
As he cast it down, thereupon it became a serpent, gliding.
Said He, "Catch it and fear not; We shall revert it."
And push your hand to your side; it will come out white without blemish. This is another Sign!"
"We show you of the Grand Signs of Us!"
"Go to Firaun; surely he has  transgressed!"
He said, "O my God, relax my heart for me;"
"And make my affairs smooth for me;"
"And free my tongue of its knot;"
"That they may listen to my words."
"And give me a helping soul from my family."
"My brother, Harun!"
"Strengthen my back by him."
"And make him my deputy."
"That we may purify Your glory more!"
"And remember You often!"
"Surely You are ever aware of us!"
He said, "O Musa! verily you were granted your request;
"And indeed We had bestowed blessing upon you before;
"Remember when We revealed to your mother through inspiration;

"Put him in a chest and leave him in the river; the river will bring it to the bank; and there, the enemy of Me and the enemy of him will receive him; and I showered My love upon you that you shall bloom under My eyes."

"Your sister came and said, 'Shall I show you one who may care take for him?' Thus, We returned you to your mother that her eyes are cooled and shall be free from sorrow. Then you killed a man; and then too We delivered you from the gravity of it; then We tested you with trials and thereafter you stayed with 'Madyans' many years. Then, O Musa, you reached formation.
And, "I have formed you to serve Me."
"So you and your brother go forth with My Signs! And tire not in My remembrance!"481
"You both go to Firaun; surely he has waxed insolence!"
"Speak with him gently perchance he may heed or fear."
They said, "Our God, indeed we fear he shall hasten against or aggress on us."
He said, "Fear ye not; surely I am with you twain listening to and seeing."

"So go to him" and say, "Surely we both are your God's messengers; so send the people of Israel with us and aggrieve them not; surely we had brought from your God a Sign unto you; and whosever follows righteousness, upon them shall be Peace."
It has been revealed to us that surely there will be torment to those who cry lies and turns away.
Said, "Musa! who is the God of you?"
He said, "Our God is He who fashioned each creation into perfect form and function."
Said, "If it is so what about the generations who have gone before?"
He said, "The fate of such is with my God; my God neither falters nor forgets."
He spread out the earth for you; and made the ways therein easy for you; and sent down waters from the sky and therewith We produce forth pairs of divers kinds of vegetations.
Eat and pasture your cattle; surely therein are the Signs for the knowledgeable.
Thereof We created you, and We shall return you into it, and We will bring you forth form it a second time.
And We verily did show him all Our Signs; but he belied and refused.
He said, "O Musa, have you come here with your magic to drive us out of our land?"
"If so, we too will surely show magic, the like of it. So commit upon a day and fix a place mutually agreeable that neither we nor you shall fail it."
He said, "The Ceremonial Day! - let it be the day for you and the morning when all the people gather together."
Thus: Firaun went and returned gathering his guile.
Musa said to them, "Woe to you, forge not against Allah a lie; He will exterminate you by His torment; and whoever lies, is destroyed."
Then, they discussed among them and kept their devising a secret.
They said, "Certainly, these two are magicians; they both, through their magics wish to drive you from your land and to do away with your traditional rituals."
So all of you plan your decisions jointly and come in ranks; this day whoever overcomes will surely be the victor.
They said, "O Musa, do you cast, or shall we be the first to cast?"
He said, "Nay; thou cast first! it seemed to him that their ropes and staffs as real things by their magic, gliding and moving."
Then Musa conceived a fear within him,-
We said, "Fear not, surely you will overcome."
And, "Cast that you have in your right hand; it will swallow up all they did; what they did was the devising of a sorcerer; and the sorcerer succeed not wherever he goes."
Defeated facedown, the sorcerers said, "We believe in the God of Harun and Musa."

He said, "Have you believed in him before I permit you? He indeed is your leader who taught you magic; so, surely I will cut off your alternate hands and legs and have you crucified on the trunks of palm-trees; and shall ye know for certain, which of us are more severe in punishing and who shall last therein."
They said, "We will not take you above the clear proofs that has come to us and He who has created us; so pronounce what you are to announce and all that you pronounce is only in this world."
"Our wrong doings, and for having been forced into sorcery; - we certainly believe only in our God for our forgiveness; and Allah is Most High and Ever Preserving."
Indeed whoever comes before his God as unjust, to him is hell for sure wherein he shall neither die nor live.
And whoever comes before him as believers and righteous - indeed for them are ranks, sublime.
For them are the preserving paradises beneath which rivers flow; they would abide therein forever; and this is the reward for the pure.
And We thus inspired Musa: "Set forth with my servants by night and strike for them a dry path in the sea; and apprehend not, 'he would seize you! And fear not.'
And Firaun followed them with his might, but the sea overwhelmed them.
And Firaun led astray his society and he showed not the straight path.
O the descendants of Israel, We indeed delivered you from your enemy; and We promised all righteous benefits of the Thur. And We sent down upon you the pure foods from above and from below@482.
And eat of the pure foods that We have provided you; cause not mischief @483; upon you shall descend My anger. And upon whoso My anger descends, indeed he shall be destroyed.
And whoever repents and strives in righteousness, believing; and takes to guidance, - indeed to him I am Oft-Returning.
And, "O Musa, what hastened you leaving your people?"
He said, "They are upon my footsteps! And my God, I hastened to You that You may be satisfied with me."
He said, "Then We tested your people firmly; but 'Samiriyu' had misled them."

So Musa returned to his people, deeply disturbed and angered. He said, "O my people! Did not your God give you a beautiful promise? And has the promised been increased upon you? Or did you wrong me against your promise so that the wrath of your God should descend upon you?"
They said, "We did not within our powers do a wrong to the covenant we made with you; but we were loaded with a burden from our adornments; then, we threw it; Samiriyu did throw too."
Then he brought out for them, an idol of the calf which 'lowed'; Some said, "This is your God and the God of Musa, but he had forgotten."
Did they not see it does not answer them and has no power either to do good or evil to them?
Before, verily Harun said to them, "O my people, surely you are put to test by this; and verily your God is the Most Benevolent; so follow me and obey my command."
They said, "We will not stop worshiping this until Musa returns to us."
He said, "O Harun! what prevented you when you saw them going astray!"
"From following after me? Did you disobey my command?
He said, "O son of my mother! clutch not my beard nor my head." I feared lest you should say, 'you caused division among the people of Israel or you did not wait for my word.'
He said, "What have you to say, Samiriyu?"
He said, "I saw what they saw not in it. So I took a handful from the footstep of that messenger and threw it. Thus my mind made it fair seeming to me."

He said, "Get ye gone! surely what befits you in this world is to go about saying, 'I'm untouchable!' And you will have your appointment, promised and you shall not escape it. And see your God which you insolently worshiped! Surely we will burn it to dust and scatter it into the sea."
Your God is One, Allah. There is no God other than He. He embraces everything in His knowledge.
Thus do we narrate the histories of those who have gone before you; and We have certainly given you from Us, that you can reminisce.
Whoever rejects it certainly shall bear the burden on the Hour484.
Abide therein; and on the Hour of Destiny, what they shall bear is an evil burden.
On the Day of Final Call, the guilty will be gathered by Us, blue in their eyes.
They will say amongst them: You stayed not beyond ten.
We know well the righteous among them saying: You stayed not but a day.
And they ask you about the mountains. Say: My God will burst them into scattered dusts.
And make it, an empty plain.
You will not see a hill or a hollow.
On that Day, they will follow the caller; no hesitation in it; and all the sounds will subdue before the Benevolent; and you shall hear naught but the footsteps.
That Day, none else's prayer will avail but for him to whom the Benevolent had given leave and whose words He approves.
He is cognisant of what is before them and what is after them; but they comprehend it not in knowledge.
And before the Giver of Life and the Eternal, all their faces will hang down; so he who bears sins, is the loser of all good.
And he who believes and stay righteous shall not fear that he will be wronged nor his reward will be curtailed.
And thus We had sent down the Quran, in Arabic, so that they would fear God; and that they may give thought to the hadiths; We had detailed in it as warning.

So the True King, Allah is the Most High. And hasten not to expound Quran before it is revealed to you and completed on you by your God through inspiration. And seek, "O my God, increase me in Wisdom."485
And before We surely took covenant from Adam; but he forgot; and We did not find steadfastness in him.486
And when We said to the inhabitants of the skies, "Obey Adam!" All obeyed except Iblis; he refused.487
Then We said, "O Adam! Surely he is enemy to you and your wife; so do not allow him to cause you to oust you out of the paradise; if so you should suffer."
"Surely you shall not be hungry nor suffer adversity;
But shaitan caused him to differ when he said, "O Adam! shall I show you the way for the eternal life and Kingdom?"489
Then they fell for the evil and tasted them all; both their shame became evident and they covered them with the leaves of the paradise. Thus Adam, the man forgot his God and lost the way.
Then His God chose him, pardoned and guided.

Said He, "Descend all together henceforth, some of you disputing some others; then from Me guidance shall come to you; whoever follows My guidance will not go astray; neither will he lose his rank."490
And whoever turns away from My remembrance - he indeed will find his life in straits. And on the day of resurrection, We will raise him blind.
He will say, "My God! I was able to see; why have You raised me in the darkness?
He would say, "Our Signs came to you but you forgot; thus, this day you are forgotten."491
And thus We would reward those who reject and aggress against the words of his God; and the torment thenceforth will be severe and lasting.
Has not the generations We have destroyed before them, guided them aright? And they travel upon where they dwelled. Surely in it are the Signs to those who give a thought.
And it would have come to pass but for a word from your God had gone before and of a period.
So bear with them; praise your God's purity before the rising of the sun and before its setting and in the hours of the night; and glorify Him at the ends of the day that you shall be gratified.

And stretch not your eyes toward certain people whom We had allowed to taste the pleasure, a beautification We had made as only a trial for them in it; and what your God has in store is lasting excellence.
Enthuse your folks to surrender to the Will of God; and bear with it and forbear; We are not to seek a thing of you - We give you your needs; and in the end the best position is to he who fears God.
And they say, "Why has he not brought a Sign to us from his God?" Have not clear Signs of God's words come to them before?492

But, had We punished them and destroyed them before the signs came to them, they should say, "O God, would that You had sent us a messenger, we would have followed Your warnings before we are disgraced and despised."
Say: "All are waiting! So wait. You shall know who are in guidance and who are righteous."
For mankind, their time of reckoning draws nigh - but they are heedless and turning away.
When there comes unto them the Hadiths from their God as a reminder, they hear it not but mockingly.493
Their minds are unheedful; and the wicked secretly say to themselves, "He is but a man like you; do you come to the magic while you see?"
He said, "My God encompasses every word uttered in the heavens and in the earth. And He is All Hearing, All Knowing."
And they say, "Nay, confused dreams - nay, he has imagined them; nay, he is a poet; so let him bring us a sign as has been sent before."
And no township We had destroyed before them, believed; then are these going to believe?
And We did not make them bodies not eating the food, nor were they immortals.
Then We fulfilled the promise to them; thus We saved them and whom We willed. But We did destroy the transgressors.
We have certainly sent down to you the Book; therein is the reminder unto you; then, will you not give a thought?
And how many a wicked town did We destroy? And thereafter We created other generations.
So when they perceived Our torment, they began to run therefrom.
Run not! Return to your pleasures and to your houses. You are to be questioned.
They cried, "Woe to us! We were indeed unjust."
And their cry ceased not till we made them as stubble, silent and still.
And We have not created the heavens and the earth and everything in between for fun.
Had fun been Our wish, surely We would have taken it from Our presence.
Nay, We throw the truth upon the falsehood; so it destroys them - and it gets shattered; then woe to you for that you ascribe.
And to Him belongs what is in the heavens and in the earth; those who are inclined to Him will not be boastful, disobeying Him - and they tire not.
They purify Him night and day, without a pause.
Or the deities they had taken from the earth as their Gods give life?
Had there been Gods besides Allah surely both these would have perished. Allah is the Most Wise; Glory be to Him, the Most Pure from all they describe.
None shall question Him what He does; rather it is them who will be questioned.

Or have they taken Gods besides Him? Say, "Bring your proof; and here is the clear thought of those with me and the wisdom of those before me." Most of them are ignorant of the truth and so they turn aside.
And We sent not any messenger before you but inspiring him, "Verily there is no God but Me; so call upon Me alone."
And they say: "The Beneficent has taken a son. He is most Pure; nay, servants dignified!"
They do not advance before Him in word, but they do what they were commanded by Him.
He knows what is before them and what is behind them; and they will not intercede except upon whom He is pleased with; and they remain in awe for fear of Him.
And if any one of them says, "Indeed I am God besides Him, We recompense with hell; thus do We recompense the unjust."
Do the disbelievers not observe that surely the skies and the earth were close together and that We separated them; and that We created every living thing from water? Do they not believe?"
And We planted mountains firm on the earth lest it shakes with them; and in order that they find ways, We made for them expanded passages.
And We made the sky a protective covering; yet they are indifferent to the proofs therein.
And He created the night and the day; and the sun and the moon - each swimming within its orbit.
And We gave no man before you eternity; so if you die will they live forever?
Everyone is to taste the death and We put you to trial, testing you with evil and good; then you will be returned to Us.
And when the disbelievers see you, they would not but mock at you and say, "Is this the one who mentions of your Gods?" And they reject the very remembrance of the Bountiful.
Man is ever hasty; soon I shall show you My Signs and so hasten Me not.
And they say, "When is this promise, if you are truthful?"
If only the unbelievers knew the Hour, when they will not be able to save their faces and their backs from the fire nor would they be helped; -
Nay, it will come to them suddenly, bewildering them; they will not be able to avert them; nor will they be respited.
And messengers before you were indeed mocked at; but their own mockery surrounded them.
Say, "Who will protect you from the Beneficent in the night and in the day? Yet they reject the very remembrance of their God."
Or do they have protecting Gods besides Us? They cannot help themselves; and they will not be protected from Us.
Yet, We allowed them and their fathers taste the pleasures of the word all their lives. See they not their lands shrinking? Do they excel Us?494
Say, "I indeed warn you by revelation; yet the deaf do not hear when they are warned!"495
If a whiff of a torment of your God touches them they would surely say, "Alas for us; we were transgressors!"
And on the lasting day, We judge on justness; no one will be wronged in aught; We will weigh in, even if it is of the weight of a mustard; We are able, to account thus.
And indeed We gave Musa and Harun "The Distinguishment". It is The Light and The Reminder to the God fearing.496
They will fear their God in their souls; and they will be afraid of the Hour.
And it is a Blessed Reminder We have sent down; is it this, you reject?
And We certainly gave Ibrahim of old his proper course; We know well about him.
When he said to his father and his folks, "What are these idols that you worship?"
They said, "We found our forefathers worshiping them."
He said, "Indeed you and your forefathers have been in manifest error."
They said, "Have you brought us the Truth or are you of the joking?"
He said, "Nay, your God is the God of the heavens and the earth; He created them and I am of the bearers of witness."
"And after you had gone back, I will certainly by Allah, cause a thing to your idols."
Thus, but for the large deity, he broke them all into pieces, would that they give a thought.497
They said, "Who did this to our deities? Certainly he will be of the wrong-doers?"
They said, "We heard an youngster has been saying of them; he was Ibrahim."
They said, "Then bring him before the eyes of the people that they may bear witness."
They said, "O Ibrahim, is it you who did this to our deities?"
He said, "Nay, here is the Mighty deity; this should have done this; so if they could speak ask them."498
They turned to one another and said, "Surely you had done a wrong thing!"
Then they were made to hang their heads down and said, "You know well they do not speak!"
He said, "Do you worship besides Allah, which neither cause good nor harm to you?"
"Alas for you and woe to that you worship besides Allah. Do you not understand this?"
They said, "If you wish, burn him! Help your deities!"499
We said, "O Fire! Cool down on Ibrahim and give him solace!"
And then for him they contrived but We made them losers.500
And We made him and Lut take refuge on the land We have blessed with for all the worlds.
And We blessed him with Ishaq and then gave him Yaqub; We made them all righteous.
And by Our Command We have made them leaders guiding; and We inspired to them to do good, to obey Allah's Command and to help others of their provisions pure; and they were righteous for Us.
And Lut - We gave him Wisdom and the Comprehension of the Unseen; and We saved him from the town that did abominations - verily they were folks lewd and evil.
And We have admitted him into Our Mercy and verily he was of the righteous.
And Nuh - when he called before, We answered him; and We delivered him and his family from a very grave situation.
And We helped him from the people who belied Our Signs; they indeed were a people wicked - so We drowned them all.
And Dawood and Sulaiman - when they judged upon a dispute concerning a field wherein the sheep of their people had strayed in on their crops, We were witness to their contemplation.501

Thereat, We made it clear to Sulaiman and We gave them both The Truth and The Wisdom; and to Dawood We subjected the mountains and the birds; and they were praising the Purity of their God with him - and We did these.502
And We taught him the making of coats of mail to protect you when you fight the war - will you then show thanks?
And to Sulaiman the winds of the tempest which, by his command reached the place We had blessed; and of everything We are All-Knowing.
And from among shaitans - they will deep dive for him and do other work besides; and We kept guard over them.
When Ayyub submitted to his God and said, "Surely distress has touched me; You are the Most Merciful of the merciful."
We accepted his submission and delivered him of the distress; We gave him his family and the likes thereof in good number; a Mercy from Us and a reminder to those abiding.
And Ismail, Idris and Zulkifl - all were of the people of great patience.
And We encompassed them into Our Mercy; surely they were of the righteous.

And Zunnun - when he went away in anger, he thought We will not hold him to account; so, when he submitted in the darkness, "There is no God but You; You are most Pure; I have indeed become of the wrong doers."
So We accepted his submission and delivered him from his great grief; thus would We deliver those who believe.
And Zachariah - he said to his God, "My God! Leave me not alone! You are the most High of the inheritors.
So, We accepted his call; We cured his wife and blessed him with Yahya; they all were active in good deeds; and they submitted with belief and fear for God; and they were humble to Us.
And she who has preserved her chastity: We breathed from Ourself into her Soul - thus made her and her son a Sign unto the people of the worlds.
Verily, you are one community; and I am your God; Obey Me alone.
Then they differed upon their assumptions; their return is unto Us.
Those who believe and stay righteous, their efforts will not go waste; verily We record them.
And whichever city We have destroyed, it is forbidden to them; they certainly shall not return.
When the way is opened for Yajuj and Majuj they will slide down from their high pride.503
If the Promised Hour draws nigh, the disbelievers eyes would become a fixed stare. Alas to us! Verily we had been neglectful of this - nay, we had been wicked.
Verily you and those whom you called besides Allah are the fuels of hell; thereunto ye will come.
Had they been Gods they would not have come down to this; and therein will all abide.
For them therein is the groaning torment and therein is not a hearing.
Verily, those to whomever Good from Us has led them forth, will be far removed from it.
They will not hear the tumult; and they will forever abide in their wishful life.
Fear will not haunt them; the angels will come to them saying, "This is your promised Day!"
The day when We roll up the skies like rolling up a scroll! We will originate the creations just as We created it in the beginning; this is a Promise upon Us; and We will do it.504
And verily We have inscribed in Zabur that surely My righteous servants shall inherit the earth.
For the abiding people surely this has enough in it.
And We have sent you not but as a Mercy unto the worlds.
Say, "I have been inspired that your God is One; so will you submit?"
But if they disobey, say: "I have revealed to you all equally; and I know not whether what has been promised to you is near or far!"
He surely encompasses what you speak openly and what you conceal.
And I know not if it is a reprisal or a respite for you!
"O my God! Judge in Truth!" He said. "Our God is Most Merciful and His succor is ever to be sought against what you attribute!"
O Mankind! Fear your God. Indeed, the shaking of the Hour will be a Mighty event.

On the day when ye behold it, every nursing mother will forget her suckling baby and every pregnant woman will deliver her burden; and, you will see mankind losing sense; it is not losing the sense, but the torment of Allah is severe.
And among men are those who dispute about Allah without the knowledge and who follows each froward devil.
It has been mentioned: whoever takes him for a friend, verily, he causes crookedness and directs him to the burning hell.

O Mankind! If you are doubtful about being raised again, then We surely created you from dust, and from a drop, and from a clot, and from the formed and unformed bulk of tissues - that We make you know; and We settle that which We wish, in the womb for a term determined; then We deliver you as a child. Then that you may reach your youth; and among you is he who dies and he who is left to reach his decrepit age and becomes like ignorant although he was knowledgeable before. And you see the parched land, and when We bring rain upon it, it is a pastureland.
It is because Allah! He is the Truth. He quickens the dead; and that He has Power over all things.
And the Hour shall come; there is no doubt thereof; Allah will raise those who are in the graves.
And among men is he who disputes about Allah without wisdom, without guidance and without clear proofs.
He, turning away with arrogance, deviates the people from the path of Allah; he will be disgraced in this world; and on the lasting Day, he will be made to taste the torment of hell fire.
This is what your hands had sent forth; and, Allah is not ever unjust to His servants.

There is also among men who call upon Allah, sitting on the border; if any good touches him he is satisfied with it; but if a trial touches him, he turns away his face - such are the losers in the present world and in the Hereafter. And this is the manifest loss.
He calls upon that neither cause harm or good to him but Allah; this is the path far away astray.
He calls upon him whose evil is nearer than his good; indeed, evil is his protector and an evil friend at that.
Indeed, Allah makes those who believe and stay righteous enter the gardens beneath which rivers flow - verily Allah does what He will.
Whoever thinks, 'Allah will not help in this world and the Hereafter', let him extend a thread unto the sky and snap it and see if this act of him removes that whereat he rages.
And thus We had sent down Clear Signs, and Allah indeed guides whom He will.

Indeed those who have believed, and the Jews, and the sabians; and those who have become Christians and Majusis; and those who have set up partners to Allah - indeed, between them Allah will judge on the Day of Reckoning; surely Allah is a witness over all things.505

Behold not thee! those in the skies and on the earth; and the sun and the moon and the stars; and the mountains and the gardens and the cattle, obey Allah? And upon men and upon many among men doom has been justly cast; and whoso Allah disgraces, none shall grace him. Allah surely does what He intends.
Both the parties dispute about their God; and, whoso rejects for them is the clothing of fire and upon their heads will be poured the scalding water;
With that will be melted that which is in their bellies and their skins;
And for them are the iron fetters;
In their agony, when they try to escape it, they will be pushed into it: "Taste the punishment of burning fire!"

Verily, Allah will make those who believe and stay righteous, enter the gardens beneath which rivers flow; they will be adorned therein with ornaments of gold and pearls; and, therein their attires will be of silk.
And they had been guided towards the words of the Most Truthful; and towards the path of the Most Glorious.

Indeed those who reject - and while the inhabitants and the outsiders are in a peaceful habitation, whoever prohibit them in the God endowed shelters for the mankind, and who causes obstruction in the path of Allah and who unjustly transgress in it - We shall make him taste the torment of a very painful punishment.

And when We fixed for Ibrahim his place of living and said, "Do not associate anyone with Me; and keep My House pure for those who Honour it; and to those who are humble in it and to those who submit and surrender to God."
And say about Hajj to people! They will come to you by walk, and from far away distance and upon their lean camels.506
So that they may witness their reward and to pronounce Allah's Name upon the cattle Allah has provided them on the days of need - so eat ye of it and feed therewith the have-nots too.
And that they shall put in their best efforts, fulfil their vow and that they shall honour their Abode.

This! And whoever honours the purity of Allah, such deed is the most beautiful with his God; and the cattle is made lawful to you except that which has been clarified to you; so turn away from the enchantment of the idols and forbid from saying the words of the lie.

Be truthful unto Allah, ascribing no partners to Him; and whoso ascribe unto Him partners it is as though he has fallen from the sky and the birds have snatched him up or he was blown by wind to a far off place.
This! whoever stands witness to Allah's Signs, it is indeed due to fear for his conscience.507
In such Signs are benefits for you for a stated term; and your return is unto your sacrifice, by your conscience.

And that they praise the Name of Allah upon the livestock, beneficial to them; and We have made sacrifice mandatory to everyone; so your God is One God! Submit unto Him! And give glad news to the humble!
Their hearts quiver at the mention of Allah; and they will endure their difficulties, look up to their God; and give others of what We have blessed them with.

And the cattle - We have made them for you of Allah's Symbols; in them are benefits to you; so when they stand remember Allah's Name; and when they had laid on their sides, eat of it and give to those who are content and to the poor - thus, We have subjected them to you that you may show gratitude.508

The meat or their blood does not reach Allah but subjecting your soul for the fear of Him shall - that you may keep up His truthfulness and that He may Guide you; thus He had subjected them to you. So give glad tiding to the righteous.
Allah indeed protects the believers. Allah surely does not love the beguiler and the hypocrites.
It is allowed upon the aggressed for they were wronged; and, Allah indeed suffices them as a Helper with Power.

They were driven from their houses unjustly for that they said, "Our God is Allah!" Had He not stopped some with some others, the monasteries, churches, synagogues and the masjids wherein Allah's names are remembered more, would have been destroyed - and, whoever helps Allah, He surely helps him. Allah indeed is Powerful, Mighty.

And such of them - if We provide them sufficiently in the earth, they will submit to Him, surrendering; and provide of the pure provisions; they will bid good and forbid evil. And with Allah is the end of all affairs.
And if they belie you, so were the people of Nuh, Aad, and Samud indeed belied before them-
And the people of Ibrahim and the people of Lut.
And the people of Madyan; and Musa were belied - yet I gave respite to those who belied and then I seized them. How was then My punishment?
How many a nation We have destroyed while they were wrongdoing; it fell on its roof; and how many wells lay deserted - and well-built castles.
Have they not journeyed through the earth that they had perceiving hearts and listening ears? surely their eyes are not blind but blind are their hearts, in their chests.
And they urge you to hasten on the torment; Allah never goes back on His promise; and, a day with your God is, as a thousand years in your reckoning.
And how many a wronging nation did I give respite; then I seized them; and, to Me is the return.
Say, "O Men, I am but a plain warner unto you."
"So those who believe and do good, for them is forgiveness and generous provision."
"But whoever strive to belie Our Signs they are inmates of hell."

And it is not that Shaitan has not cast corruption on the command before you, each time We sent a messenger or a prophet with Our Command; but Allah, annulling the corruption Shaitan has cast, He strengthens His Signs. And Allah is Knowing, Wise.
The corruption Shaitan casts - as only a trial for those in whose hearts is the disease and those whose hearts are hard; and surely the unjust are in open schism.

And that those who were given wisdom shall see it as the truth from your God and believe in it; their hearts totally submit and surrender to Him. And Allah does ever guide the believers to the straight path.
And the rejecters do not cease to be in doubt until the end comes upon them suddenly or until the punishment of a barren day catches them.
Sovereignty on that day belongs to Allah; He will judge among them and hence those who believe and stay righteous will be in the blessed heavens.
And it is for those who belied Our Signs, is the disgraceful torment.
And whoever is killed or dies in the path of Allah deserting their homes, surely Allah provides them with an excellent provision. And indeed Allah is the best in bestowing.
Surely He will make them enter where they wish to; and verily, Allah is Knowing, Forbearing.509
This - whoso punishes to the extent he was wronged; but then exceeds limits, then Allah will surely succour him; surely Allah is Relenting, Most Forgiving.510
This - Surely Allah causes the night enter the day and causes the day enter the night. And surely Allah is Hearing, Seeing.511
Certainly the believers have become victorious
Who fear God in their servitude.
And they who will turn away from vain talks.
And they who spend of the pure things.
And they who will guard against secret thoughts.
Except with their wives or their right hand possessed - certainly it is no dishonour.
But whoever trespass, they are the aggressors.
And they who are keepers of their trusts and their covenants.
And they who will fear God in their servitude.
They are the inheritors.
They shall inherit the Paradise and dwell therein.
And verily, We created man from the quintessence of clay.
Then We placed him secure, a drop.

Then We made it into a cluster of cells; and then, We made it into a lump of flesh; and, We made in it, the bones; then We clothed the bones with muscles - then We made it into a different creation. Allah is the Most Blessed, Creator of Beauty.
Then indeed, on the day of Resurrection, you will be raised.
And verily, We have created seven paths above you - and We were never negligent of Our Creations.
And We send down water from the sky in just measure and We store it in the earth; and, surely We can take it away.
Then therewith, We grow gardens for you of date-palms and grape-vines; in it are innumerable fruits in varieties, whereof ye eat.
And the tree that issues of 'Thur-Sinai' grows oil and seasoning for the eaters.
Verily in the cattle is a Sign for you; We feed you from their bellies; and, in them are many benefits for you and of them, you eat.
And upon them, and on the ships you are borne.
And verily We sent Nuh to his people. He said, "O my people, call upon Allah; you have no God other than He; will you then not fear?"

Said the leaders of the unbelievers of his people, "He is not any but a man like you; he wants to be praised above you; and had Allah willed He would have sent the angels; We heard not of this, of our fathers before."
"He is but bedevilled; so endure him for a period."
He said, "O my God, help me for these people bely me."

So, We inspired him, "Build a ship before Our eyes by Our Inspiration! Then when comes Our command, and the oven overflows, embark pairs of every livestock in the ship - your family members except upon whom Our word has foregone. And speak not to me about those who were wrongdoers; surely, they will be drowned."
When you and those who are with you have settled on the ship, say: "All Glory be to Allah Who saved us from the wicked people!"
Certainly in it are the proofs; We are ever putting to the test.
Then, after them, We brought forth a different generation.
And from among them We sent a messenger to them. "Call upon Allah; there is no God other than Him; will you then not fear?"

But the chiefs of the disbelievers of his people; and, those who belied the Last Day; and, those to whom We have given luxury of this world, said: "He is but a mortal like you; he eats what you eat and drinks what you drink."
"And if you fall to a mortal like you, you will certainly be the losers."
"Does he surely promise you that you will be certainly brought forth after you die and become dust and bones?"
"Far away, far away is that which you are promised."
"There is no other life other than the life of this world; we shall die and we are alive; and we are not to be raised up again."
"He is naught but a man who forges about Allah a lie; so we will not believe him."
He said, "My God, help me for they brand me a liar."
He said, "In a short span will they be contrite."
Then a burst did seize them in truth; and We made them into humus; so away with the aggressors.
Then, after them We brought forth other generations.
No nation hasten their term, nor do they postpone it.

After that We kept sending Our messengers; and when each messenger of its community came to them, they belied him; so We made them one after another as 'hadiths - histories'; hence far away is, for those who disbelieve.
Then We sent Musa and his brother Harun with Our clear Signs and proofs.
To Firaun and his chieftains: they were a people proud and despotic.
Then they said, "Are we to believe these two people like us, while their people are our slaves?"
So they belied them; and they were of those destroyed.
And verily We gave Musa the Book, that they may be guided.
And We made the son of Maryam and his mother a Sign; and, We sheltered them on an elevated land of tranquillity with water springs in it.
"O messengers! Eat of the good things and be righteous; surely I am ever watchful of what you do."
"And surely you are one human nature; and, I am your God; so fear Me."
But they got divided in their affairs and each division is satisfied with whatever they have with them.
So let them enjoy in their ignorance till a term-
What do they think that We had increased them in luxury and progeny?
We hasten them in good? Nay, they least reflect!
Surely, they who fear their God, guarded;
And they, who trust the Signs of their God;
And they, who do not set up partners to their God;
And they, who fear that they are to return to their God and spend to their capacity;
They are those who hasten to righteousness and who keep advancing.
And We charge not any soul beyond its scope; and with Us is the witness that speaks the truth, and they shall not be wronged.
But their hearts are in ignorance about this; and they have jobs other than this, and they indulge.
Till when We seize those who are indulged in their vanities, with our torment, they will groan, supplicating.
"Groan not in supplication this day! Assuredly you shall not be helped from Us."
Indeed My Revelations were recited to you; but you did swirl back on your heels;
Head haughty, gathering by night, rejected it jesting;
Then, have they not reflected what has been revealed to them? Or that there has come to them that which came not upon their forefathers?
Or that they are neglectful and so reject their messenger?
Or, do they say, "He is bedevilled?" Nay, he has come to them with the Truth; yet most of them are scornful at the Truth.

And if the Truth had served their vanities, verily, the heavens and on the earth and all in them would have been thrown into chaos; but, We gave them the reflection; yet they reject the very essence of wisdom.
Or that you have sought wages from them? Excellent is what your God bestows; and He is the Best of Providers.
And surely you call them to the straight path;
And those who disbelieve in the Hour has certainly fallen off the course.
But if We, by Our Mercy, remove their distress, they pursue in their wandering wildly, bewildered.
And verily, We had seized them with torment; yet, they had not surrendered to their God nor did they show humility.
Till We opened up on them, the gates of severe chastisement - behold, they lose their hopes therein.
And it is He who created for you the Hearing, the Sight, the Hearts; little do you use!
And He made you grow and spread on the earth; and, you will be gathered unto Him.
And He gives life and causes death; and to Him is the ever changing night and day; will you then not reflect?
On the contrary, they say as what those before them said.
They said, "Will we surely be raised again after we are dead and have become dust and bones."
Surely thus - we and our fore fathers were promised before; this is but a fable of the men of old.
Say, "If you know, to whom belongs the earth and those on it?"
They would say, "Allah's!" Say, "Will you not then bring to mind?"
Say, "Who is the God of the seven heavens and the God of the Glorious Kingdom?"
They would say, "Allah's!" Say, "Will you not then fear?"
Say, "In whose hands is the sovereignty? And He protects and no one is protected against Him, if you know"
They would say, "Allah's!" Say, "Why then do you lose your mind?"
But We brought them the Truth; yet they are surely liars!
Allah has not taken unto Himself a son; and, there is no God with Him; if so each God with its creation would try to compete with one another; Allah is most Pure from what they forge.
He knows what is concealed and what is manifest; so Exalted is He, above what they attribute.
Say, "My God, if You are to show me what they are promised;-
"My God, make me not be with the wicked."
"And surely We are able; We would show you what We promised them."
Avert the evil with the beautiful response; We know what they describe.
Say, "My God, I seek refuge in Thee, from the incitements of shaitans."
"And I seek refuge in Thee. My God, they shall not come near me."
When the death comes to one of them, he would say, "My God, send me back!"
"To do the good things I had left behind." Nay! What he says is empty utterance; there is a veil over them until they are raised up.
So, when the call is given, that day, there will not be any relation between them; and they will not enquire each other.
The successful are those whose good, measures greater.
And those whose measure of good is light are they who have lost their souls, in hell abiding.
The fire would scorch their faces; their looks will be gruesome with their lips drawn away.
Have not My Signs Revealed to you? Then you turned away.
They would say, "Our God, our evil has overtaken us and we have become misguided ones."
"Our God, deliver us out of this! If we turn away again, then surely we are wicked."
He would say, "Be despised therein; speak not to Me."
Indeed a section of My servants say, "Our God! We have believed; so Forgive us and grant us Grace; and, You are the Most Gracious of the graceful."
But you took them in mockery, ridiculing - until you lost Me in your mind.
This day, surely for their patience, I have rewarded them. Certainly they are victorious.
He will say, "By count how many years have you tarried on the earth?"
They will say, "A day, or a part of the day; ask who would know!"
He will say, "If you know, you tarried only for a short while."
"Were you to think then, that We created you in vain and that you will not be returned to Us.?"
So, Allah, the True God is Exalted; there is no God but He. And He is the God of the All Noble Wisdom.
And He who calls Gods other than Allah, has proof nought; so his account is with his God. Surely, the deniers will not succeed.
And say, "My God! Forgive and Grace me; for You are the Most Gracious of the graceful."
The Chapter! We bestowed and made it obligatory; and, We have clearly revealed the Sign that you might mind.

The adulterer and the adulteress - whip each a hundred lashes; show not mercy for them both in what Allah has decreed if you believe in Allah and the Last Day; and to their punishment, let there be a group of believing witnesses.512

An adulterer shall not marry any other than an adulteress, or one who associates with partners; and an adulteress shall not marry any other than an adulterer, or one who associates with partners. This is forbidden for the believers.513
Those who charge chaste women but bring not four witnesses, whip them with eighty lashes; and never ever take them for a witness - for they are evil.514
Except those who repents and reforms - surely, Allah is Ever Forgiving, Merciful.
Those who charge their wives, yet have no evidence but themselves - they shall say four times, "By Allah surely, I am saying the truth",
And for the fifth time, "If I lie, may the curse of Allah befall me."
But it shall avert the punishment from her, if she says four times, "Surely, by Allah, he is of the liars."515
And for the fifth time, "If he is of the truthful, may the wrath of Allah be on me."516
And had there not been Allah's Grace and His Mercy,- Allah is Ever Appreciative of repentance, Most Wise.517

Surely, those who slandered they are a band of you; but think it not as evil to you; nay, it is good for you; each soul has the evil it earned; and, of them who took a major part in it, is a mighty chastisement.518
Why did ye, believing men and women on hearing it, thinking good of their own folk and say, "This is a manifest calumny?"
Should they not have brought four witnesses? Not having brought the witnesses, they are the liars before Allah.
And had it not been for the Grace and Mercy of Allah upon you, now and ever, a mighty chastisement would surely have seized you even as you entered into this affair.
You had taken this slander on your tongue and prattling with your mouths, things of  which you knew naught; and you thought it to be a simple thing; but with Allah it was gruesome.
And why did you not say when you heard it, "it befits us not to utter on such affairs." "Glory be to You! This is a great calumny?"
Allah admonishes you shall never resort to the likes of it ever, if you are believers.
And Allah thus details the Guidance; and Allah is Knowing, Wise.
Lo! those who desire to spread such lecherous things among the believers, theirs will be a painful doom in this world and in the Hereafter. Allah knows; ye know not.
And if it had not been for the Grace and Mercy of Allah upon you;- and surely Allah is Merciful, Loving.

O believers! Follow not shaitan's footsteps; and, whoso follows shaitan's footsteps, he would surely drive him to indecency and abomination; and had it not been for Allah's Grace and Mercy none among you would have ever got purified; yet Allah purifies whom He will - And Allah is Ever-Hearing, All-Knowing.

And whoso of you is blessed with grace and abundance swear, 'not to give' to the near and the needy; and, to those who have emigrated in the cause of God; let them forgive and overlook. Will ye not wish Allah to forgive your sins? And Allah is Forgiving, Merciful.
Verily those who defame decent, innocent, believing women are accursed both in this world and in the Hereafter; and for them is an awful doom.
On that Day, their tongues, and their hands and their legs will testify against them as to their deeds.
On that Day, Allah will fully recompense them their reward - and they would know Allah - He is Clear Conscience!

Vile women for vile men and vile men for vile women; and Pure women for pure men and and Pure men for pure women - they are virtuous and free of all they say; theirs is Forgiveness and Respectable Sustenance.
O believers! enter not the houses other than your own until the household is free of fear for you and admit you in; that is better for you, that you may mind.
And if one is not there, enter not in it unless you are allowed in; and if you are asked to leave, turn back; it is pure for you. And Allah is well aware of what you do.
It is not sin for you if you enter unmanned shelters for necessities; Allah knows what you reveal and what you hide.
Say to the believing men: Guard thy sight; observe decency - it is best for you. Surely Allah is aware of what they do.

And say to the believing women: Guard thy sight; observe decency - show not your ornaments except that which naturally shows; and let them cover their bosoms. And make not a show of their ornaments - except before their husbands, their fathers, fathers in law, or their sons, or their husbands' sons, or their brothers; or their brothers' sons; or their sisters' sons; or their women; or their right hand possessed ones; or of the men, the children who have not attained their age but live with them. And let them not desire to show their hidden ornaments by stamping their steps aloud. And O believers! Turn to Allah for success.
And give in marriage to the spouseless among you, and the righteous of your servants; and if they are in need, Allah by His Bounty, will make them abundant. And Allah is Expansive, Knowing.

And those who have no means to marry, may they guard decency until Allah enriches them by His Blessings; and, if any of your right-hand possessed seek emancipation - and if you see in them their merit, then write it, and give them of the wealth Allah had bestowed; and concerning the chaste women under your care- force them not into whoredom seeking the cheap enjoyment of this world; and if one forces them, then lo! Allah is Forgiving, Merciful.
And certainly We have sent down clear Signs of Truth, and the examples of those who passed away before you, and an admonition for the God-fearing.

Allah is the Light for the skies and the earth. The parable of His Light is a niche wherein is a lamp; and, the lamp is in a glass; and, the glass is as it were the radiance of a star, lit by the oil of a blessed tree, belonging to neither the east nor the west; even when it is not touched by the fire, the oil shines; Light upon Light; Allah guides to His Light whom He will. Allah makes plain such examples to mankind; and Allah is All-Encompassing.519
Allah ordains that His Name be most remembered and revered in the houses; and in them they shall uphold His Purity, morn and evening.

Mankind whom neither trade nor transactions turn them away from the remembrance of Allah; and from surrendering to Him and to give of the pure things, fearing a Day, when their hearts and their eyes will be downcast in despair.
That Allah may reward for the best of their works and that He shall increase the favour by His grace; and Allah bestows without measure upon whom He will.

And as for those who reject, their deeds are like a mirage in the desert; the thirsty one feels it to be water till he comes to it  and finds it nothing, but finds Allah; and He settles his due in full; and Allah is swift at reckoning.

Or as darkness over darkness in the deep sea - wave upon a wave cover it; and clouds shroud above it, ever deepening the darkness; if he puts out his hand he can hardly see it; and to whoever Allah has not given a Light, he has no Light at all.
Do you not see - all in the skies and on the earth; and the birds in flight, indeed glorify Allah? Each one knows its way of worship and praising His glory. And Allah is aware of what they do.
And Allah's is the sovereignty of the heavens and the earth; and to Allah is the return.

Do you not see, Allah ever so lightly draws the cloud and merges them; and then He thickens them into clusters. Then you see the rain bursting out of their clusters; and He sends down hails from the mountains in the skies - He strikes therewith whom He will and averts it from whom He will. And His spark of lightning draws nigh to causing blindness.
Allah causes the ever changing night and the day; surely herein is the sign for those who reflect.

And Allah has created every living being from water; of them are those that move on their bellies; and, of them are that walk on their two legs; and, of them are that walk on fours; Allah creates what He will. Surely, Allah has power over all things.
We have indeed sent down Revelation, clear; and, Allah guides whom He will to the right path.
And they say, "We believed in Allah and His messenger and we obey; then, after that, a group among them turn away - they are not believers.
And if they are called to Allah and His messenger for justice among them, then a party of them turn aside.
But if the truth is on their side, they come to him with all submission.
Do they have disease in their hearts? Or do they suspect? Or do they fear Allah and His messenger would wrong them? Nay, they are the wrong doers.
When the believers are called  to come to Allah and His messenger to judge between them, all they say is, "We have accepted; we had obeyed." Such are the victorious.
The victorious are those who obey Allah and His messenger and fear disobedience to Him
And they say with firmness swearing by Allah, they would go forth if you order them; say, "Do not swear; obedience is well known. Surely Allah is watchful of what you do.

Say, "Obey Allah and obey the messenger; then, if you turn away, his duty rests upon what is laid on him; and your duty rests upon what is laid on you. So if you obey him, you will be guided; and it is not upon the messenger but to manifest deliverance."

And Allah's promise is that whosoever of you is believing and righteous will surely be given the authority on the earth as were those given the authority before them; and that He would surely place them firmly in the path chosen for them and that He would  replace their fear with peace. They would not associate partners to Me but they would reflect Me. But whoever disbelieves after that - then those are the sinners.
And stay firm in His remembrance and give from that which is pure; and obey the messenger - that you shall be shown Mercy.
And certainly think not that the rejecters would win over on this earth; and their shelter is fire - an evil abode!

O ye who believe! Of those who are righteous for you and the pre-pubertal innocent children among you shall seek your permission on three occasions: before your reverence at dawn; when you are tired and relaxing during the forenoon and after your reverence at night - the three occasions of privacy for you; this apart, there is no blame on you nor on them - for they are to come to you often, and of you, one to another. Thus Allah explains to you His Wisdom. And Allah is All-Knowing, Most Wise.
And if, of your children, have attained age, they too shall seek permission as their elders used to do; thus Allah gives wisdom from Him; and Allah is Knower, Wise.
And no blame on those elderly women who could not opt for marriage when they relax a little, unintentionally; yet, to keep their guard is good for them; and Allah is Hearer, Knower.

No blame upon the blind, nor upon the handicapped, nor upon the ill, nor in yourselves - that ye may eat separately or all together in your houses and of your fathers, or of your mothers, or of your brothers, or of your sisters, or of your fathers' brothers, or of your fathers' sisters, or of your mothers' brothers, or your mothers' sisters, or in the houses whose keys are in your possession, or in your friends' houses; but into whichever house you enter make lawful to you to greet the household with that which you had received from Allah as most pure and blessed words; thus  Allah makes clear His Signs that you may understand.

The believers are those who believe in Allah and His messenger; and they would not leave out without his leave when they have assembled on a common interest; surely the true believers in Allah and His messenger are those who leave after seeking your permission; hence if they seek your permission for certain of their affairs give them leave to whom you will; and seek pardon for them from Allah. Surely Allah is Most Forgiving, Merciful.

Call not your messenger as you wont to call one another among you; Allah indeed knows who of you skulk away; so let those who disobey his order, fear being seized by a trial, severe or, by a painful torment.

And know that to Allah belongs all that are in the heavens and in the earth; and He knows your state; and on that Day when they will be brought back to Him He will inform them of what you used to do; and Allah is Cognisant  of all things.
Blessed is He who sent down the 'Furqaan - the distinguishing' ability, upon His servant that he may be a warner to the worlds.520

It is to Him is the sovereignty of the heavens and the earth; and He has not taken a son unto Him; and He has no associate in His Kingdom; and it is He who created everything and proportioned each to a measure.521
But they have taken Gods besides Him which create naught but are themselves created; they possess not harm or good for themselves; and they have no power of life or death, or raising up.
And the rejecters say, "It is nothing but a lie he has fabricated and others have helped him in this." So, surely they had brought a lie unjustly.
And they say, "They are the fables of the old he had written it down - so it is recited before him morn and evening.
Say, "It is sent down by Him, who knows the secrets of the skies and the earth. And indeed He is Ever Forgiving, Most Merciful.
And they say, "What is with this messenger that he eats and walks in the markets; is it not that an angel should have been sent with him as a warner?"
"Or should he not have been given a treasure? Or a garden to feast from it?" And the unjust say, "You follow no other than a bewitched one."
See how they set forth parables for you; so they are astray and shall not find a way.
Blessed is He who can create for you august gardens beneath which rivers flow if He will - and He would create for you palaces of grandeur.
Yet, they strive to deny the Hour and We have prepared for those who cry lies to the Hour, a Blaze.
They will hear the crackling and raging uproar, when it sees them from afar.
When they are flung into a chink therein chained together, they will cry out for destruction.
Cry not out for one destruction this day, but call for many destructions.
Say, "Is that good? Or the infinite paradise promised for the God fearing is good? It will be a goodly reward and a beautiful destination.
Therein will be all that they wish, dwelling forever; it is on your God a promise, you would pray for.
On the Day when they and those that they worshiped besides Allah will be gathered, He will say, "Did you mislead My slaves, or they went astray from the way?"

They will say, "You are Pure! It is not for us to take Protectors beside You; then, You made them and their fathers taste the worldly pleasures; yet they forgot remembering You and became a people ruined."
"Surely, they have denied all what you said; so you will not have the strength to avert or to help; and of you who were wicked We will make them suffer a mighty chastisement.

And We sent not a messenger before you, but indeed, they ate food and walked in the markets; and We have made some of you as a trial unto some others. Will you then be patient? And your God is ever watchful.522
And those who deny their meeting with Us say, "Why the angels have not been sent to us? Or why are we not able to see our God?" Undoubtedly, they are proud and had transgressed!523
The day they see the angels - there is no good news for the sinners on that day; they would say, "Absolutely forbidden."
That day the people of heavens will have dignified resting place and an environment beautiful.
And on the day when the sky is cleaved asunder by the clouds, the angels will be sent down in ranks.
That day the true sovereignty belongs to the Most Benevolent; and to the misbelievers it will be a disastrous day.
And that day the wicked will bite on his hands and would say, "Alas, would it not be that I had taken to the path with that messenger?"
And he would say, "Woe to me! Would that I had not taken so-and-so for a friend?"
After the remembrance and reminders have come to me for sure, he misled me; ah, shaitan is an open plotter.
The messenger would say, "My God, surely my people deserted this Quran."
And thus did We make for each prophet enemies from the wrongdoers; and your God suffices as a Guide and a Helper.
And the misbelievers say, "Why has this Quran not been sent wholly on a single descent?" We sent this in stages so that your heart is strengthened with it.524
They do not come to you with examples but that We give you in truth, exemplary proof.
Those who will be gathered in the hell upon their faces, evil is their abode; and by the path most astray.
And indeed We gave Musa, the Book; and with him, We set his brother Harun as a helper.
And We said, "Go forth you both to those who denied Our Signs." Then We destroyed them utterly.
And the people of Nuh: when they belied Our messengers, We drowned them; and We made them a Sign unto the mankind; further, We have prepared a very painful torment for the unjust.525
And the people of Aad, Samud and the Russ and many a generation between them-
And to each We gave the Signs of Revelation, clear. We ruined them each.
And certainly they have gone to a town whereon was rained the evil rain; what, they have not seen it? Yet they believed not in resurrection.
Is this he, whom Allah has sent as a messenger? When they see you, they take you for mockery.
He indeed was well-nigh to making us deviate from our Gods had we not been firm to them; they will know who is in far astray in way when they behold the doom.
Have you seen he who has taken for god his own lust? Would you then be guardian over him?
Or deem you that most of them listen or comprehend? They are but as cattle; they are worse astray in path.
Have you not given a thought to the God how He stretches the shadow? And if He so wish, He would have made it still; and We made the sun a sign unto it.
Then We retrieve it to Ourselves, gently.
And He made the night a garment unto you and sleep as a resting for you; and He made the day to rise up.
And it is He who sends the breezes with glad tidings; and We send down from the sky the purest water.
We thus give life to the earth, dead; and We give to drink of that We created cattle and men a many.
We indeed turned it amongst the men that they may reflect; but most people reject all but disbelief.
And had We willed We would have sent a warner to every town.
So follow not the misbelievers; and with this strive against them mightily.
And He it is who made the two seas meet, one being sweet and delectable and the other salt and detestable; and between the two He had set a bar and a ban forbidden.
And He it is who created man from clay and made generations and relationships; and your God is All Powerful.
Yet, they worship other than Allah that which shall neither benefit them nor harm them; and the misbeliever is ever a partisan against his God.
And We have not sent you as a bringer of good tidings and a warner.
Say, "I do not ask of you a wage for this except that whoever wills let him take to the path of his God."
So trust your God who Ever Lasts and whom death does not touch; and Glorify Him with His Purity; and suffices be that He is Aware of His bondsmen's sins.526
He it is who created the heavens and the earth and all in between in six periods and placed Himself upon the throne - the Most Benevolent. So ask of Him from one well informed.
When said to them, "Surrender to the Most Benevolent," they say, "What is most benevolent? Shall we surrender to that which you command us?" And it only increased aversion in them.
Most Blessed is He who created the moving orbits in the sky and placed amidst them the light and the luminous moon.
And He made the night and the day change into one another to those who desire reflection.
And the slaves of the Most Benevolent - are those who are modest on the earth; if the ignorant one address them, they will prefer 'salam - peace'.
And who pass the night surrendering, being firm in their God's remembrance.
They would say, "Our God, avert the punishment of hell from us; surely its torment is inseparable."
Lo! it is wretched as abode and station.
And who, when they spend, are neither prodigal nor stingy but between that, are just.
And they will not call on another God beside Allah; nor slay any soul unjustly, which Allah has forbidden, neither fornicate - so whoso do these, invite punishment.
On the Eternal Day their punishment will be doubled; they will abide therein despised forever.
But whoever repents, believes and strives righteous, Allah will change their sins with goodness. And Allah is Ever Forgiving, Most Merciful.
And whoever repents and reposes in righteousness, has indeed turned to Allah for salvation.
And they will not testify to falsehood; and when they come upon impiety, they pass by with dignity.
And when they are recited with their God's Signs, they will not fall thereat deaf and blind.
They say, "Our God! enliven our eyes of our wives and seed; and make us inspiring to those who are God fearing."
They will be rewarded magnificent mansions for their patience and will be received with greetings of peace.
They will abide therein forever - a beautiful one as a place to dwell.
Say, "Had it not been for your prayers, my God would not have minded you; but you keep rejecting; so soon will be the inevitable."
Tha, Seem, Meem, Meem.527
These are the Signs of the Book, clear.
It may be that you will self destroy for their unbelief.
If We willed We would have made a Sign from the skies fall on them to bend their necks in abject surrender.
And no new 'hadiths' - reminders come to them from the Benevolent but to their rejection.
And surely they strive to deny; yet the news of that which they mock will soon reach them.
Have they not seen the earth - upon it how many a treasure! We produced them all to pair.528
Verily in this is the Sign - yet, most of them believe not.
And indeed your God is Mighty, Merciful.
When your God said to Musa, "Go forth to the aggressors."
To the people of Firaun, "Will they not fear?"
He said, "My God, I do fear their rejection of me."
"My bosom will straiten and my tongue would not move; send Harun too as messenger."
"And they have a charge against me; I fear they will kill me."
Said, "Nay! Go you both with Our clear Signs; surely We are with you, Hearing."
"So go to Firaun and say to him, "Verily We bear a message of the God of the worlds;
"Send with us the people of Israel!"
He said, "When you were a child did we not rear you? And were you not with us for years of your life?"
"So you have done what you did, being one of the ingrates."
He said, "I did it when I was of those astray."
"Then when I feared you, I went into safety; then my God had made me of the messengers granting me wisdom."
Is it a blessing on you to charge me, having enslaved Israelis?
Firaun said, "What is the God of the worlds?"
He said, "If you know, He is the God of the heavens and the earth and all in between."
He said to those about him, "Do you hear it not?"
He said, "Your God and the God of your first forefathers."
He said, "Surely the messenger sent to you is mad."
He said, "If you are discerning, He is the God of the East and the West and what between them is."
He said, "If you take other than me as God, I will surely make you of the imprisoned."
He said, "What! Even if l bring you a manifest Proof?"
He said, "Bring it, if you are truthful!"
So he cast his staff; it became a serpent, manifest.
And he drew out his hand and it was white to the beholders.
And he said to the assembly about him, "He surely is a talented sorcerer!"
He plans to send you away from your land with his sorcery; then what is your suggestion?
They said, "Put him and his brother off a while and send into the cities, the gatherers."
"They will bring unto you every talented sorcerer."
The sorcerers were assembled at a set time on a day, prescribed.
The people were asked, "Will you assemble?"
"For if the sorcerers succeed, we may have to follow them."
So when the sorcerers came, said to Firaun, "Is there indeed a reward for us if we win?"
He said, "Yes, indeed then you will be of those close to me."
Musa said to them: "Cast what you should cast!"
So they cast their ropes and staves and said, "By the might of Firaun we shall be the victors."
Then Musa threw his staff, lo! it swallowed up the illusion they created.
The sorcerers were cast down prostrate.
Crying, "We believed in the God of the worlds."
"The God of Musa and Harun."

Said, "You put your faith in him before I gave you leave; Lo! doubtless it is he who is your chief taught you sorcery; so, soon you will know; verily I will cut off your hands and feet alternately and I shall crucify you all together."
They said, "No harm! Surely we will only return to our God."
"We certainly hope, our God will forgive us our sins, as we are first-hand believers."529
And We inspired Musa, "Take away my slaves by night; surely you will be followed!"
Then Firaun sent into the cities gatherers;
"Surely these are but a very few;
"Verily they have enraged us;
"Assuredly we have been vigilant."
Thus We did take them away from gardens and springs;
And treasures and glorious mansions;-530
Thus We bequeathed them upon the descendants of Israel.
Then they pursued them at sunrise.
When the two hosts sighted each other, the companions of Musa said, "We are seized!"
He said, "No. Surely my God is with me and He would pave the way for me."
Then We inspired to Musa, "Smite the sea with your staff; and it clave, each part was as a mighty mountain."
And there We brought near, the others on;
And We saved Musa and all those with him;
Then We drowned the others.
Surely in this is a manifest assurance; yet most of them are not believers.
Surely your God is  the Mighty, the Merciful.
And recite to them the life of Ibrahim!
When he said to his father and his people, "What do you call upon?"
They said, "We call upon our idols and we remain in their worship."
Said, "When you call them do they hear you?"
"Or do they do good to you or harm you?"
They said, "Nay, but we found our fathers doing so."
He said, "Then did you see what you had been worshiping?"
"You and your fathers;
"These indeed are my enemies - except the God of the worlds;
"It is He who created me and then guides me;
"He feeds me and gives me to drink;
"He cures me when I become ill;
"And He cause me to die; then He will bring me to life;
"And I put my trust in His forgiveness of my sins on the Lasting Day."
"My God! Give me wisdom and make my company with the righteous."
"And grant me an honourable mention among the latter generations."
"And make me among the inheritors of the Paradises of Delight!"
"And forgive my father. Lo! he is of those who err."
"And put me not to disgrace on the day they are raised up."
"The day when wealth and sons avail not."
"Except those who, come to Allah with a serene heart."
"And Paradise will be brought near to the God fearing."
"And Hell advanced for the erring."
And it will be said to them, "Where are those that you worshiped?"
"But Allah? Will they help you? or help themselves?"
Then they will be thrown headlong into it - they and the erred.
Iblis, his forces - all;
They will dispute among them therein saying,
"By Allah, we indeed were in open error;
"When we equated you with the God of the worlds;
"We are not misguided, but the criminals;
"So we have no interceder;
"And not a compassionate friend;
"if we have a way back, we would be faithful."
Lo! herein is indeed a Sign - yet, most of them are not believers.
And your God surely is All-mighty, Merciful.
And the people of Nuh; they falsified the messengers.
Their brethren Nuh when said, "Will you not fear God."
"Verily, I am messenger sent unto you, trustworthy."
"So fear Allah and obey me."
"I ask not wages for this; surely, my reward is with the God of the worlds."
So fear Allah; and follow me.
They said, "When the despised ones follow you, shall we believe you?"
He said, "And what knowledge do I have of what they have been doing?"
"Their account is only with my God, were you but aware."
