"And I will not drive away the believers."
"I am naught but a plain warner."
They said, "If you do not stay clear, surely you will be one of the stoned."
He said, "My God, surely my people have belied me."
"So judge between me and them in truth and save me and the believers with me."
So We saved him and those who were with him in the laden ship.
Then We drowned the rest;
Surely in this is a Sign; yet most of them do not believe.
Surely your God is Mighty, Merciful.
Aad - belied the messengers;-
When their brethren Hud said to them, "Will you not fear?"
"Surely I am your messenger, trustworthy."
"So fear Allah; and follow me."
"And I ask of you no wages for this; my wage is not but with the God of the worlds."
"Do you erect vain monuments on every high ground?"
"And do you build mansions, enduring?"
"And when you seize, you seize as a cruel one."
"So fear Allah; and follow me."
"And fear He Whom ye knew has succoured ye,"
"Succoured ye with flocks and folks."
"And gardens and springs."
"Surely I fear for you the retribution of an awful day."
They said, "Alike it is to us whether you admonish or not of the admonishers."
"This is but a habit of the men of old.
"And we shall not be doomed."
They belied him; so We destroyed them; surely herein is a Sign; yet most of them do not believe."
And surely your God is Exalted in Might, Most Merciful.
Samud - belied the messengers;
When Salih said to his brethren, "Will ye not fear?"
"Surely I am a messenger, trustworthy to you."
"So fear Allah, and follow me."
"And I ask of you no wages for this; my wage is not but with the God of the worlds."
"Will ye be left in this here, without your fear?"
"In gardens and springs?"
"And in the cornfields and palms with slender spadices?"
"And you hew out houses in the mountains, being skilful!"
"So fear Allah, and follow me."
"And bow not to the bidding of the prodigals."531
"They cause corruption in the land and set not things aright."
"They said, "You are only of the bewitched."
"You are naught but a mortal, like us; so, if you are truthful, bring us a Sign."
He said, "Here is a she-camel; she has its turn of drinking; and you will get your turn of the catchment."
And harm it not with any intent lest the torment of an awful day will seize you.
But then they hamstrung her; then they were remorseful.
So the torment seized them - herein is a sure Sign; yet most of them do not believe.
And indeed your God is Mighty, Merciful.
The people of Lut belied the messengers;
When their brother Lut said to them, "Will you not fear Allah?"
"I am indeed to you a messenger, trustworthy."
"So fear Allah and follow me."
"And I ask of you no wages for this; my wage is not but with the God of the worlds."
"Do you lust for males in the world?"
"Leaving your wives God has created for you? Nay, ye are a people transgressing."
They said, "O Lut! if you do not step aside, you will be surely be of those evicted."
He said, "I am truly a detester of what you do."
"My God, deliver me and my family from what these people do."
Thus did We deliver him and his family all together.
Except the old lady who stayed behind-
Then We destroyed others.
Then We made rain of evil pour on them; it was an awful rain upon the warned.
Indeed herein is a Sign; yet most of them do not believe.
And your God is surely Mighty, Merciful.
The people of the thicket belied the messengers;
When Shuaib said to them, "Will you not fear Allah?"
"I am indeed to you a messenger, trustworthy;"
"So fear Allah, and follow me."
"And I ask of you no wages for this; my wage is not but with the God of the worlds."
"Measure in full; lessen it not."
"And measure justly."
"And deprive not people their due and move not about the earth causing corruption."
"And fear He who created you and that were before you."
They said, "You are merely of those that are bewitched."
"You are naught but a man like us; indeed we regard you of the liars."
"So if you are truthful, make a piece of the sky fall on us."
He said, "My God knows well what ye do."
Then they belied him; so the torment of the day of black clouds overwhelmed them; it was indeed the punishment of a ghastly day.
Surely herein is a Sign; yet most of them do not believe.
And surely your God is Mighty, Merciful.
And surely it is sent down by the God of the worlds.
The trustworthy soul descended with it.
Upon your heart - haply you might be a warner.
Clearly, in Arabic.
Surely it is from the time of the descent of the Scriptures.
Is it not then a Sign for them that the learned among the descendants of Israel knew this?
And if We had sent it down on one whose tongue is not Arabic,
And even if he had recited this to them, they would not have been believers in it.
Thus do We push into the hearts of the wicked.
They will not believe in it until they behold the painful punishment.
So it will come to them suddenly when they are unaware.
They will ask, "Will we be respited?"
"Do they seek to hasten Our Punishment?"
Do not you see even if We allowed them, long happy years;
Then there comes to them what they were promised;
Then the happy days they had lived avail them naught.
And We destroyed not a city except that it had warners.
As a reminder; and We were not unjust.
And not the shaitans brought it down.
And it befits them not; neither are they able.
Verily, they are banished from hearing this.
So call not god besides Allah; lest you will be one of the chastised.
And warn those who are dear to you.
And lower thy wing to those believing followers.
But if they disobey you, then say, "I am quit of that you do."
And put your trust in the Mighty, the Merciful.
And He Sees when you are steadfast.
And your being with those who are humble.
Surely He is Hearing, Knowing.
Shall I tell you upon whom the shaitans descend?
They descend upon every sinful liar.
They give ear, but most of them are liars.
And the poets; only the erring follow them.
Have not you seen them, how they wander in every valley?
And surely they say that they do not do.
But except those who believe and stay righteous, revering Allah and avenge the unjust - and the unjust would surely know where they are to return.
Tha Seen@ - These letters are the Proofs of Quran, the clear Book.532
As guidance and glad tiding to the believers.
They obey God and spend with pure heart and sure of the Hereafter.
Surely to those who do not believe in the Lasting life, We made their works seem fair to them; so they wander wild.
For such of them is an evil punishment; and in their Lasting life, they will be the greatest losers.
Surely, you receive this Quran from One, All-Wise, All-Knowing.
When Musa said to his folks, "I certainly see a fire; I will bring you information from there; or I will bring a flaming brand, haply you shall warm yourselves."
So when Musa came to it he was called and said, "Blessed are those who are upon the Light and those who surround it; and Most Pure is Allah, the God of the worlds."
"O Musa, behold, it is I, Allah, All-Mighty, All-Wise.
"Cast down your staff!" But when he saw it as a creeping snake, he turned back and flee headlong. "Musa, fear not! surely the messengers fear not in My presence."
Except he who caused evil, - yet, I am indeed Most Forgiving, Most Merciful if he changes his evil to righteousness.
And put your hand into your bosom and take it out; it will come out spotless-white; it is of the nine signs to the Firaun and his people; they are indeed evil-living people.
Thus when Our manifest signs came to them, they said: "This is plain sorcery!"
And though their hearts knew it is true, they rejected it with pride, unjustly. Lo, and behold! what an evil end for the wicked.
And assuredly We gave wisdom to Dawood and Sulaiman; they both said, "All Praise be to Allah; it is He who raised us above most of the believing servants."
And Sulaiman became Dawood's heir; he said, "O men! We have been taught birds' language; and we have been given of everything; it indeed is a blessing, evident."
And for Sulaiman, forces from the jinns, men and the birds were gathered and set in ranks;
Until when they came close to the valley of anthill an ant said, "O Ants! enter your houses lest Sulaiman and his army crush you, being unaware."

Then he smiled at its saying, and said, "My God, help me with wisdom that I shall show gratitude to Thee for bestowing Thy grace upon me and upon my parents; and to do righteousness to Thy pleasure. And by Thy mercy join me with those of Thy righteous servants."
And as he inspected the birds, he said, "I do not see 'hudh-hudh' - any reason? Or is he among the absent?"
"Surely I will punish him with a severe punishment; or I will slay him; or he should bring me a clear evidence."
He had not waited for long; then he said, "I have come upon a thing that you have not apprehended; I have brought to you a sure tiding from Saba."
"Surely I saw a woman ruling them and she has been given everything; and she possesses a grand throne.

"And I found her and her people submitting to the sun apart from Allah; shaitan had made their work pleasing to them and had hindered them from the path of Allah; so  they are not in the straight path."
"That! they do not submit wholly to Allah, Who brings forth the hidden in the skies and in the earth and Who knows what you hide and what you proclaim?"
"There is no God but Allah; the God of the Exalted Throne."
He said, "Do you say the truth? or are you of the liars? We will soon know."
"Take this, my edict and drop it before them; then withdraw from them to see what they return."
Said she, "O Assembly! A dignified letter has been delivered to me."533
"Indeed it has come from Sulaiman; and surely it is, "In the Name of Allah, the Beneficent, Merciful."
"Show not your pride before me; come to me surrendering."
She said, "So, O Assembly! Put forth your suggestion in my affair, this; I have never decided my affairs except in your presence."534
They said, "We are mighty and a fierce force and the command is yours; so consider what you will command."535
She said, "If the kings enter a nation, surely they ruin it and demean its dignified ones; and thus too will they do."536
"So I will certainly send goodwill to them and see with what the emissaries return."
Thus when they came to Sulaiman, he said, "Help ye me with the things? What Allah has bestowed me with is better than what He has provided you; yet, it is you who are pleased in your gift."
Go ye back to them! Surely we will come to them with a force they cannot withstand; we will drive them out therefrom, disgraced; and they will be abased."
Said, "O assembly! Which of you will bring me her throne before they come unto me submitting."
Among the Jinn, Ifrith said, "I will bring it to you before you rise from your seat; I am indeed powerful for it, and trustworthy."

Said he who possessed the wisdom of the Book, "I will bring it to you before thy glance returns unto thee." And seeing it placed before him, he said, "This is blessing from my God, to test me if I am thankful or I am thankless; whoever is thankful, to him is his thankfulness; and whoever is thankless, then indeed my God is Needless, Noble."
He said, "Duplicate her throne; let us see if she is guided or she is of those, unguided."537
So when she came it was said to her, "Is your throne like this?" She said, "It is like it!" And we were given the wisdom before her, and we are a people for peace, 'Muslims'."
And what averted her was that which she was worshiping other than Allah; she is indeed of the people who disbelieved.538

It was said to her, "Enter the palace!" When she saw it, she thought it to be a virginal pool and she bared her upto her shins. He said, "It is indeed a palace built of brightly transparent glass." She said, "My God! I had indeed wronged my own soul; I am a Muslim unto Allah, the God of the worlds, with Sulaiman."
And certainly We sent to the people of Samud, their brother Salih that 'they call unto Allah'. But there they were, divided disputing.
He said, "O my people, why do you seek to hasten evil before good? And why do not you seek forgiveness of Allah that you might be blessed?"
They said, "We consider you and those with you as evil omen. He said, "Your evil omen is with Allah; yet you are a people on trial."
And in the city were nine men who were spreading corruption in the land without doing any good."539

They said, "We will swear by Allah that we certainly destroy him and his family by night. Then we shall certainly say to his heir, 'we did not witness your family's destruction and surely we are truthful'."
They plotted a plot; and We planned a plan without their knowing.540
See then how was the end of their plot; We ruined them and their entire population.541
See, yonder are their houses ruined, because they wronged; surely herein is the sign for those who know.
And We saved those who were faithful and feared God.
And Lut - to his people said, "Do you behave lewdly while you see?"
Do you approach men in preference to women, with lust? Ye are a people utterly ignorant."
His people had no answer except that they said, "Drive Lut's family out of your city; they are indeed too pure!"
But We delivered him and his family, except his wife; We decided she should be of those who stayed behind.
And We rained upon them an incessant downpour; and evil was that rain of them who  were warned.
Say, "All Praise be unto Allah; and may peace be upon His servants whom He had chosen! Is Allah best? Or what they associate?

Who created the heavens and the earth and brings down pure water from the sky? Therewith We create lush green pastures and gardens; you cannot make its trees grow; so, is there God with Allah? Nay. Yet, they are a people who associate.

Who made this world a place of dwelling and made the rivers flowing through it and the mountains for it; and caused a barrier between the two seas? Is there a God with Allah? Nay, most of them have no knowledge.
Who answers and removes your distress when you call Him in plight and made you successors in the land? Is there a God with Allah? Yet, you give little thought.
Who guides you in the darkness of the land and the sea and who sends you the breeze with good tidings before His Mercy? Is there a God with Allah? High Exalted be Allah from that they associate.
Who begins the creation and then creates it again? Who provides you from the sky and the earth? Is there a God with Allah? Say: "Bring your proofs if you speak truly.
Say: But Allah no one in the heavens and in the earth knows the secrecies and they know not when they will be raised.
Yet, very low is their knowledge about their end; they are in doubt thereunto; nay, they are blind to it.
And the disbelievers say, "What! we and our forefathers will really be brought back after we are dust?"
"We were promised this, forsooth, we and our fathers before; this is not any other than ancient-tales."
Say, "Travel about the earth and behold what was the end of the wicked."
And grieve not for them nor be you straitened for what they conspire.
And they say, "When is your promise, if you are truthful?"
Say, "Some of what you hasten on may be close behind you."
And your God indeed is bountiful to mankind; but most of them are thankless.
And your God surely knows what they hide in their breasts and what they declare.
And nothing is hidden in the heavens and the earth, but it is in the Book, clear.
Surely this Quran reveals to the descendants of Israel most of that concerning which they dispute.
And in it surely is the guidance and a mercy unto the believers.
Surely your God will judge between them by His Judgment - He is the Mighty, the Knowing.
So rely upon Allah; you are indeed upon the clear truth.
Surely you can not make the dead hear; even thus you cannot make the deaf hear the call when they turn away, retreating.
And you cannot guide the blind from their error - surely you can make none to hear except those who believe in Our Signs, for they submit to peace.
When their Promise befalls them We will bring forth for them a creature from the earth; it will surely speak to man that they had not believed in Our Signs. 542
And upon the day when we shall muster out of every nation the deniers of Our Signs as a force, duly disposed;-
Until, - when they come, He will say, "Were you denying My Signs while you could not encompass them? What were you doing?"
And because of their evil doings, the Word has come to pass; so they will not speak.
Do not they see, verily, We cause the night - that they may rest therein; and the day - that they may see; in it are the Signs for those who believe.
And the Day when the Word will be blown! Except those whom Allah saved everyone in the skies and the earth would be terrified. And all come unto Him, humbled.
And seeing the mountains, you deem them strong; they will fly like clouds- by the might of Allah, who strengthened everything. Verily He is All Aware of what you do.
Whoever brings good, will have better than that; and they will be free from fear that day.
And whoever brings evil, he will be flung headlong into fire - will ye be rewarded except for what you used to do?
I am only commanded to call Him who has made this city dignified; all things belong to Him; and I am commanded to be in peace with Him.
And I bring Quran to you - whoever takes to guidance it is for his good; and whoever strays away, then say, "I am only of the warner."
And say, "All Praise be unto Allah! Very soon He will reveal His Signs to you; then you will know them; and your God is not neglectful of what you do.
Tha, Seen, Meem543
These are the Signs of the clear Book.
We bring to you for the people of faith, in truth, of the events from the lives of Musa and Firaun.544

Verily Firaun exalted himself on the earth, dividing the people on the land into sections and abased a group of them; he slaughtered their menfolks and let live their womenfolks; surely he was among the wicked.
Yet, We willed to bestow Our Favour upon the abased, make them leaders and the heirs.545
And to establish them in the land and to show the forces of Firaun and Haman what they were dreading from them;-
We Inspired the mother of Musa, "Nurse him; if you fear, leave him in the river; thereafter fear not and grieve not. Surely We will return him unto you and will make him among the messengers."546
Firaun's folks took him, that he shall become an enemy and a grief to them; verily Firaun and Haman and their forces were wrong doers.
And Firaun's wife said, "He is refreshing to the eyes- to me and to you; kill him not; he may be a good tiding for us or we will take him for a son" - but they were not to know.
The heart of Musa's mother became desolated; she well nigh disclosed him had we not strengthened her heart, that she might be of the believers.
And she said to his sister, "Follow him." She kept her watch on him from a distance, without anyone noticing her."
And We had stopped him from suckling before. Said, "Shall I inform you of a family who would rear him for you and take care of him?"
Thus, that it refreshes the eyes of his mother and that she might not grieve; and that she may know Allah's word is true, We restored him to his mother - but most of them know not.
And when he reached full age and was ripe We gave him judgment and wisdom - thus do We reward the good-doers.

He entered the city when the people retired; there he saw two men fighting. One was of his caste and the other was of his enemy; the one who was of his caste cried out for help against the enemy. Musa with a blow finished him; he said, "This is the work of shaitan; surely he is an enemy in manifest error."
He cried out, "My God! I have certainly wronged myself; so forgive me!" Then He forgave him; surely He is Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.
He said, "My God! As You have favoured me, I will nevermore be a helper to the criminals."
And in the morning when he was observing the city with fear, the one who cried out to him the day before, cried out to him again. Musa said, "You are indeed an impetuous."
Then Musa when lunged forward to catch their enemy, he said, "Musa! are you going to kill me as you killed a man yesterday? You always prefer wrong doing and you are not of the peace making."
Then a man from a remote corner came running said, "O Musa! Surely the chieftains jointly conspire to kill you; so exit! Surely I am one of your sincere advisers."
So with fear, he carefully left the city. He said, "My God! Save me from these wrong doers."
And when he came to Madhyan, he said, "It is that my God shall guide me aright."

And when he came to the water of Madhyan0, there he saw a group of people watering; apart from them he found two girls holding back their flocks. He said, "What is you need here?" They said, "Until these shepherds drive away we cannot draw water - and we have very old father."
So he watered for them; then he turned back to the shade and said, "My God! I am indeed in need of whatever good you would send down for me."

Later, of the two girls one came before Musa with hesitation and said, "My father invites you to give you the wage for having watered for us." Thus when Musa came to him, he narrated his situation. He said, "Fear not. You have escaped from the wrong doing nation."
Of the two girls one said, "Father, hire him; surely he is the best whom you would hire; he is strong, trusty."

He said, "Upon that you shall serve me for eight years, I certainly wish one of these, my daughters weds you - but if you could complete ten, that is your wish; I intend not strait to you; if Allah will you would see me of the good."547
He said, "This is the condition between you and me; there is no blame to me, of the two terms whichever I complete; and Allah is surety over what we say.

Thus when Musa was journeying with his family completing the term, he saw a flash by the 'Thur' and said to his folks, "Surely I see a torch; I will bring you a news from there or a burning firebrand that you may warm yourselves."
So when he came to it, in a blessed place on the right side of the valley, from a tree a voice called and said: "O Musa! I am indeed Allah, God of the worlds."548
"Throw down your staff!" When he saw it becoming a serpent creeping, turning away he fled headlong. "O Musa! Come forward; and fear not; surely you are of the secured."

"Push your hand into your pocket and it will come out pure white; and when you fear push your hands into your sides. These are the two Signs meant for Firaun and his chieftains from your God. Surely they are a people sinning."
He said, "My God! verily I had killed one of them; so I fear they might kill me."
And my brother Harun! He is clearer in communication than me and so send him with me as a helper to confirm me; surely I fear they will cry me lies."
Said He, "We will strengthen your arms with your brother and will give you both the power so they cannot touch you; you two, and those who followed you will exalt over them by Our Signs."
So when Musa came to them with Our clear Signs, they said: "This is no other than a magical tale and we had not heard of this of our ancients."
Musa said, "My God knows who is of His guidance and whose stable is stable. Verily the wicked will not succeed."
And Firaun said, "O Chiefs! But for me I know not there is a God for you; O Haman! Raise a tower upon the baked clay; so I shall mount and see Musa's God; and I deem him of the liars!"
And he and his forces were unjustly arrogant in the land; and they deemed they would not be brought back to us.
So we seized him and his forces and cast them into the sea; behold, what a tragedy to the transgressors.
And We made them leaders taking them to fire; and they will not be helped on the lasting day.
And in this world we made curse to pursue them who on the Judgment Day will be of the condemned.
And after We had destroyed the ancient generations, We indeed gave Musa the Book with wisdom, guidance and mercy - that man shall reflect.
But when We gave Our Commandments to Musa, you were not by Us, nor were you a witness.
And We raised up generation upon whom the times have passed; and you were not a dweller amidst Madhyan, reciting to them Our Signs; yet We were senders.
And you weren't  by the Thur when We called; yet, those to whom We had not sent a warner - as a warning, a grace from your God that they might heed.

When an affliction touches them because of what their hands have forwarded, and that they shall not say: "Our God! Is it not that you had sent a messenger upon us? Then We would have abode by Your Signs and been of the believers."

Yet, when the Truth from Us came to them, they say: "Why was he not given as that what Musa was given?" What! did they not reject what Musa was given before? And they say, "Two magics, supporting each other; surely we reject everything."549
So say, "If you are truthful, bring from Allah that which gives better guidance than these that I may follow it."

If they do not answer you, know that they follow their desires. And who is more astray than he who follows his desires without the directions from Allah? Surely Allah will not guide the transgressing people.
And that they may give heed We kept sending them the word.
Those to whom We had given the Book before it, they believe in this.550
And when Our Signs are recited to them they say: "We believe this. Verily this is the Truth from Our God and we were ever at peace with this before."
They will be rewarded twice for their patience; and they repel evil with good and expend from what We have provided them.
And when they hear vain talks, they slight and say, "To us our deeds and to you your deeds; may peace be upon you! We desire not those who pass off."
You cannot guide whom you like but Allah guides whom He will. And He knows who befits guidance.

And they say, "If we were to follow the straight path with you, we would be thrown out of our land." Have We not settled them in a sure sanctuary whereunto was brought the fruits of all kinds, as a provision from Us? But most of them know not.

How many a nation have We destroyed because of their froward transgression; all these were the places where they dwelled; and after them none lived there but for a while. Then, it is We, the inheritors.
And whatever things you were allowed is the fun and glamour of this world; but what is with Allah is, infinitely exalting; will you then not know?
Is the one, to whom We have given from Us a fair promise, unfailing, equal to him to whom We have allowed the meanest pleasure of this world, to be seized in the end?
And on the Day when they are called, he would say, "Where are they whom you deemed as associates to Me?"

Those upon whom the pronouncement is made would say, "Our God, these are they whom we led astray; we led them astray even as we ourselves were astray - and we declare to You, our innocence; they were not worshiping us."
And it will be said: "Call your associates!" They will call them; but they will not answer them; and they will see their torment. Lo! if only were they righteous!
And on the Day of their call He will ask: "With what did you answer your messengers?"
But on the Day, all their affairs will be closed; neither will they ask one of another.
But whoso reforms, believes and behaves, they are of the guided.
And your God creates what He intends and chooses; choice is not theirs. Allah is Most Pure and Exalted be He, from what they associate.
And your God knows well what their breasts conceal and what they publish.
And He is Allah, there is no God but He. Glory be unto Him before and ever; His is the authority of Justice; and you will be returned unto Him.
Say: "Think ye, if Allah were to make night permanent over you to the last day, Who is the God beside Allah who will bring you light? Will you not hear?"
Say: "Think ye, if Allah were to make day permanent over you to the last day, who is the God beside Allah will bring you night to rest therein? Will you not see?"
And He by His Mercy made night and day for you that you may rest therein and to seek His Grace; so be grateful!
And He would ask on the day of calling, "Where are My associates whom you deemed?"
And We, while keeping witness from each nation, will say, "Bring your proof!" Then they will know, 'The Truth belongs to Allah' - and all that they forged will vanish.

Surely Qaroon belonged to Musa's community; yet he committed atrocities against them. We had given him treasures - and verily, its keys were heavier even to the heaviest. Then their people said to him, "Be not proud; Allah likes not the proud."

"And seek eternal house from what Allah has given you and do not forget your portion of the world; do good as Allah had done good to you and desire not corruption in the land; surely Allah loves not the corrupters."

Said he, "I am endowed this because of my certain knowledge." Did he not know that Allah had destroyed those who were even stronger and more abundant in possession than he? But the guilty will not be asked about their sins."
Then he went before the people in his pomp; those who loved this world said, "Ah, would that we had the like of what was given to Qaroon? Surely he is lord, mightily blessed!"
Those who were given the true knowledge said, "Woe upon you, the reward of Allah is better if you believe and stay righteous; yet none shall attain it except who is patient."
So We caused the earth to swallow Qaroon and his house and there was no host to help him against Allah; and he was helpless to himself.

Those who longed to be in his place the day before said, "Ah, Allah increases provisions to whom He Will of his servants and reduces in measure; had Allah not shown us Mercy, He would have made us to be swallowed too. Ah, the unbelievers will not prosper."
We will reward the eternal home only to those who would not exalt and spread not corruption in the land; beautiful end is only for the God fearing.
Whoever brings good, for him is better than that and whoever does evil the evil doers will not be punished but for that they used to do.
Verily He who hath ordained this Quran upon you shall again return you to the blessed place. Say, "My God is Well-Aware who has brought righteousness with him.
And you did not expect the Book would be revealed to you except by the Mercy of  your God. So be not a supporter for the unbelievers.
And let not anything deviate you away after the Signs from Allah has reached you; and call to your God and become not of the associators.
Follow not a god besides Allah; there is no god but He; and all things vanish except His Guidance. His is the Judgment. And unto Him you shall be returned.
Alif Laam Meem 551
Do the men think they will be left to say 'we believe', and will not be tried?
Surely We tried those before them - verily Allah knows the truthful and knows certainly the liars.
Or, is it that the unjust think, they would escape us? Ill, they judge.
Whoever believes his meeting with Allah, surely Allah's Hour is coming; He is Hearing, Knowing.
And whoever strives, indeed strives for himself; lo! Allah is needless of all creations.
So, those who believe and stay righteous, We will surely remove their evil from them; and We will surely recompense them with a reward greater than their due.

We enjoined upon man kindness to his parents; and do not obey them if they force you to set up partners to Me that whereof you have no knowledge;  unto Me is your return and I will inform you of what you used to do.
And those who believe and stay righteous, We will surely join them with the righteous.

And of the people is he who says, "We believe in Allah; but if a trial touches them in Allah's path, they take it as the punishment of Allah while it is caused by the men. But when Allah's help comes to them, they say, "Surely we were with you! Does not Allah know what is in the breasts of the people of the worlds?"
And Allah does know the believers and Allah knows the hypocrites.552
And the disbelievers say to the believers, "Follow our way; we shall bear your sins." "But they are not the bearers of their own sins; they are indeed, liars."553
They shall bear their burden and bear the burden upon their burden; and they shall be surely questioned on the lasting day concerning that they forged.
And We certainly sent Nuh to his people who tarried amidst them fifty short of a thousand years; but the flood engulfed them while they were wrong doers.
But We saved him and those who were in the ark and We made it a Sign for the inhabitants of the world.
And Ibrahim, when he said to his people: "Call upon Allah and fear Him; that is better for you, did you know.

You worship the idols but Allah; and you only invent a lie; surely, save Allah, none that you worship shall avail you aught; so turn to Allah for your needs; call only on Him and be faithful to Him; and unto Him ye shall be returned.
And if you cry lies, those before you cried lies too; so upon the messenger is not but to deliver, clear.
Do not you think how Allah begins creation and creates again? Verily, it is easy to Allah.
Say, "Journey through the earth and behold how He causes a creation to begin and how Allah originates the latter creations; verily Allah is Able over all things." 554
He punishes whom He will and graces whom He will - and you will be returned unto Him.
And you shall not over rule the earth or the sky; and neither you have a protector nor a helper other than Allah.
And whoever rejects the Signs of Allah and meeting with Him are they who are despaired about My Grace. And for them is a painful torment.
The only answer of his people were but this: 'Kill him or burn him'. But Allah saved him from the fire; surely in it are the Signs for the believers.

And said, "You have taken for worshiping other than Allah because of your love among yourselves in this world; then on the day of reckoning, you will reject each other and curse one another; and your refuge is fire; and you shall have no helpers."
Lut believed in him and said: "I will leave my livelihood for my God's sake. Surely He is the Mighty, the Wise."
And We gave him Ishaq and Yaqub and We gave their descendants prophecies and wisdom; and We gave his reward in this world; surely in the hereafter he will be among the righteous.
And Lut, said to his people: "You have indeed dared exhibiting such abhorrence that none in the world has ever exhibited before you."555

He said, "What! ye approach men? And cut the way; and you behave with moral looseness in your assemblies. The answer of his people was nothing but to say, "Bring upon us the doom of Allah if you are a truth sayer."
Then he said, "My God! Help me against the corrupting people."
When Our messengers came to Ibrahim with good news, they said, "Surely we are destroyers of that city for they truly are sinners."556
He said, "Lo! Lut is in it." They said, "We know very well who is in it; so we shall surely deliver him and his family except his wife; she will be of those who tarry."

And when Our messengers came to Lut, he was sad for them and was distressed on their account. They said, "Fear not, worry neither; we shall surely deliver you and your family except your wife; she will be of those who tarry."
"We indeed will bring down the torment from the sky upon the people of the town for the evil they do."557
And for the knowing, We have certainly left in this a Sign, manifest.
And to Madhyan We sent their brother, Shuaib. He said, "O my people! Call only upon Allah and rely on him till the last day; and stray not in the earth spreading evil."
But they denied him; so earthquake seized them and the morning found them prone dead in their homes.
And the Aad and Samud; and they are clear to you from their dwellings; because shaitan made their works fair seeming to them and barred them from their straight path, while they know well.
And Qarun, and Firaun and Haman: Musa indeed came to them with clear Signs. Yet, they were arrogant on the earth and they could not escape.

Thus we seized each one by the account of their sins individually; upon some We sent the hail storm; and the blast seized some; and some were buried, and some others did We drown. Allah wronged them not but they wronged themselves.
The parable of those who take other protectors than Allah is as that of a spider who built a house - surely the frailest of houses is the house of a spider, if only they knew.
Surely Allah knows whichever they call upon besides Him; and He is the Mighty, the Wise.
Thus We expound similes for mankind but none will receive it save those who remember.
Allah has created the heavens and the earth in truth; in it indeed, is the Sign for the believers.

Make clear what is revealed to you of the Book, and stand firm. Surely standing firm by the command of Allah shall avert the indecencies and evil; certainly greater is Allah's remembrance; and Allah is aware of what you do.
And thus, We have sent down to you the Book; so those to whom We have given the Book, they believe in it; and there are such who believe in it - and none would reject Our Signs but the unbelievers.
And you were never the knower of this before from any Book; nor were you the writer of it, with your right hand; if it were so, these liars could suspect.
Yet, in whom the revelation was given, their hearts possess it as clear Signs; and none will reject Our Signs but the wicked.
And they say, "Why has not been sent down to him, the Signs from His God? Say, "The Signs are with Allah and I am a plain warner."
What! Is it not sufficient for them that We had sent down to you, the Guidance? Assuredly in it is the mercy and the clarity for the believers.
Say, "Allah suffices as witness between me and you; and He knows what is in the heavens and the earth; so the losers are they who believe in the lies rejecting Allah."
And they hasten you for the torment; and had it not been for a respite, the torment would have reached them; yet, it will surely come to them while they perceive not.
They urge you to hasten the torment and surely the hell is to surround the rejecters.
On that Day, the torment will cover them from above them and from under their feet; and He will say, "Taste what you were doing!"
"O My believing bondmen, surely My earth is vast; so call unto Me."
Each one shall taste of death; then, you will be returned to Us.
They endured and put their trust in their God.
And how many a creature - they carry not their foods; Allah provides them and you; and He is ever the Hearer, the Knower.
And when you ask them, "Who has created the heavens and the earth - and the sun and the moon, and then subjected them?", they will surely say, "Allah!" So, whence are they then turned away?
Allah, of His bondsmen, expands provisions to whom He will - and shrinks to him; surely Allah is the Knower of each thing.

And if you ask them, "Who sends down rain from the sky and therewith revives the earth, after it is dead?", they would surely say, "Allah!" Say, "All Praise be unto Allah." Yet, most of them will not understand.
And the worldly life is nothing but pomp and show; but surely, the final house - therein is the life for sure, did they but know.559
And when they embark on a ship, they call upon Allah, fearing; but when He brings them to the shore, they associate others with Him.
Let them enjoy, turning away for what We have provided them - soon will they know.
Do they see not, We had securely placed them amidst a people who could be snatched away? Will they believe deception, rejecting Allah's grace?
And who is more unjust than he who invents a lie against Allah, or belies the Truth when it has come to him? Is hell not the refuge for the rejecters?
And whoever strives in Our way, We indeed guide them in Our Straight Paths; verily, Allah is with the righteous.
Alif Laam Meem - A L M 560
Rum has fallen!561
In the near land! But they, after their fall, will triumph.
In a short period; the command is Allah's - before and after; and on that Day, the believers will rejoice.
This is the Promise of Allah - He fails not in His Promise, but most understand not.
They only know the outwardness of this worldly life - and, they are heedless of the next life.

Do they not consider? Allah has not created all that is in the heavens and in the earth and everything in between but for a period specified, and in truth? Most of the humankind belie the meeting with their God.

Do they not see the world around and know the end of the people before them? They were mightier than them and did agriculture, and they used the land better than how they used it; and, to them their messengers came with clear proofs; Allah never did them wrong, but they wronged themselves.
Then when they belied Allah's Signs and mocked it, - lo! evil was the end of the evil doers.
Allah begins the creations, then recreates - then, unto Him you will be returned.
And on the Hour, the wicked will despair.
Then none of those whom they had associated will ever intercede for them, and will despair of those whom they did associate.
And on the Hour of the Day, they shall sunder.
So, whoever believe and stay righteous they shall live with joy in a green meadow.
And as to those who became disbelievers in Our Signs and denied the meeting on the last day, will be arraigned into the punishment.
So, Praise the Purity of Allah, as you course through the eventide, and as ye rise in the morn.
And all Praise be unto Him in the heavens and earth - and in the eventide and at noon.
He brings forth the living from the dead; and brings forth the dead from the living; and revives the earth after it is dead - thus, will ye be raised up.
And that He has created you from the dust, and your spreading out as human beings are among His Signs.
And of His Signs is that He created from among you, your pair, wherein you find comfort and in that He has caused Love and Mercy between you. Indeed, in it are the Signs for those who reflect.
And of His Signs is the creation of heavens and the earth; and your varied tongues, and colours. Indeed, in it are the Signs for those who know.
And of His Mercy is, in the night and day, and your sleep, and your seeking of His bounties. Surely, herein are the Signs for those who have ears.

And of His Signs is that He shows the lightning, wherein is fear and hope; and, sends down rain from the sky thereby revives the earth after it is dead. Surely, in it are the Signs for those who give thought.
And of His Signs is that by His command the heavens and the earth withstand. Then, when there is a call, you will emerge from the earth.
And to Him belongs what is in the heavens and the earth. All obey Him.
And He begins creations - then originates; and it is easy for Him. And to Him belongs all the Beautiful Names in the heavens and the earth; He is the Mighty, the Wise.

He sets forth a similitude for you from among you: Do you share that which Allah has bestowed upon you and make yourself equal with those whom your right hand possesses? Or, do you fear them as you fear those of your likes? Thus, do We reveal to those who comprehend.
But the evil ones chase only their desires without sense - so, who shall guide him, whom Allah had left astray? And they have no helpers!

So fix your direction upon the straight path. The Way Allah has created the humankind is the straight path. There is no change in Allah's creation. It is the direction, firm - but most men will not understand.562
Turn only in His direction with piety and stand steadfast in God's remembrance. And become not of the associators.
Whoever causes schisms in the straight path, each schismatic rejoices in what he has.
When the people suffer an affliction, they turn only to their God; and they pray to Him alone. Then, when He makes them taste from His Mercy, a section among them set up partners to their God.
Let them be rejecting, Our Mercy. "Keep enjoying; soon you will know."
Or, have We sent down upon them a Sign as a proof for their associating?
And they rejoice when We make the people taste the Mercy. But behold, they despair when an evil befalls them for what their hands have forwarded.
Do they not see Allah indeed expands and restricts the provisions to whom He will? Certainly in it are the Signs for people who believe.
So, grant the near ones their right and thus, to the righteous. Whoever seek Allah's countenance, it is best for them; they are the victors.

If you lend the investment of the people for the interest, it will not increase with Allah. But when you seek Allah's satisfaction and purification, it will increase with Allah; and, whoever would lend in this way, are they who had doubled.

Allah created you and then gave you comforts; then, He causes your death - then, again raises you up. Is there any of your deities does aught of these? Allah is the Most Pure, and He is the Most High and above what they associate.
Corruption erupted in the land and sea for what the men had wrought with their hands; and He makes them taste a little of what they had worked so that they may return.
Say, "Travel through the land and behold what happened to those before you. Most of them were associators."
So, establish your face in the straight path, before a day from Allah that none can stall, arrives. On that day, they will dissociate.
Whoever reject, evil for them is their rejection; and, whoever do good, they only prepare themselves for the best.
He bestows of His Bounties to those who believe and stay righteous; indeed, He does not like the disbelievers.

And among His Signs - that He sends the winds bearing the glad tidings; and, that He lets you taste of His Mercy; and, that He sails the ship at His Command; and, that you may seek of His Bounties - and, that you may show thanks to Him.
And Verily, We sent messengers before you to their people. And they came to them with clear Signs. Then We took retribution on those who sinned - then, it is upon Us to favour the believers.

It is Allah who sends the winds, raising clouds and spreads them in the sky in chunks as He wills; so, you see the rain coming down from its density; then, when He brings upon whom He wills of His bondsmen, they rejoice.
But they indeed were in despair before it came upon them, and before it.
So, look at the prints of Allah's Mercy; how He quickens the earth after it is dead; indeed, He is the quickener of the dead and He has power over all things.
But when they see Us send a wind and find them turn yellow, then they become unbelievers.563
So, indeed you shall not make the dead hear; neither would you make the deaf hear who turns away, rejecting.
And you shall not guide the blind out of their error; neither you shall make any hear save those who would surrender to Our Signs, believing.

Allah created you as a weakling; then, after the weakness He gave strength; then, after strength, He causes weakness and greying. He creates what He will; and, is the Knower of all things. The All-Powerful.
And on the Lasting Hour, the sinners would swear that they had not tarried but a snap; thus were they deluded.
And those who were given the wisdom and faith would say, 'by Allah's count, you tarried until you were raised up! So, this is the day of Upraising and you were ignorant'.
So, on that day, the excuses of the sinners avail them nought; nor could they appease.
In faith, in this Quran, We have enumerated many an example for humankind. But, if you were to bring any truth before them the unbelievers would surely say, "Ye, but liars!"
Thus, Allah seals the hearts of the ignorant.
So, be patient. Verily, Allah's Promise is True. And, let not those who are uncertain dishearten you.
Alif, Laam, Meem - A L M 564
These are the Signs of the Book of Wisdom.565
A Guidance and Mercy for the righteous.
They will ever be in Allah's remembrance and give of the purest things; and they will have firm faith in the lasting life, in the end.
These are them upon the guidance of their God and they are the victors.
And there are of men - they, pervertedly, acquire fantasies to obstruct Allah's path and to take it in mockery. For them is the humiliating punishment.
And when We recite Our Signs to him, he turns away in arrogance as if he had not heard them - that he has deafness in both the ears. Admonish him: 'For him is the chastising doom'.
Verily, for those who believe and stay righteous, are the Graceful Paradises.
They will abide therein - Allah's Promise is True. He is the Exalted, the Wise.

He has raised the skies without the supports566 and that you see them. And He erected firm, the mountains upon the earth - that it shall not shake with you; and He made all varieties of cattle spread upon it. And We sent down the rain from the sky and caused the produces to grow and paired them with their noble kind.
"Such are Allah's creation - show me those but Him, who have created a thing." Nay! The wrongdoers are in clear error.
And Verily, We gave wisdom to Lukmaan: "Be grateful to Allah; for, whoever shows gratitude, he shows gratitude for his self; and whoever rejects - surely, Allah is Needless, Glorious."
And when Lukmaan said to his son, "My dear son, set not association to Allah; surely, association is a grave injustice."

And, We have advised man concerning his parents; his mother borne him in weakness upon weakness; and weaning him away is two years. So, be grateful to Me and to your parents; and, Unto Me is your return.

But if they force you to set partners unto Me, that of which you have no knowledge, then, obey them not; but consort with them in the world kindly. And follow the path of those who always look up to Me; and then, your return is unto Me - then, I will reveal to you what you used to do.
"My dear son, even if it is of the weight of a mustard seed, and it is inside a rock, or in the skies, or in the depth of the earth - Allah will bring it forth; Allah indeed, is Subtle, All-Aware.
"My dear son, stay constant in obeying Allah; and, enjoin the good and forbid the evil; and, be patient over evil that befalls you - this indeed, is the steadfast heart of things.
"And turn not your cheek from men; and walk not exultant on the earth. Surely, Allah will not love any vainglorious conceit.
"And be moderate in your conduct and be kind in your voice; the most hateful of the voices is indeed the noise of the donkeys.

Do you not see that Allah surely has subjected to you what is in the heavens and what is in the earth and that He has abundantly placed His benevolence within you and outside of you? But there are people, who argue concerning Allah without knowledge, guidance and the luminous wisdom.

When it is said to them, "Follow that which Allah has sent down to you", they say: "We will follow only that wherein we found our forefathers." What! Even when the shaitan calls them to the blazing fire?"
And whoever turns his heart to Allah doing good deeds, has surely grasped a firm handhold; and, with Allah rest the End of all affairs.
And whoever rejects, his rejection need not grieve you; their return is unto Us. Then, We will inform them of what they used to do - surely, Allah knows what is in the breasts.
We give them enjoyment a little; then, We will thrust them into severe and agonising torment.
And if you say to them, "Who created the skies and the earth?" They will surely say, "Allah!" Say: Praise be to Allah! But most of them do not understand.
Unto Allah belongs whatever is in the heavens and the earth. Verily, Allah is Free of Need, worthy of All-Praise.
And surely, even if all the woods on the earth are pens, and the seas, and seven more such are added - the Names of Allah will be far from finished. Verily, Allah is the Exalted, the Wise.567
Your creation and your raising up are not but as a sole, soul; surely, Allah is the Hearer, the Seer.

Do you not see Allah ushers the night into day and the day into night; and, that He has subjected to you the sun and moon; and, each completing its term decreed. Allah indeed, is Ever-Cognisant of your works.
For surely, Allah is the Truth and whatever they call upon other than Him are falsehood; and Allah is Most High, Most Great.
Do you not see that the ships with Allah's bestow sail in the sea, perchance you see Allah's Signs? In it indeed are the Signs for every one forbearing, grateful.

And if mountainous waves cover them, they sincerely call Allah in the soul of their hearts; but if He delivers them safe to the shore, some take to the middle path - yet, but for the treacherous ingrate, none rejects the Warnings.

O humans! Fear your God; and fear that Day - a father shall not help his son; and the son cannot carry out anything for his father; indeed, Allah's Words are True. So, the worldly life of the people shall not deceive you, nor the deceiver deceives you regarding Allah.

Surely, with Allah, is the knowledge of the Hour; it is He who sends down the rain and knows what is in the wombs; and, none knows what he will earn tomorrow; nor perceives where on the earth would he die. Verily, Allah is the Knower, the Astute.
Alif, Laam, Meem - A L M568
As to the Revelation of the Book, there is no doubt it is from the God of the worlds.
Or do they say, "He has conjured this?" Nay! This is the Truthful warning from your God to a people to whom has not come a warner before you, that haply they are guided.

It is Allah who has created heavens and the earth and whatever is in between, in six periods; and then, He placed His authority over them all; there is no helper nor an interceder for you besides Him; so, will you not mind?
He conducts the affairs from the sky to the earth; then, on a day, it will ascend to Him whose extent is a thousand years in your count.
He is the Knower of what is hidden and manifest. He is the  Mighty, the Merciful.
It is He who beautified each of His creation; and, He began the creation of humanity from clay.
Then He created his generations from the essence of a drop despised.
Then He breathed into him His Revelation and caused perfection to your hearing, and sight, and hearts; little thanks you show.
And they say, "When we become dust, will we be truly in a new creation?" Nay, they reject the meeting with their God.
The 'angel of death' assigned upon you will take you and then you will be returned to your God.
When you see the sinners hanging their heads before their God and say, "Our God! We have witnessed - henceforth, send us back; we will be righteous; surely, we believe."
And if We had willed We would have guided each. But, My stern Word that I would fill the hell with Jinn and Men together had gone forth.
So, taste for your denial of the meeting of this day of yours; indeed, We too forget you. And taste the lasting torment for what you did.
The ones who believe in Our Signs are those, who when reminded of them would praise the purity of their God, in total surrender; and, they will not be boasting.
They will rise up from the bed and remember their God with fear and faith; and, they will spend of that We have bestowed upon them.
And no one shall know that We have hidden for them as comfort to eyes as reward for what they did.
Then, will the believers be like those who transgress? Nay!
As for those who believe and stay righteous, for them are the paradises as their abiding places for their deeds.
But whoever sins, their abode is fire - every time they try to escape it, they will be pushed back into it and said, "Taste the torment of fire which you had been denying."
And We will make them taste a nearer punishment before a greater torment touches them haply that they may return.
And who is more unjust than he, who turns away after he was reminded of his God's Signs? Surely, of the criminals, We shall take retribution.
Verily, We gave Musa the Book; so be not in doubt about his receiving; and, We made it a Guide for the descendants of Israel.
And when they endured and stood firm on Our Signs, We made among them, the guiding leaders.
Your God will judge between them on the Lasting Day, concerning that wherein they differed.
Is it not a guidance to them how many nations We destroyed before, and, in whose dwelling places they walk? Verily, in this are clear Signs. Will they not then heed?
Do they not see? It is We indeed drive the rain-clouds to the barren land and bring forth thereby the produces for them and their cattle. Do they not then see?
They ask: When is this victory if you speak truly?
Say: "On the day of the victory, their faith avails them not nor will they be respited."
So, dismiss them and expect; indeed, they do expect too.
O Prophet! Fear Allah and obey not the unbelievers and the treacherous. Verily, Allah is the Knowing, the Wise.
And follow that with which your God inspires you. Verily, Allah sees all that you do.
And rely on Allah. Allah is sufficient as a Trustee.

Allah has not created two minds in anyone's heart; and, because you say to any of your wives, "You are like my mother," He would not make them your mothers nor your adopted sons, your sons; all these are vanities from your mouth. Allah speaks the Truth and Guides aright.

You shall call them after their true fathers; and, if you do not know their fathers, they are your brethren and friends in righteousness; and if you had mistaken, no blame on you. But if your hearts do wrong - And, Allah is Most Forgiving, Most Merciful.

This Prophet - for the believers, is greater than themselves; and their wives are their mothers. And of the relations some are dearer than the believers and the emigrants. This is the Decree in Allah's Book: if you wish to help your friends, it is allowed.
And when We took the covenant from the prophets and you; and, from Nuh, Ibrahim, Musa and Esa, son of Maryam, We took a solemn covenant.
So, He will ask the truthful about their truth; and for those who disbelieve, He has prepared a chastising punishment.
O believers! Remember Allah's favours upon you; when the forces came down upon you, We drove upon them the wind, and, the forces you cannot see; and, Allah is Ever Watchful of what you do.
When they came upon you from above you and from below you - your sight swerved, your heart reached to the throats and you grew suspicious about Allah.
There the believers were tested and were shocked with a severe shock.
And remember when the hypocrites and those in whose hearts were the disease said, "Allah and His messenger has not promised us but deceit."

And among them when a party said, "O people of Yasrib! You shall not withstand; so turn back," a party of them said to the prophet, "Indeed, our homes are not safe," while truly it is not that they are unsafe - they only wished to flee.
And if the forces came upon them from different directions and were asked to cause confusion, then, they would have done so; and, would not have delayed it but a while.
And they have certainly sworn before Allah that they would not turn back. An oath to Allah, to be questioned of.
Say, "Flight from death or killing shall not benefit you - then, you shall comfort but a little while."
Say, "Who shall guide you if Allah intends harm for you? Or, if He intends a Mercy for you! They will not find for them besides Allah, a Guide nor any Helper."
Allah certainly knows those amidst you who hinder and say to their brethren, "Come to us!" And they do not face the evil but meekly.

They are niggardly towards you; but when fear grips them, you will find them looking at you with their eyes rolling, like one who swoons of death. But when the fear departs, they will sting you with their sharp tongues in their greed for wealth - such have not believed; so, Allah has destroyed their deeds; and, it is easy for Allah.

They think the forces have not left - if the forces are to return, they will wish they were of the ignorant inquiring news about you; yet, even if they had been with you, they would not have withstood but a little.
Surely, there is a perfect exemplar in the Messenger of Allah for those who believe in Allah, and in the lasting day; and, in those who, ever-remember Allah.
And when the believers saw the confederate enemies, said, "This is what Allah and His Messenger have prophesied; and, Allah and His Messenger are true; and, it only increased their belief and peace.
Of those who believed are they who lived up to the covenant; and, of them some reached their goal while others are expecting - they did not differ a trifle in their promise.
Allah will surely recompense the truthful for their truth; He will Punish whom He will or will Forgive - surely, Allah is Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.
And Allah repulsed the unbelievers away, in their rage; they gained no good; and, Allah suffices for the believers in their striving. Allah is All-Powerful, All-Mighty.
And He brought those of the people of the Book who helped, down from their fortresses and cast terror into their hearts; you killed some and some you made captive.
And He made you heirs for their lands, and their houses, and their wealth and to the extent of earth you had not imagined; and, Allah has Power over all things.
O Prophet! Say to your wives, "If you desire this world and its glamour, come, I will release you with provisions generous, gracious."
"But if you believe in Allah and His Messenger, and the House in the Hereafter, Allah indeed, has prepared for the good among you, a mighty reward."
"O wives of the Prophet! If any of you indulge in open lewdness, her punishment will be doubled; and, it is easy for Allah."
"And whoever of you obey Allah and His Messenger and do good, We would double her reward."
"O wives of the prophet! You are not as any of the women; if you fear God, then, speak not in casual terms lest in whose heart is a disease will desire; so, speak mindfully."

"Live in your houses! And roam not as you used to do ignorantly; and, surrender to God and give for your purity. And obey Allah and His Messenger. O the people of the houses, Allah only wishes to purify you, removing your evils."
And give thought to the Signs and Wisdom of Allah, recited in your houses - indeed, Allah is Most Gentle, All-Knowing.

Verily, Allah is Ever-Forgiving and has prepared a Magnanimous Reward for those peace-loving men and peace-loving women; the believing men and the believing women; the surrendering men and the surrendering women; the truthful men and the truthful women; the enduring men and the enduring women; the God-fearing men and the God-fearing women; the righteous men and the righteous women; the fasting men and the fasting women; the honourable men and the honourable women; and, those of the men and women who oft remember Allah.

And when Allah and His Messenger has decreed a thing, then over it, shall there be no options for a believing man or woman. So, whoever differs against Allah and His Messenger, surely they are in manifest error.

And when you said to him, to whom Allah has favoured, and you had favoured, "Keep your wife with you and fear Allah," you feared the people and concealed in your heart that which Allah was to reveal. But Allah has the greater right that you should fear Him. So, when Zayd has performed what is necessary to set her free, we gave her to you in marriage. It is because there shall not be a hindrance for the believers to marry the divorced wives of their adopted sons. And this is the decree of Allah to be fulfilled.
There is no wrong on the prophet that he fulfilled Allah's command; this has been Allah's Way with those who passed away of old. And Allah's command is a decree determined.
They will deliver Allah's Command and will fear only Allah; and, they will fear none but Allah. So, Allah suffices for accounting.
'Muhammad' has not been the father of any of your males. But he is a Messenger of Allah and the Seal of the Prophethood. And Allah Knows all.569
O believers, remember Allah more and more.
And Praise His Purity morning and evening-
It is He who showers His Grace upon you to bring you forth from darkness to light; and, His angels. And He is Merciful to the believers.
On the Day of their meeting Him, their greeting is, "PEACE!." And He has prepared for them a noble reward.
O Prophet, We have indeed sent you as a witness, and a bringer of good tiding and a warner;
Calling unto Allah by His leave, and as a luminous one.
So give the believers the good news that there awaits them Allah's Grace.
And obey not the disbelievers and hypocrites; and, heed not their hurt; but put your trust in Allah. And Allah suffices as Helper.
O believers, if you have married and divorced the believing women before touching them, there is no waiting period concerning them - so, release them with a beautiful grant of provisions.

O Prophet! We have indeed made lawful to you - those wives to whom you have given their dowries, and, those whom you righteously possess of whom Allah had favoured you. And, the daughters of your father's brothers, the daughters of your father's sisters, the daughters of your mother's brothers and the daughters of your mother's sisters - of them who migrated with you. And, a believing woman, if sacrifices herself in the cause of the prophet and if the prophet consenting, - this is only for you excluding the believers. We are Well-Aware what We have commanded them about their wives and about whom they rightfully possess - so that there shall not be stress upon you. And Allah is Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful. 570

You can exempt whom you will of them and retain whom you will; or, take back of them whom you had deferred - there is no blame on you; so that it is reassurance to their hearts and that they shall be free from dissatisfaction; and, that each of them are at ease with what you had entrusted them - this is the easy way. And Allah is aware of what you have in your breasts; and, Allah is All-Knowing, Forbearing.

After this, it is not lawful for you to have women other than what you possess in righteousness - and, not to change wives however pleasing their manners are to you. Allah is Vigilant over all things.

O believers, unless invited enter not the houses of the Prophet anticipating a feast; but if called then step in; and when you have feasted, disperse and stay not indulging in 'hadiths' - abominable talks; it shall embarrass the Prophet. He may hesitate to condemn you but, Allah will not falter to say the Truth. And, if you are to ask for anything from the Prophet's wives, ask them honourably; this will purify your hearts and their hearts. It does not befit you that you hurt the Messenger of Allah; and, you shall not marry his wives after him - indeed, it is a grave crime before Allah. 571
Whether you reveal a thing or conceal it, surely Allah is ever the Knower of all things.

It is no blame on them when they are - before their fathers, their sons, their brothers, the sons of their brothers, the sons of their sisters, their daughters and their right hand possessed ones. So, fear Allah. Allah indeed is a witness over all things.
Allah sends His blessings on the Prophet; and, the angels seek blessings for him. O, believers! Seek blessings on him and greet him with "Peace!"
Allah indeed curses those who hurt Allah and His Messenger in this world and the world to come; and, has prepared for them a disgraceful torment.
And those who malign the believing men and the believing women with what they had not done, surely they bear the slander and a manifest sin.

O, Prophet! say to your wives, your daughters and the women of the believers, "Wear your garments suitable to the land so that they shall be known and not troubled." And Allah is Ever Forgiving, Most Merciful.572

We will certainly urge you against the hypocrites who have evil in their hearts, and who indulge in false propaganda in the cities - if they do not restrain; then, they will be your neighbors but a while.
Accursed, they will be seized wherever they are found and culled to death.
Allah's Way - and for those who have gone before; and, you shall not find a change in Allah's Way.
People ask you concerning the Hour. Say: The Wisdom of it is only with Allah. Do you know it? It may be nigh!
Verily, Allah has cursed the rejecters and prepared for them a blaze.
They shall abide therein and will find for them neither a protector, nor a helper.
On that day when their faces are turned sides in the fire, they would say, 'woe to us! We should have obeyed Allah and the Messenger.'
And they will say, "Our God, verily, we followed our leaders and our elders, and they led us astray from the way."
"Our God, torment them twofold, and curse them with a mighty curse."
O believers! Be not like those who annoyed Musa, but Allah declared him quit of what they alleged, and he was ever with Allah in dignity.
O believers! Fear Allah and speak the just words.
He will make easy your affairs, and He will forgive your sins; and, whoever follows Allah and His Messenger, he has certainly won success, grand.
Verily, We had offered Our trust to the earth and the mountains, but they refused to bear it - they feared to undertake it; but, the man received it; surely, man is arrogant and ignorant

Allah will punish the hypocritical men and hypocritical women and the men and the women who set up partners to Allah. And He pardons the believing men and women. And Allah is Most Forgiving, Most Merciful.
All glory be to Allah! To Him belongs what is in the heavens and what is in the earth; and, His is the Praise of the Hour. And He is Most Wise, All-Knowing.
He knows that which enters the earth and what sprouts out, and that which descends from the heavens and what ascends to it. And He is Cognisant, All-Knowing.

Yet the rejecters say, "The Hour shall not come upon us!" Say, "Nay! By my God, surely it will come to you; and, He knows that which is unseen; in the heavens or on the earth an iota of a thing will not be hidden from Him; nor smaller than that nor bigger, it is in a clear record."
That the believing righteous shall receive the reward and for them is Forgiveness and generous provisions.
And those who strive to defeat Our Signs, for them is a painful torment.
Whoever is given the wisdom, they see that what is revealed to you from your God is the truth and, it takes us to the straight path of the Almighty and the Praiseworthy.
But those who reject say, "Shall we show you a man who announces that you will be a new creation after you had become dust with the dust?"
Or does he invent lies about Allah or is he mad? Nay, those who do not believe in the Hereafter are in agony and in serious error.

Do they not see what is before them and after them in the heavens and the earth? If We will, We would plunge them into the earth, or We would cause a piece from the sky to fall upon them; to every servant who look up to, indeed has a Sign in this.
And surely We bestowed Dawood Our Bounty: "O mountains! Follow through his command; and, O birds!" And We made iron soft for him.
"Make strongest war shields, and set right the weak points; and, do rightful deeds. Indeed, My watch over you is intent."

And to Sulaiman, the Winds - the distance of its speed was that of a month of morning and evening; and, We made the brass a stream for him, and We subjected the jinns for him by Our grant - of them whoever rebels, We will make him taste the blaze.

Fashioning for him whatsoever he would - magnificent monuments, immense statues, gigantic bowls, and anchored huge cooking pots. O descendants of Dawood! Be grateful. But of My servants, rare are they who show thanks.573

When We appointed death for him, nothing informed the jinns of his death except the termites that eroded his staff; and, when he fell, the jinns saw it clearly that had they got the knowledge of the unseen, they need not have been in the disdainful punishment.

Verily, for the Sabians, was there a Sign in the houses they lived; on their right and left there were twin gardens: "Taste from the good of what your God has bestowed and show thanks to Him - a bountiful land, and the Merciful God."
But they turned away. So We sent upon them a flood causing a dam-wreck; and, we gave them in exchange for the twin gardens, two gardens bearing sour and bitter fruits and a few lote-trees.
We recompensed them for their rejection. And will We recompense others but the rejecters?
And We have created between them and the cities We had blessed, towns apparent and well We measured between them the journeying:: "Travel therein by night and by day, securely!"

But they said, "Our God, increase the distance of our journeying." Thus they wronged themselves; and, so We made them a history and scattered them into a scatter. Indeed in this are the Signs for the enduring and the grateful.
And certainly Iblis proved true his assessment about them; and, they followed him, save the party of the believers.
But, he has no authority over them - yet, that We know the believers in the Hereafter from them who are in doubt thereof. And your God is the Guardian over all things.
Call them whom you have in mind besides Allah; they do not have an iota of authority over the skies or on the earth, nor do they have any share in them, nor he has in them a supporter.

And, save whom He has given permission, no intercession avails with Him. So, when the terror is removed from their hearts, they will say, "What did your God say?" They will answer: "The Truth! He is the All-High, the All-Great!"
Say, "Who provides you from the heavens and the earth?" And say, "Allah! Is it we or you - who indeed is guided aright or in manifest error?"
Say, "You shall not be asked of what we do, nor shall we be asked of what you do."
Our God will gather us all together; and then, He will judge between us in truth. He is the Greatest Judge, the All-Knowing.
Say, "Show me them whom you associated as equal with Him! Nay, He is Allah, the Mighty, the Wise."
And We sent not you but as a giver of glad tiding and a warner to humankind; yet, most of the people will not know.
And they say, "When is the word if you speak truly?"
Say, "Yours is an appointed Hour; neither will there be a delay nor hastening of it."

And the rejecters say, "We shall surely not believe this Quran and What was before it." If you find these sinners when they are brought before their God, some will turn to face some of them - those who were oppressed will say to those who were arrogant, "But for you, we would indeed have been believers."
Those who were arrogant will say to those who were oppressed, "Did we hinder you from the straight path after it has reached you? Nay, rather you were sinners."

The oppressed will say to the arrogant, "Nay, you conspired against us by night and day and caused us to reject Allah and that we should associate partners unto Allah." But when they see their agony, they will hide their remorse; and We will fetter their necks. Will they ever be recompensed except for what they used to do?
And to whichever town We send a warner the affluent therein would but say, "Surely we reject that which you had been sent with."
And they say, "We are mighty in wealth and people; so we shall not be punished."
Say, "My God increases the wealth upon whom He will and reduces too. But most of the people do not know."

And it is neither your wealth nor people would bring you near to us; but, whoever believe and do righteous deeds, to them is double the reward for what they did; and they will reside in peace in mansions, magnificent."
And those who strive to defeat Our Signs will be brought in pain.
Say, "Verily, my God will increase the wealth to whom He will of His bondmen; and, He decreases to whom He will. So He recompenses for whatever you spend, and He is the Best of Providers.
And on the day when He shall gather them all together, He would say to the angels, "Are these the ones, worshiping you?"
They will say, "You are Most Pure; You are our Deliverer and not these; yet, they were worshiping Jinns - and, most of them were believers in them."
We will say to those who sinned, "But this day you will neither be able to benefit nor harm one another; so, taste the torment of fire that which you used to deny."

And when Our clear Signs are recited to them, they say, "He is but a mortal, and he wishes to prevent you from that which your ancestors used to worship. And they say, "It is not but a conjured up lie." And when the Truth came to them, the unbelievers say, "It is sorcery, manifest!"
But We have not given them a scripture for revelation, nor have We sent them before you a warner.
And the people before them did strive to deny; and, they did not receive even a tenth of what We gave them. Yet, they cried lies to My messengers; so, how was My abhorrence.
Say: "I only advise you of one thing; rise and ponder for Allah, in twos or singly; your friend has no madness; he is not except a warner before a terrible suffering comes to you."
Say: "I seek not any wage of you; let it be with you. My wages are with none but Allah. He is over all things, Witness."
Say: My God indeed, raises the Truth; He Knows the hidden things.
Say: "The Truth has come! And, the falsehood has achieved nothing new thus far, and, no further."
Say: "If I err, erring is my loss; and, if I am on the straight path, it is because of the revelation from my God. Verily, He is Hearing, Nigh."
And if you see them tremble in fear, they will have no escape out; and, they will be easily seized.
And they will say, "We believe therein!" But how can they reach when they are afar off.
But before this, they rejected it, and from afar off were throwing at the Unseen.
And, as what was the destiny of their people before, there will be a barrier between them and their desires. Verily, they were in disquieting denial.

All Praise be to Allah, the Creator of the heavens and the earth; he made the angel messengers with wings in twos, threes and fours; and, He increases in creation what He wills. Verily, Allah has Power over all things.574
If ever Allah opens up a Grace upon a people there is none to withhold it; and, if He withholds, there is none to send it. And He is Mighty, Wise.
O mankind! Call to mind the favours of Allah upon you. Is there a creator other than Allah, who provides you from the heavens and the earth? There is no God but He; whence then ye turn away?
And if they deny you, they indeed denied the messengers before you. And to Allah return, all affairs.
O men! Indeed Allah's Promise is true; so, let not this world's life deceive you; and, let not the deceiver deceive you about Allah.
Surely, shaitan is your enemy; so take him for an enemy. He calls his people only to make them the inheritors of the blaze.

Him, to whom the evil of his deeds shown fair, and he himself considers it fair - for indeed, Allah leaves astray whom He will, and guides whom He will. So, grieve not for them as to lose your life; Allah surely knows what they do.
And Allah send the winds that move the clouds - then We cause it to reach the dead land, and therewith We revive the land after it is dead. Thus is the rising, live.

Whoever wishes dignity - All dignity belong to Allah; every word of dignity ascends to Him; and, He dignifies all good deeds. As to those who conspire evil, awaits a harsh chastisement; and their conspiracy will come to naught.

And Allah created you from the sand; then from a drop - then he made you companions; but for His knowledge, no woman conceives nor delivers. Likewise to increase or decrease from one's age, it is not that that which is not in the words of Allah; indeed, it is easy to Allah.

And the two seas are not equal. One is fresh and sweet to drink while the other is salt and bitter; yet, from each of these you eat tasty meat and deck out the ornaments you wear; and, you see the ships cleaving the waters for you to seek His Bounties; will you not then show thanks?

It is He Who thrusts the night into the day, and the day into the night; He holds the sun and the moon under His domain, and all these exist within the time frame determined. He is your God, Allah! And whoever you call besides Him, have no power even to the husk of a date stone.
