If you call them, they will not hear your call; and, if they hear, they will not answer you; and, on the last day, they will disown your worshiping them; and, none will inform you as the All-Encompassing.
O people! You are ever in need of the help of Allah. But Allah! He is All-Sufficient, All-Praised.
If He so wish, He would eliminate you and bring forth a new generation.
And it is not a matter for Allah.

Now soul laden, will bear the load of another; and, if you call your nearest kin to carry some of your heaviest burdens - a little of it will not be borne.  And you will only warn those who fear their God soulfully and follow His Command; and, whoever is pure, he is pure for his own good; and, to Allah is the homecoming.
The blind and the seeing are not the same;
nor the darkness and light;
nor the shade and the heat.
And not equal are the living and the dead; verily, Allah causes to hear whom He will; and, you make not hear who are in the graves.
You are not a but a warner.
Verily, We have sent you in truth that you may give glad tiding and as a warner; and, there is not a people, to whom a warner has not come.
And if they deny you, surely those before them too denied; and, their messengers had come to them with clear Signs, the Scriptures and the Luminous Wisdom.
Do not you see that Allah sends down rain from the sky? And thereby We bring forth fruits of various colours; and, from the mountains, tracts white, red and colours of diverse hues and utter dark.
Thus are there, the diverse hues in the humans, reptiles and cattle. Verily, the God fearing are they who possess the Unseen Wisdom. Surely, Allah is All-Mighty, Oft-Forgiving.
Verily, those who recite the Book of Allah, practise it in obedience and spend secretly and openly of what We have bestowed them - they only hope a trade, never to be a loss.
He will give them their goodly reward, and He will further bestow upon them; surely, He is Most Forgiving, Most Appreciative.
The Wisdom We have inspired in you is True and testifies what is before it; verily, Allah, of His bondmen - All Aware, The Seer.575

Then We chose successors to this Book of Our bondmen; but, there are them who wronged themselves; there are who took the middle course; and, there are those who by Allah's leave advanced in righteousness. And, this is the Blessing, Grand.576
They will enter the eternal paradises where they will be adorned with the bracelets of gold and pearls; and, their raiment will be silk.
And they say, "All Praise be to Allah, who removed all our worries. Surely, our God is Ever-Forgiving, Appreciative."
He made us dwell in our houses by His Mercy wherein no distress troubles us nor any weariness touches us.
And whoever rejects, for them is the hell fire; their life will not end as to finish them nor their torment will be lessened; thus, We will reward the rejecters.

And therein they will cry out, "Our God! Release us! We will do right, not what we used to do." "Have We not given you a long life to think, for those who would reflect? And a warner did come to you! So, taste! For, there is not a helper for the unjust."
Verily, Allah Knows the secrets of the heavens and the earth; and He Knows the secrets of the hearts.577

He made you the viceroys on the earth; so, whoever rejects, to him is his rejection; and their disbelief increases them not in the sight of their God except in hatred; and to the disbelievers, their rejection increases not but loss.

Say: Have you seen your partner-gods whom you worship besides Allah? Show me, what have they created in the earth? Or in the heavens do they have any partnership? Or have We given them the Wisdom to see the Signs? Nay! What some of the wicked promise to some others is naught but deceit.
Verily,  Allah holds the heavens and the earth together from falling apart; and, if they fall apart, then none shall prevent them; surely He is Forbearing, Forgiving.

And whenever a Warner came to them, they indeed solemnly swore by Allah, that they would be more compliant than any other nation; yet, when the Warner came to them, it increased them in naught save abhorrence.

They indulged in devising with arrogance, but their evil design will not encompass any save them. What! Do they await a path of those passed before them? If so, you will not find a change in Allah's Way, and you will not see in Allah's Way, a way to alter.

Have not they seen around the earth as to the end of those before them?  They were greater in strength than them; nought in the heavens and the earth shall avert Allah. Indeed, Allah is All-Knowing, All-Powerful.

And if Allah were to seize men for what they had earned, Allah would not have spared a single living being on the earth; however, He delays it to a term, decreed; when the Hour arrives - Allah indeed, over His servants, is Ever-Watchful.
Ya Seen578
By the Wisdom of Quran!
You are indeed, of the Messengers;
Upon The Guidance.
Sent down by the Al Mighty, Merciful-
That ye may warn the careless, for what their fathers not having been warned;
Certainly against most of them the word has been realised; so they will not believe.
Indeed, We had fettered their necks upto their chins; so, their heads were forced up.
And We have put a blockade before them and a blockade behind them; and, We have covered them - so, they cannot see.
And alike for them whether you warn them or you warn them not; they will not believe.
You only warn those who follow the glad tiding and fear the Bountiful in secret; and give him the glad tiding that for them is the Forgiveness and a Mighty Reward.
Verily, We raise the dead; and, We record what they had sent forth and what they had left behind - and We have archived them all.
Coin for them a similitude: When those sent came to a town folks.
When We sent twain to them, they cried them lies; so, We strengthened them with a third. They said, "We indeed are the Messengers unto you."
They said, "You are but men like us; the Beneficent has not sent anything and you only speak lies."
They said, "Our God knows we are indeed sent unto you."
"And our duty is to give you the Signs, clearly."
They said, "Verily, we augur ill of you; if you do not desist we will surely stone you; and, from us to you will be a terrible punishment."
They said, "Your evil augury be with you; and, do you see so a good tiding? Nay, you are a people froward."
From the afar end of the city a man rushed up to them and said, "My people! Follow this Messenger."
"Follow them who do not claim any wages; and they are the guided ones."
"What is with me that I do not worship He Who created me? Your return is unto Him."
"Will I take any god besides Him; if the Benevolent intends me a harm, their intercession shall not avail me aught; nor will they deliver me.
"Indeed, I would then be in manifest error.
"Assuredly, I trust only in your God; therefore, listen to me."
It was said to him: "Enter the Paradise!" He said: "Lo! If only my people would know.
"My God has made me of the dignified, forgiving my sins!"
And We did not send upon his people after him any host from the heaven; and, it is not that We send so.
It is a single blast; and, they were ashes.
Woe to My servants! Whichsoever Messenger comes to them, they were not any but ridiculing him.
How many generations have We destroyed before them! Do not they see that they will never come back to them?
And indeed, they will all be gathered and brought before Us.
And the dead earth is a Sign for them; it is We who give life to it and bring forth the grain whereof they eat.
And We produce therein orchards of  date-palms and vines and therein We caused the springs to gush forth.
that they may eat of their fruits; but, their hands made it not - so, will they not show thanks?
Most Pure is He Who created in pairs - of what the earth produces, of themselves and of what they knew not.
And unto them, the Night is a Sign; We remove the day from it and so they plunge into darkness.
And the Sun moving, staying in its orbit - this is a decree from the All-Powerful, the All-Knowing.
And We have made stages for the moon till it returns like an aged palm-bough.
Sun can touch the moon and the night cannot overtake the day; thus each swims, staying in its orbit.
And a Sign unto them! We carry their generations in the provisions-laden ship.
And We had created for them the likes of it to embark.
And if We will, We drown them; then, there will be none to help them, nor will they be saved.
Except that they might taste Our Grace for a while,
And if you say, "Fear what is before you and what is after you," so that they may receive the Grace-
And whatever be the Sign from Allah comes to them, they but turn away from it.
If it is said, "Spend from what Allah has given you," the unbelievers say to the believers, "Is it right to give those to whom Allah would have provided, had He willed? Ye are in manifest error."
And they say, "If you speak truly, when shall the promise come to pass?"
They do not but await, only for a blast, and it will seize them even as they do debate.
Then they will not be able to name the heirs, nor will they return to their folks.
And when the Voice is blown, they will rise from their graves and hasten to their God.
They will say: "Our grief! Who woke us up from our resting place?" Such is the Promise of the Benevolent, and the Truth the messengers delivered.
There will be nothing but a blast! At once, they will be before us!
This day no soul is wronged in aught, nor will ye be recompensed save for that you did.
On that day, surely the people of heaven will be well pleased.
They with their companions reclining on the couches, under the shades.
There, the fruits will be theirs, and theirs are what they ask for.
A word from the God, the Most Merciful is: "Peace!"
And, "O the Evils, this day, you stand apart."
O the descendants of Adam, "Did I not take a solemn oath from you that you shall not call shaitan, and that he is your open enemy?"
"And that you shall call upon Me; this is the Straight Path.
"Yet, he indeed had led a great multitude of you astray. Did you mind this not?
"This is your promised Hell!"
"Burn therein this day because of your rejection."
On that day, We will set a seal on their mouths; their hands will say to us as to what they were earning, and their legs will be the witness too.
Had We willed We would have removed their sight; then whither will they run to find a way?
And had We willed We would have changed their form to stillness; then they would be powerless to go forward or to retreat.
And We reverse the nature of one's creation when We grow him old. Do they not then give a thought?
And We taught him not poetry, nor is it seemly for him; it is not but Quran, a clear reminder.
It warns the living humans and realises the Truth against the disbelievers.
Do they not see We indeed have created for them the cattle from Our hands that they own?
And We subdued them to them so they ride some, and some you eat.
And from them are the benefits and drinks for them; then will they not be thankful?
Yet they have taken unto them deities other than Allah for their help.
But they cannot help them - yet they will be brought as hosts against them.
Their talks need not hurt you; We Know well what they say and what they hide.
Does he not  see it is We who created man from a drop? Yet he is a open disputer?
And forgetting his creation, he coins for us an example: "Who will quicken the bones when they have become decomposed?"
Say, "He shall quicken them who created the first time, and He knows all creations!"
He creates fire for you from the green tree and lo, from it you kindle.
Is He who created the heavens and the earth, cannot create the likes of them? Yes, He indeed is the Creator, the All-Knowing.
When He intends a thing, His command is, 'Be!' And it is.
So, Blessed is He, in whose hands is the Kingdom of all things; and, unto Him will ye be returned.
By those who range in ranks.
By those who drive with power.
By those who remember the wisdom.
Verily your God is One.
God of the heavens and the earth and all in between; the God of the Easts.
Surely We adorned the nearest sky with the beauty of the stars.
And as a deterrent to all froward devils.
They cannot hear to the words of the raised; they will be a castaway from every side.
They are chased-away and for them is the lasting torment.
If they try to snatch, then a blazing torch will chase him.
Say: So which are stronger in creation - they, or that We have created? Verily, We had created them from sticky clay.
You are in awe, but they mock.
And when they are reminded, they heed not;
They scoff when they see any Sign.
And they say:  This is nothing but a clear sorcery.
"Will we truly be raised up after we are dead and become dust and bones?"
And our fathers, ancients?
Say: Yes, in all lowliness.
One blast and lo, they will see.
They will say, "Woe to us! This is the Day of Execution!"
"This is the Day of Execution, you used to deny."
"Muster the unjust, their companions and that they used to worship."
"Except Allah - then lead them to the path to hell."
"And, halt them; they are sure to be questioned."
"What happened to you that you do not help one another?"
But on that day, they will surrender.
And advance one upon another seeking.
"You indeed kept coming to us as righteous."
They will say: "Nay, but you were unbelievers!"
"And we had no authority over you; no, you were an insolent people!"
"So our God's word is realised upon us and surely we shall suffer."
"We misled you; we indeed were upon the error."
So on that day they will be companions in the suffering.
Thus do We treat the criminals!
And when said to them, "There is no God but Allah," were only proud!
And say, "Shall we forsake our gods for a poet possessed?"
Nay, he has brought the Truth and confirms the messengers.
Surely you are to suffer the chastising punishment.
And you recompense will not be but for what you used to do.
But the devout servants of Allah.
For them are all the provisions they know.
Fruits; and, they will be graced.
In the gardens of delight.
On couches, facing each other.
The glasses of clear drinks will come around them.
Crystal-clear and a delight to the drinkers.
It has no evil, nor is there drunkenness.
And with them will be they who have devotedness and clear sight.
They will be like the pearls in the shell.
Some advance unto some others, exchanging pleasantries.
One of them will say: "Lo, I had a dear friend!
Who would say: "Are you indeed, a confirmer?
"Is it that we will be recompensed after we are dead and had been to dust and bones?
He said, "Would you see?"
He saw; saw him in the centre of hell.
He shall say: "By Allah, well-nigh you destroyed me!"
"Had it not been for the grace of my God I too would have been of those brought in."
"Will we die?"
The companions of the heaven will say: "We do not have except for our first death, and we will not be punished."
"It is indeed a grand victory!"
So, let the strivers strive for the like of this.
Is this a grand feast? Or the 'tree of torment'?
We indeed have made it a test unto the wicked.
Surely, it is a tree issuing from the base of hell.
Its spathes are as the heads of shaitans.
They eat of it, and of it fill their bellies.
Then indeed, they will have scalding water to drink.
Then their return is surely unto hell.
They indeed found their fathers in error;
But they hastened only in their path.
And before this, most people were astray.
And We did send warners amongst them.
Lo, and behold the end of the warned!
But those pure and obedient-serving,
And Nuh, looked up to us, and We are the best in answering to the caller.
So, We saved him and his family from a grievous distress.
And, We left for him among the generations to come.
May Peace be upon Nuh from the Universes.579
Thus do We certainly recompense the good-doers.
He indeed was among the believing servants.
Then We drowned the rest.
Surely Ibrahim was of those who followed him.
When he came to his God with pure heart:
He said to his father and his people: "What is that ye worship?"
"Do you desire false-gods but Allah?"
"If so, what do you think of the God of the worlds?"
Later, he pondered over the stars.580
He said, "I am indeed unwell!"
So they turned away from him.
Then he drew near to their gods and said, "Will ye not eat?"
"What ails you that ye speak not?"
Then he turned upon then smiting them with his right hand.
They hastened towards him.
He said, "Do you serve these which you hew?"
"Allah created you and that you did."
They said, "Build for him a burning furnace and fling him in it."
They plotted against him, but We disgraced them.
And he said, "I will go to my God, and He will surely guide me."
"My God, grant me of the righteous."
So We greeted him with a forbearing son.

Then when he grew with him reaching his age, he said, "My dear son, I indeed saw in my dream, I sacrifice you; so bethink ye!" "My dear father, do what you shall do; Allah willing, you will see me of the patient ones."
So, in their submission, when he lay his son prone for the sacrifice, -
We called out: "O, Ibrahim!"
"Verily you  have completed the vision; thus do We recompense those who do good."
Verily that was a manifest trial.
And We compensated him with a magnificent sacrifice.
And We left for him among the generations to come.
Peace be upon Ibrahim!
Even so do We recompense the good-doers.
Verily, he is among Our believing servants.
And We gave glad tidings of Ishaq, a Prophet, of the righteous.
And We blessed him, and Ishaq; and, among their descendants are the good-doers; and those who wrong themselves, manifestly.
And verily, We blessed Musa and Harun.
We saved them and their people from the grave distress.
And We helped them that they became victors.
And We gave them the manifest Book.
And We guided them.
And We left for them among the generations to come.
Peace be upon Musa and Harun.
Thus do We recompense the good-doers.
Verily, they were of Our believing servants.
And Ilyas indeed is among Our Messengers.
When he said to his people, "Will you not fear?"
"Do you call upon Ba'l abandoning the Best of the Creators?"
"Allah is He, who created you and your fathers of the yore."
But they belied him; so they will be brought forth.
Except the devout servants of Allah.
And We left for him among the generations behind.
Peace be upon Ilyas!
Thus do We reward the good-doers.
He indeed is among Our believing servants.
And Lut was certainly a messenger.
We saved him and all his family, -
Except the old woman among them who stayed behind.
Then We destroyed the rest.
And you walk on them in the morning hours.581
And in the night - then, will you not mind?
And Yunus - he indeed was among the messengers.
When he slipped into the laden ship;582
Then he drew lots and was of the losers.
And a whale swallowed him, while he was blameworthy.
And had he not been focussing on Allah more than ever,
He would have tarried in its belly till the day of raising up.
And We cast him on the plains while he was still 'dis-eased'583
Then We sent him to a hundred thousand, or more.
And they believed; so We made them taste the good for a period.
Say to them: "Daughters for your God and sons for you?"
"Or have We created the angels as females? Or, are they the witness?"
Know ye: they speak of their imagination!
Liars are they who say, "Allah has begotten."
Has He chosen daughters to sons?
What ails you? How ye judge?
Will you then not reason?
Or have ye a manifest proof?
Bring your proof if you speak truly.
And they create relationship between Allah and the jinns, but they know the jinns also shall be brought.
Most Pure is He, above that they describe.
Except the devout servants of Allah.
Therefore, ye and all that ye worship;
You cannot mislead him;
Save them who are bound for hell.
There is none of us without an assigned place.
Indeed we are the rangers.
And We are they that Glorify Him.
And verily they were saying:
"If only we had received a Sign from our fathers -
"We would have surely been Allah's sincere servants."
But they do deny it - soon they will know.
Our word had indeed gone forth before, to the serving messengers.
Assuredly they shall be helped.
And Our hosts! Surely they shall succeed.
So, stay away from them for a period.
Behold thee! Lo, they behold too!
Do they hasten for our torment?
When it descends in their midst, - what an evil dawn will it be of the warned!
So, stay away from them for a period.
Behold thee! Lo,they behold too.
Exalted high is your God above what they describe.
And Peace be upon The Messengers.
Glory be to Allah, the God of the worlds.
Saad - O, the Forbearing! By the Quran, the complete reminder!584
But the deniers are in pride and dissent.
How many a nation have We destroyed before! Then their cries gave them no time to escape.
And they were surprised that a Warner came to them from them. The deniers said, "He is a sorcerer, lying."
"Has he made all gods as One God? Verily, this is surprising!"
"Go and be staunch to your gods! Surely in this, there is a design."
"We have not heard of this in any community; this is pure invention!"
"Is it upon him among us the Revelation has been sent down?" "Nay, they doubt about My Revelation! Nay, they had not tasted My torment."585
Or have they the treasuries of the Grace your God, the Exalted, the Abundant in providing?
Or do they rule the heavens, the earth and that in between? If so let them ride out.
But the host here are of those defeated there.
Denied before them are the people of Nuh; and, Aad and Firaun, he of the tent pegs.
And their bands are the Samud, the folks of Lut and the dwellers of the gardens.
Not one, but denied the Messengers, so My torment was sure.
And they await not, but one blast and there will be no delay in it.
And they say, "Our God! Hasten on us our share before the Day of Reckoning."
Endure what they say; and, remember Our servant Dawood. He indeed always looked up to us.
Indeed, We subjected to him the mountains; they praised the glory of Allah with him at nightfall and sunrise.
And gathered the birds - all looked up to Him.
And We strengthened his Kingdom, and gave him the Wisdom and Clear Signs.
Did you received the news of the disputants? When they entered his privacy, -

When they entered his seclusion, he was taken by the scare. Then they said, "Fear not! We are disputants; one of us has transgressed upon the other; so judge aright between us; be not unjust, and guide us to the right path."
"He indeed is my brother; he has ninety-nine sheep. But with me I have one sheep; but he, by his argument has won over me to put it in his custody."

"Verily by asking you to add your sheep to his sheep, he has wronged you. And, many intermixed do wrong one another except those who believe and are righteous - they are very few." But when Dawood realised We had tested him, he turned to his God in repentance, subdued.
So We forgave him that, and surely with Us is the nearest and beautiful place for him.

"O Dawood! Surely We made you the viceroy in the earth. So judge justly amongst the people; and, follow not pride. It will cast you away from Allah's Way. Those who deviate from Allah's path as castaways, for them indeed, is a severe torment for having forgotten the Day of Reckoning."
And We had not created the heaven and the earth and everything in between for waste; such is the thought of the disbelievers. Woe of the fire upon the disbelievers.
Or would We make the right doers as the corruptors on the earth? Or would We make pious as the sinners?
We have bestowed upon you the Blessed Book that they ponder its Signs, and that the men of understanding shall reflect.
And We gave Dawood, Sulaiman - a glorious servant. Verily, he was ever turning!
When the standing steeds were presented to him at eventide,
He said, "Lo, I have preferred the good things to the remembrance of my God until the sun was bidden behind the veil."
"Bring them back to me!" He then began to stroke their shanks and necks.
And We did test Sulaiman harshly; We threw the dead, on to his throne. So he turned.586
He said, "My God! Forgive me! Grant me a Kingdom that none shall aspire after me; verily, You are the Bestower!"587
So We made the air subservient to him; it carried to his destinations at ease, by his will.
And, every builder from shaitans, and the divers as well;
And others, chained;-
"Our Bestow, this - give or withhold, without a questioning."
And surely with Us for him, a near and a beautiful dwelling.
And remember Our servant, Ayyub: He said to his God, "Verily, shaitan has given me anguish and torment."
"Tap with your foot! Here is the freshness for the bathing and a drink."
Then as a Mercy from Us and a reflection for the men of understanding, -  We gave him his family, and added at that.
"And have a handful and strike with it - break not your oath." We saw him, enduring; and, an excellent servant - surely, he was ever turning to us.588
And remember Our servants Ibrahim, Ishaq and Yaqub, the men of Might and Insight.
We indeed purified them with a pure quality, to mind their abode.
And assuredly with Us, they are of the chosen people, outstanding.
And remember Ismail, Alyasavu, Zulqifl - all are of the good standing.
This, a glad tiding! Surely, for the pious is a beautiful abode.
For them will be kept open the gates of the Paradise, Adhnu.
Reclining on it - and they will ask for fruits and drinks in plenty.
With them will be companions who guard the gaze and of the same age.
This, the promise, given to you for the Day of Reckoning.
Verily, this is Our gift; and, there is no end to it.
This - but to the wicked, surely the most evil is their abode.
The Hell - therein they will enter; what an evil resting place!
This - so, let them taste it; scalding water and pus.
And countless more like this.
And such is the army, enter hustling in with you; no welcome for them; surely they shall burn in the Fire.
They would say, "Nor ye, no welcome for you; you forwarded it for us; so wretched is the abode."
They would say, "Our God, whoever have forwarded this to us, double their punishment in the Fire."589
And they would say, "What ails us? Why do we not see those whom we counted among the wicked?"
"Did we take them for a mockery? Or has our vision swerved away from them?"
Indeed, this is the truth; the disputing of the dwellers of the Fire.
Say: "I am but a Warner. There is no God but Allah, the One, the Omnipotent."
"He is the God of the heavens and the earth and all in between. He is All-Mighty, All-Forgiving."
Say: "This is the Most Blessed Revelation.
"But you keep ignoring."
"I know nothing of what the exquisites exchanged."
"The Wahy was indeed not sent to me except that I warn you openly."
When your God said to the angels, "Verily, I am going to create humanity from clay -"
And when I Perfect him with My Ruh, to the Stature, obey him."
Then the angels fell in obedience - all of them.
Except Iblis, he was proud and became of the disbelievers.
"O Iblis! What prevented you from obeying him whom I have perfected with My Wisdom? Do you boast? Or have you become lofty?"
He said, "I am above him; You created me from the Fire, but him, out of clay."
"Go ye out of here because you are an outcast."
"And My curse will be on you until the Day of Reckoning."590
He said, "My God, respite me until the Day they are raised up."
He said, "You are among those respited!"
"Until the Hour, fixed!"
Then he said, "By Thy Glory, I will surely lead them all astray!"
"Except Thy servants, pure for Thee."
God said, "That is the Truth, and I say the Truth."
"Surely, I will fill up the Hell with you and all of them who followed you.'
Say, "I ask you of no wages for this, nor do I put you to stress."
"This is no less than a Revelation for the people of the worlds."
"By the Time! Verily, you will know the Truth of This."
This Revelation has been sent down from Allah, the Mighty, the Wise.
Verily, We have sent down this Revelation upon you in Truth. So, strive for purity at heart, turning to Allah.

Know that that Allah's is the Pure Way. And those who take besides Allah as helpers say: "We worship them not but they would bring us nearer to Allah." Allah will indeed judge between them about that which they differ; verily, Allah will not guide he who lies, denying.
Had Allah wished for a son He would have chosen so from His creations; He is the Most Pure. He is the One God, the Almighty.

He created the heavens and the earth in Truth. He covers the day about the night and wraps the night about the day; and, subjected the sun and the moon. Each moves according to the time prescribed for it. Allah is Mighty, Forgiving.

He created you from the Soul, and from it, He made your companion. And He produced for you of the cattle eight kinds. He formed you in your mothers' wombs, and that He conceives you in three darkness, one creation after the other. He is your God. And to Him is the Command. There is no God but He. How then are you turned away?

If you turn away - Allah indeed, is Needless of you; but Allah is not satisfied with His servants about their turning away. Therefore, He will be appreciative if you show thanks. And the bearer of the burden will not bear the load of another; then your return is to your God; then He will inform you what you used to do. Lo! He knows what is in the breasts.

And if any affliction touches man, He turns to his God and calls only Him; then, when He grants from Him a good, he forgets that for whatever he had called upon Him; he creates associates to Allah and prevents from the path of Allah. Say, "Enjoy for a time with your ingratitude; indeed, you are the companions of Hell."

Is he equal to - the one, who fears His God concerning his next life, surrendering to God steadfast during the night, trusting His Mercy? Say, "Are the men of understanding and the ignorants the same? Verily, the knowing are those who ponder."
Say, "O the believing servants! Fear your God. There is goodly wage in this world for those who do good. Allah's earth is plentiful; the enduring ones will indeed receive their reward in abundance."
Say, "Verily, I am ordained to look up to Allah with purity at heart for the guidance."
Say, "I am called to serve for the Peace, wilfully, first hand."
Say, "I surely fear for a mighty day of the torment if I wrong my God."
Say, "I soulfully call upon Allah for my life."
Say, "But you keep worshiping as per your desires; surely the worst losers are they who bring upon them and their family a great loss, in the End."
Over and below them will be the sheets of fire. Allah warns His servants thus: "My Servants! Fear Me."
The Blessing is upon those who avoid and keep off from shaitans and turn to Allah, surrendering. So, give good news to My servants.
They listen to the speeches and follow the Truth in it. Allah guides only such. They are the people of understanding.
Upon whom the word of punishment has come true, then can you save he, who is in the Fire?
But whoso fear God, they will have lofty mansions below which the rivers flow - Allah's Promise. Allah fails not His promise.

Beheld not thee? Allah sends down water from the heaven and makes it run as springs; then He brings forth thereof grains in various hues. Soon you find them becoming dry and yellow; then, He makes them chaff. Verily, in it is the Sign for the people of remembrance.
Him, whose breasts Allah has expanded for the peaceful life is in the Light of his God. And woe to those whose hearts have hardened against the remembrance of Allah - those are in manifest error.

Allah has sent down the Book having beautiful hadiths; they testify one another, inspiring perpetual remembrance. Whoever fear their God, their skins quiver; then their skins and their hearts become tender to Allah's remembrance - Allah's Way, this. With this Allah guides whom He Will. But whoso Allah leaves astray, there is none to guide him.
He who strives saving his face from the horrible punishment of the Judgement Day - and, to the wicked ones, it will be said, "Taste what you earned!"
Those before them denied, and therefore the torment came upon them from whence they were not aware.
Thus Allah made them taste humiliation in this world, and the torment of the Hereafter is much greater - if only they knew.
And indeed, We have set forth every example in this Quran for the humanity to reflect.
In the Arabic tongue, this Quran, without corruptness - that they may guard.

Allah coins a similitude: a slave owned by many masters at variance with one another, and a man exclusively at the service of one man - are the two equal in comparison? All dignity be to God, but most of them do not know.
Indeed ye will die, and surely, they will die.
Then, on the last day, surely you will put forth excuses before your God.
So, who is greater in wickedness than he who lies against Allah, and dismisses the Truth when it came to them?
And he who brought the Truth and those accepting the Truth - are the God fearing.
For them with their God, is what they wish; this is the reward of the righteous.
Allah will remove the worst of their evil deeds from them - and, grant them the best reward for the fair things they used to do.
Does Allah suffices not for His servants? And they threaten you with that besides Allah; and, whomever Allah has left astray, there is none to guide him.
And whomever Allah guides, none shall misguide him. Is not Allah All-Powerful, Avenging?

If you ask them, "Who created the heavens and the earth," they would inevitably say, "The none but the One!" Say: "Beheld thee, if the 'none but the One - Allah' has decreed an affliction upon me, can those you call besides Allah deliver me? Or, if He grants me a favour, will they be able to prevent His grace?" And say: "Allah suffices me; in Him, do the trusting put their trust."
Say: "O my people! Do what you would do, and indeed I do too; so, soon you will know."
"To whom the torment will come? And upon whom will the eternal affliction descend?"
We indeed have sent down this blessed Book upon you; so, whoever takes to righteousness, it is for him; and, whoever errs, he errs only to his peril; and, you are not a protector over them.

Allah captures the lives - when they die, and that which would not die, in their sleep; then He withholds that upon which the death is decreed, and sends back the rest to complete their term. Verily, in this are the Signs for those who reflect.
Or do they take for intercessors besides Allah? Say: "What! Even though they do not possess any power or knowledge?"
Say: "Allah's is all intercession; to Him belongs the Kingdom of the heavens and the earth; then your return is unto Him."
And when 'Allah!' is mentioned alone, those whose hearts do not believe in the Lasting Day, shrink in aversion; but when those beside Him is mentioned, behold, they are glad.
Say: "O Allah, the Originator of the heavens and the earth! The Knower of the Secrets and the Evident. Judge among your servants concerning what they dispute."

And, even if with the wicked is the possession of all things on the earth, and the likeness thereof, surely, they would give them away to ransom them from the severe chastisement on the Day of Judgement. And there would appear to them from Allah that which they could never have counted upon.
And there would appear to them the evils they had earned; and, that with which they used to mock at would encompass them.

When an evil encompasses the man, he only calls Us; but then, when We favoured him a boon from Us, he says, "This is due to me on account of my knowledge!" Nay! It is but a test - but most of them will not comprehend.
Thus said those before them, but whatever they earned availed them nought.
So, the evil they had earned smote them; and, of them, to the unjust, their evil would reach them fast; and, they will not be able to avert.
Do they not see Allah indeed expands the provisions to whom He wills and shrinks to whom He wills? In it are sure Signs for the believers.
Say: "My servants! Despair not of Allah's Mercy, even though you had committed excesses on yourself - surely, Allah is Oft-Returning, Most Merciful."
So, turn to your God and surrender to Him, before the affliction comes upon you; then, you will not be helped.
And before the torment comes upon you of a sudden, when you are unaware, follow the beautiful things bestowed upon you from your God.
Lest you should say, "O woe unto me for not being mindful in my duty to Allah; and, I was indeed among the scoffers!"
Or, lest it should say, "Had Allah shown me the Way, I too would have been of the God-fearing."
Or, lest it should say on seeing the punishment, "If only I find a way out, I will be of the righteous."
"Verily My Signs came to you; but you were proud, rejecting them; and, you were of the unbelievers."
And on the Day of the Reckoning you will find the faces of those who lied against God blackened. Is there not in hell the abode for the Haughty?
Allah delivers those who are God-fearing with victory; no harm shall touch them, nor would they grieve.
It is Allah who Originates all things, and He is the Protector over all things.
And with Allah is the keys of the heavens and the earth. So, the losers are those who disbelieve in the Signs of Allah.
Say, "O Ignorant! Do you command that I worship that which are not Allah?"
And what is revealed to you and those before you is, 'if you associate partners - your toiling will surely fail, and you will be among the losers.'
So, turn to Allah and be among the thankful.
And they have not regarded Allah with Truthful regard; and, on the Hour, the earth will be in His grip; and all the heavens will be under His Order. He is High above all that they associate.
When the call is given, at that, those in the heavens and on the earth will faint save whom Allah willed; when there comes the call again, lo, they shall stand up, beholding.

And the earth will shine with the Light of its God, and the Record will be placed; and, the Prophets and the witnesses will be brought - and, the judgement will be just between them. And, they will not be wronged.
Each one will be recompensed for what he has wrought; and, He knows well their deeds.

The disbelievers will be dragged to the Hell as combines and as communes; when they come to it, its gates will be opened. The guards would say to them: "Haven't there been the Messengers from amongst you exemplifying your God's Signs, and warning about this Day of assemblage? They would say: "Yes." But the Truth, the word of Doom, has come upon the disbelievers.
It will be said, "Enter the gates of the Hell and abide therein." Evil is the abode of those who waxed proud."

And those who feared their God would be led to paradise in companies; and when they come thither, its gates will be opened; and, its keepers will say to them: "Peace be upon you; so enter ye, into it and abide therein forever."

To this they would say, "All Praise be unto Allah! He made true His promise to us and to make us go about in the paradise wherever wished to, He made us the inheritors of the earth." So, the recompense of the righteous is blessed.

And the Angels - you will find the Angels Praise their God and glorify His Purity while they surround every Wisdom of the Universe. Then the judgement will be pronounced between them with justness. It will be said, "Glory be to Allah, the God of the Worlds."
Ha Meem.591
This is the Book revealed by Allah, the All-Mighty, All-Knowing.
Forgiver of sins, Accepter of penitence, Severe in Punishing and Merciful. There is no God, but He; and, to Him is the final return.
Save he who denies - shall not dispute concerning the Signs of Allah; therefore, let not their pride in the cities delude you.

Before them denied the people of Nuh, and the following generations; and, to corner the Messenger who came to them, every nation disputed against the truth with the falsehood. But I seized them; how then was My punishment?
And thus the promise of your God has come upon the unbelievers as the companions of Fire.

Those who bear the wisdom of the Universe and those who encompass it, praise their God and glorify His Purity. They seek forgiveness for the believers while they believed in Him. "Our God! You surround everything by Your Grace and Wisdom; so, bestow Your Mercy upon whoever follow Your Way, repenting. And, deliver them from the punishment of Hell!"

"My God! Make them, and of their parents, and of their wives, and of their descendants and those who do good - enter the Paradise of Adhnu, the eternal abode You had promised them;  verily, You are the Mighty, the Wise."
"And deliver them from the evils of that Day; and, he whom You would save on that Day, You have taken him to Mercy - and, that is a great victory."
It will indeed be said to the unbelievers, "Allah's wrath on you is much greater than your anger on you; for, you denied when you were called to the belief."
They would say, "Our God, You caused us to die twice and raised us up twice. So, we accept our wrongs - is there a way out?"592
"This is because, when you were called to, 'the Only God!' you disbelieved; but when partners were joined to Him, then you believed. So, this decree is from the Most High, the Grand."
He shows you His Signs; He sends down all your provisions from the heaven - so, none shall reflect, except he who turns to Allah alone.593
So, though the unbelievers hate, steadfastly call upon Allah with the sincere remembrance of Him.
The Exalter in ranks; the possessor of the Seat. It is He who sends His command through inspiration upon whom He will of his slaves, to warn them of the Day of Meeting..
On that Day they would rush forth; none of their matters will hide from Allah. Whose is the Kingdom today? To Allah, the One, the Subduing.
This Day each will get their recompense for what they earned; no wrong today; surely, Allah is severe in Reckoning.

And warn them the Day is near; on that Hour when their hearts fill with grief and choke their throats, for the wicked, there will not be a sympathising friend, nor would there be one for him, with acceptable intercession.
He Knows well their treacherous eyes and the secrecies in their mind.
And Allah judges with Truth, and those who call besides Allah will not judge a thing. Allah indeed is the Hearing, the Seeing.

Beheld not they travelling on the earth and saw the end of those before them? They were greater than them in strength and left firmer traces on the land. But Allah seized them in their ill-deeds, and there was none to save them from Allah.
This - verily, their messengers came to them with clear Signs; but they denied them. So, Allah seized them. He is All-Powerful, Severe in Retribution.
And We indeed sent Musa with Our Signs and a clear Warrant.
To Firaun, Haman and Qarun - but they did say, "A sorcerer! A liar!"
When he brought them the Truth from Us, they said, "Kill the sons of those who believed with him, and leave their daughters alive." So, the plans of the disbelievers are not but in error.
And Firaun said, "Leave me the killing of Musa; and, let him call His God. Surely I fear, he would change your way, or that he should cause chaos in the land."
Musa said, "I surely seek refuge in my God and your God from every arrogant disbeliever in the Day of judgement."

And a believer in the tribe of Firaun, who was hiding his belief said, "Will you kill a person because he says, 'My God is Allah'? And verily, he has brought you from your God, clear Signs; therefore, if he is a liar, upon him is his lie; but if he has spoken the Truth, then certain of what he has promised would come upon you. Allah indeed, will not guide a transgressing liar."

"O my people! Today the kingdom is yours, and you are mighty; but, who is our helper, if Allah's punishment has come upon us?" Said Firaun, "I show you the straight path; and, I show not the way except what is right."
And he who believed said, "O my people! I certainly fear for you like the days of the parties."
"The like of that befell the people of Nuh, and Aad and Samud - and their generations. But Allah wills not wrong for His bondmen."
And, "O my people! I fear for you the Hour of summoning!"
"The Hour of your retreating, when there is no protector for you from Allah; and, whoever Allah has left astray, there is none to guide him."

And, "Yusuf came to you with clear Signs before; but you doubted that which he brought to you until when he died. And you said, "After him, Allah will never send a Messenger." Thus Allah sends the prodigal and the doubter, astray."
It is most hateful in the eyes of Allah, and the believers to dispute the Signs of Allah without a clear proof. Thus Allah seals the heart of every proud and haughty.
And Firaun said, "O Haman! Construct for me a high tower - so, I would reach the ways!"

Firaun said, "The ways of the heavens - so that I would see Musa's God; and I surely think he lies." Thus were the evil deeds of Firaun, made fair seem to him; he was prevented from the way; and, Firaun's plot did not end but in ruin.
And he who believed said, "O my people! Follow me; I will show you the Straight Path."
"O my people! A mean is the pleasure of this life, but the Hereafter is the eternal abode!"

"Whoever does ill-deed, he will not be recompensed except with the like of it; and, whoever of a male or a female, believes and does good, will enter the heaven. There, their needs will be fulfilled."
"O my people! How is it with me? I call you to salvation, but you call me to the Fire."
"You call me to deny Allah and that I associate partners with Him whereof I have no knowledge; but I call you to the All-Mighty, the Most Forgiving."
"Towards whatsoever you call me, it is unfit to be called upon now or ever; and, we surely will return to Allah. Verily the transgressors remain the companions of Hell."
"So you will soon know what I say; and, I entrust my affair with Allah. Allah indeed is Ever-Seeing of His servants."
So, We delivered him from their planned plot; and, the evil of the torment surrounded the people of Firaun.
They will be exposed to the Fire, morning and evening - and, on the Hour, lasting - it will be said, "Thrust the folks of Firaun into the most terrible chastisement."
And, when they wrangle in the Fire, - the oppressed people would say to the transgressors, "We were surely a people, following you; so, will you remove the least part of this fire from us?"
The transgressors will say, "We are all in this; Allah indeed has judged between His servants."
The inhabitants of the fire would say to the keepers of the hell, "Seek from your God to  reduce this suffering for us a little, for one day."

They will say, "Haven't your messengers come to you with clear proofs?" They will say, "O yes, undoubtedly!" They will say, "If so, seek yourselves." But the prayers of the unbelievers is not but in error."
Certainly We will help Our messengers and the believers in this world and on the Hour of the establishment of the witnesses.
On that Day, the excuses of the transgressors will avail them nought; and they will have the curse, and an evil resting place.
Indeed, We gave Musa the Straight Path; and, We made the descendants of Israel, inherit the Scripture.
It was a Guidance, and a clear Revelation to those who mind.
So remain patient; surely Allah's word is the Truth. Seek forgiveness for your deeds; and, Praise your God's Purity in the evening and the morning.
Verily, those who argue concerning the Signs of Allah without proof, have nothing but pride in their breasts; but they do not attain it. Seek refuge then, in Allah; indeed, He is Hearing, Seeing.
Surely the creation of the heavens and the earth is greater than the creation of man; yet, most of the people would not know.
Those who have the external sight and those with insight are not the same; likewise, the believing good doers and the evil doers are not equal. But a few of you, mind not.
The Time will come, and there is no doubt in it - but most people do not welcome it.
Your God says: Call unto Me; I will Answer. Whoever is boastful, unmindful of Me, shall enter the Hell, despised.
Allah created the night for you to rest therein, and the day for your eyesight; Allah ever blesses the humans - but most people do not give thanks.
He is Allah, your God - the Originator of all creations; there is no God but He. So, whither are you turned to?
Thus were the people who were denying the Signs of Allah, turned away.

It is Allah who had made this earth the dwelling place; and, the sky, a protective cover. And He created you, perfected you and measured your provisions in full - He is Allah! Most Blessed is Allah, your God, and the God of the worlds.
He is the Originator of life; there is no God but He - so, turn unto Him and look forward to Him alone; all glory be to the God of the worlds.
Say: "When the clear Signs of my God has come to me, I am indeed forbidden to call upon that which you worship beside Allah; and, I am commanded to surrender only to the God of the worlds."

He Originated you from the sand; then from a drop; then from the cluster - then brings you forth as an infant. Then you grow into maturity and reach old age; some die before this - yet, each has an appointed term - that you may give thought.
He Originates life; He causes death. So, when He Intends to Originate, He has to say to it is, 'Be!' And it is.
Have you not seen those who dispute Our Signs? How are they turned away?
Whoever denies the Book and that with which We sent Our Messengers, will soon know.
They will be dragged with the fetters and chains around their necks;
through the Scalding water, and then into the Fire.
Then it will be said to them: "Where are the partners you associated?"
They will say, "Except Allah, - they had vanished from Us; and, We had not been calling them before!" Thus Allah sends astray, the unbelievers.
This is for your unjust rejoicing in the land, with arrogance.
Enter the gates of the Hell to dwell therein forever; thus, evil is the resting-place of the Haughty.
So, have patience! Verily, Allah's word is True. Whether We show you certain of Our Promise or We cause you to die before it, it is to Us they shall return.

And indeed, We had sent before you the Messengers. We have revealed the histories of some to you; and, there are the Messengers whose histories We had not narrated to you. No Messenger shall bring any Sign of Allah but by His Leave; so, when Allah's command comes, the justice will prevail. And, on the Hour, the liars are to lose.
Allah has created the cattle for you - on some, you ride; and, you eat of it.
And in them are the uses for you; and, you are carried on them and on the ships to fulfil the needs of your hearts.
And He shows you His Signs; so, which of Allah's Signs will you deny?

Beheld not they travelling on the earth and saw the end of those before them? They were greater than them in strength and left firmer traces on the land. However, whatever they earned did not benefit them.
So, when their Messenger came to them with Clear Signs, they exulted only in the knowledge they possessed; and, whatever they mocked at, encompassed them.
So, when they saw Our torment, said: "We believe only in Allah; and, deny what we used to associate with Him."
However, their belief when they saw Our torment, did not avail them; the wont of Allah ever touching His bondmen. And then, the disbelievers are lost.
Ha Meem594
This has been sent down from the Most Benevolent, Most Merciful.
The wisdom of this Quran, given in the 'Arabic,' is made clear for the thoughtful.
As giver of Glad tiding and a Warner; but most of them ignore; and, they behold not!
And, they said, "Our hearts are closed to where you call us; and, there is deafness in the ears; and, a veil is there between us and you. So, act; we indeed, are acting."
Say, "I am a mortal like you - but Inspiration is being given to me; surely, your God is One; so, stand steadfast for Him alone. And, seek His Forgiveness; and, woe to the associators."
Those who do not spend for purification; and, they are the disbelievers in the Hereafter.
Those who believe and do good works, to them will be the lasting recompense.
Say, "Is it you who associate partners, denying He who created the earth in two days? He is the God of the Universes."
He planted on it from above, the mountains, firm; and, He blessed it; and, on it, He perfected their provisions in four days - in the required measure.
Then He willed to create, when the sky was smoky - so, He said to it and the earth, "Come ye together, willingly or unwillingly!" They both said, "We have come, in willing obedience!"

So, He made it into seven firmaments in two days; and, inspired in each firmament its duties; and, We decked the nether sky with the stars, and rendered it inviolable; it is prepared by the All-Mighty, the All-Knowing.
So, if they reject, say, "I warn you that you may be seized by a seizure of thunder blasts as Aad and Samud were seized."

When the Messengers came to them from before and behind them saying, "Call not upon anything other than Allah," they said, "If our God had willed, He would have sent down the Angels; so, we certainly reject that with which you were sent."595

And on the land, the unjustly arrogant people of Aad said, "Who is mightier than us?" Lo! Beheld not they, that Allah, their creator - is surely Mightier than them? And they were people who continually denied Our Signs.
So, to make them taste a disparaging chastisement in the days of their worst adversities We sent against them a tempest; and, the punishment in the Hereafter will be even more humiliating.
And as for Samud, We guided them; but they preferred blindness to the Guidance. So, the disgracing torment of thunderbolt overtook them for what they earned.
But We delivered those who believed and feared their God.
And the enemies of Allah will be assembled in rows on the Day when they are gathered to the Fire.
Finally, when they reach their Hour - their ears, their eyes and their skins will testify against them as to what they used to do.

And they will say to their skins, "Why did you testify against us?" They will say, "Allah, the God who makes everything speak, caused us talk. He created you in the first, and you are returned unto Him."
"And you did not conceal to your ears, eyes and skins, that they could not bear witness against you. And, you thought Allah would not know much of what you do."
And, this imagination you assumed of your God has destroyed you, and so you have become among the losers.
So, Fire is their dwelling place, even though they are patient nor will they be forgiven despite their seeking.
We have joined companions with them; they made beautiful to them what is before and after them - affirmed is Our Word, upon the Jinn and the men who passed on before. Lo, they were ever losers.
The disbelievers said, "Give not ears to this Quran! Cause chaos and confusion in it; so, you will prevail."
So, We will make the disbelievers taste the severest torment - for, We will reward them for the most evil of their deeds.
That is the reward for the enemies of Allah - the Fire! In it is the eternal dwelling for their denial of Our Straight Path.
And the disbelievers would say, "God! Show us those of the Jinns and humans who misguided us; we will bring them low, and below our feet."
Surely, those who say, "Our God is Allah, and endure," Verily, the angels descend on them saying, "Fear not, nor worry - Enjoy, the good tidings in the Promised Paradise!"
"We are your Helpers in this world and the next. And, therein is whatever you Will, and all that you wish for."
A Grace from from the Forgiving, the Merciful.
And, "Who says fairer than he, who calls people to Allah, and says, "I am of those who wish Peace," while being righteous himself?
Not equal are the righteousness and wrong; prevent the evil with the righteousness! Then between whom and you was enmity, becomes as though he is a bosom friend.
But none will attain it save those who keep patience; and, except the highness, none shall possess it.596
And, whenever you are aware of any inducement from Shaitan, turn to Allah, at once. Verily, He is Hearing, Knowing.597
And the night and the day, and the sun and the moon are among His Signs; so, if you are people who call upon Allah, never worship the sun and the moon. But surrender to Allah, the Creator.
But if they wax proud, - those with your God exalt His Purity by night and day, and they do not exhaust.

And of His Signs are that you see the earth barren; when We send down rain on it, it quivers and grows. Surely, He Who gives life is the giver of life to the dead. Verily, He has power over all things.

Indeed, those who find a wrong in Our Signs are not hidden from Us. So who is better - he who is hurled into Fire or he who comes without fear on the Day of Reckoning? He indeed is ever Watchful over what you do.
Surely, when the Remembrance came to them, they disbelieved; indeed, it is the Book, ingrained.
Come not nigh to it a distortion from before, nor from behind it. It has been sent down from the Wise, the Most Glorious.
Nought is said to you but was indeed said to the Messengers before you; surely your God is Oft-Forgiving, Severe in Retribution.

And if We had sent down this Quran in non-Arabic, they would say: "Should its Revelation be not in the known Arabic? What! Not an Arab?" Say, "It is the Guidance and Comfort to the believers. But for the disbelievers - in their ears is the deafness; and, in them is the blindness; so, they are called to from afar."

Verily, We gave Musa the Clear Book; but, changes were made therein. And, had there had not been a word preceded from Allah, long-settled would have been their affairs among them; and thereof, they are in grave doubt.
Whoever is righteous, it is for his good, and whoever sins, for him is the grief; and, your God does not wrong his bondmen a bit.

He has the Wisdom of Time, And, not a fruit comes forth from its sheath without His knowledge; and, no woman conceives nor delivers. On that Day, He will say, "Where are My partners?" They will say, "We declare to you, none is here as a witness!"
And whatever they were calling before will vanish from them. So, they will know they have no refuge.
Man is not tired of asking for good; but, if a harm touches him, he despairs.

But, after his suffering, when We make him taste Our Mercy, he says, "It so happens to me; I do not think there is the Hour; and, if I am sent back to my God, I will certainly receive good from Him." "So, We will indeed inform the disbelievers what they did, and will surely make them taste a punishing chastisement."
And if We shower upon man Our Mercy, he turns away, denying. But when an evil visits him, he engages in a prolonged prayer.
"While this is from Allah, yet, if you deny - behold not thee, who is far away astray than he who is in dissension?"
We will soon show them Our Signs in Truth for sure, from all around and from within them. Does not it suffice you that your God is, over all things Ever-Watchful?
Know that they are in doubt concerning their meeting with their God. And know that He surrounds all things.
Ha Meem598
Ain Seen Qaf599
Thus Allah sends Revelations to you and those before you through inspiration. He is the Exalted in Power, the Wise.
To Him belongs whatsoever is in the heavens and whatsoever is in the earth. He is the All-High, the All-Glorious.
The skies above may cleave asunder; but, the angels seek Forgiveness, Praising their God's Glory and Purity, for the people of the world. Lo! Surely Allah is Forgiving, Merciful.
Those who have taken besides Allah as protectors, He keeps watch over them - you own no responsibility for them.

And thus do We inspire this Quran to you in Arabic, to warn the capital cities and the surrounding towns about the Day of the gathering of all whereof there is no doubt. Some will be in the Heavens and some in the Blazing Fire.
And had Allah willed, He would have made them a single nation; but, He admits whom He will into His Mercy. And for the unjust there is no protector nor a helper.
Or have they taken protectors other than Allah? But Allah, He is the Protector; He brings life to the dead, and He is Powerful over all things.
And the judgement concerning any of your disputes is with Allah - He is Allah, My God! I put my trust in Him and to Him I return.

He is the Originator of the heavens and the earth; and, He causes you to spread by creating your companions for you, and of the cattle their strains; there is nothing like unto Him. He is the Hearing, the Seeing.
The Keys to the Heavens and the earth are with Him; He expands or restricts the measures of this world, for whom He wills. Indeed He is the Knower of all things.600

He has allowed a life for you what He has ordained upon Nuh. So, what We reveal to you, what We have revealed to Ibrahim, Musa and Isa is: "Endure in the Straight Path and deviate not away from it." To the idolaters, hard is the Path to which you call them. Allah chooses for Him, those whom He pleases, and Guides to Him, those who turn.

But for their jealousy, they had not fallen apart after the Clear Signs came to them. Had there not been the word preceded from Allah, for a term fixed, the affairs between them surely would have been settled; and, whoever after they became the owners of the Signs of the Book, are also in the deep divide.

So, keep calling; and, stand steadfast as ordained upon you, and follow not their vanities. Say, "I believe in the God-send Scriptures; and, I am commanded to justice amongst you. Allah is Our God, and He is your God. Our deeds are for us; your deeds are for you. And there shall not be disputes between us and you; Allah will bring us together, and we are to return unto Him."
Whoever dispute about Allah after accepting Him, their argument is fruitless before their God; and, His anger will come upon them as a terrible chastisement.
Allah it is who has sent down this Book in justness and truth; and, do you know that the Hour is nigh?
Those who disbelieve in it, hasten for it; but, the believers fear it, and they are sure it is true. Lo! Those who involve in vain dispute concerning the Hour are far astray.
Allah is Ever-Gentle with His servants; He provides to whom He will. He is the Powerful, the Mighty.
Whoso wishes for the harvest of the Hereafter, We shall increase his provisions. And whoso desires this world's harvest, We give him of it, a measure. But, he will have no portion in the Hereafter.

Or, have they partners who bid against what is forbidden by Allah? And had it not been for the Word about the judgment, the affairs between them would have been settled - surely for the unjust is a painful torment.

You will see the evildoers being afraid of what they have earned, but it will happen on them. But Paradise is the place for the believing righteous; they will receive whatever they wish for, from their God. And that is the Grand Blessing.

This is the glad tiding for His servants who believe and do good deeds. Say: "Save that you shall show mercy to the relatives - for this, I seek no wages of you!" And, whoever does a good deed, We will increase the good for him. Indeed, Allah is Oft-Forgiving, All-Appreciative.

Or that they say: "He is conjuring lies against Allah?" Had Allah willed, He would have set the seal upon your heart. And Allah eliminates the falsehood, vindicating the Truth by His Signs. Surely He is the Knower of what is in the breasts.
He accepts the repentance of His servants, and Pardons the sins; and, He knows all that you do.
And admits into His Grace those who believe and do good and increases them in it. And, as to the disbelievers, awaits a chastising doom.

And if Allah had expanded the provisions for His servants, they would transgress on the earth; so, he has prepared them in a measure as per His will. Surely, He is the Knower of His servants, being Ever-Watchful.
It is He who sends down the rain after they despair; and, He spreads well His Blessings. And He is the Protector and Praiseworthy.
In the origination of the heavens and the earth, and in the living beings being spread out in them both - therein are of His Signs; so, when He wish, He is All-Powerful to gather them.
And the afflictions that reach you is because of what your hands have earned; but, He forgives them much.
And you cannot nullify Him on the earth; and, there is neither a Protector nor a Helper but Allah.
And of His Signs are the ships, sail like mountains in the sea.
If He so Wishes, He calms the weather and so, they are quiet on the surface; surely, in it are the Signs for the patient and the grateful ones.
Or He would drown it for what they had earned; and, He Forgives much.
And, those who dispute about Our Signs - may know they have no refuge.
So, whatever is with you is but this world's pleasures; to those who believe and put their trust in their God, - what is with Allah is Noble and Lasting.
They will forgive when they are angry, even as they guard against sin and shame.
And they will abide by their God's Command and endure - and, they will counsel their affairs among them, and provide from what We have Bestowed them.
And they will preserve when wronged.
The recompense for the evil is the like of it; but, whoever forgives and makes peace, his goodly reward is with Allah - He indeed loves not the unjust.
So, whoever amends after an injustice upon him, there is no way against him.601
But whosoever is unjust and pert, against them is the way; for them is a painful chastisement.
And whoso endures and forgives, it indeed is a disposition, formidable.
And whoso Allah sends astray, after that he has no protector. And you will find on the Hour, the unjust on seeing the torment saying, "Is there a way out for us?"

And you shall see them disgraced when they are brought before it, glancing furtively. The believers will say, "Those who brought loss to them and their family are indeed in perdition on the Hour." Know that the unjust will be in the lasting torment.
But for Allah there will be no guiding helpers for them; and, whomever Allah has sent astray, no way has he.
Answer the call of your God before the Day arrives from Allah when one will not find any way of escape - on that Day there is no averting nor refuge for you, nor will ye have denial.

But if they turn away, We have not sent you as a guardian over them; to deliver is your duty. Man indeed is joyful if he is made to taste Our Favour; but if an evil befalls him for what his hands have earned, surely man is ungrateful.
Allah's is the kingdom of the heavens and the earth; so, He Originates what He wills - He gives female children to whom He wishes and male children to whom He wishes.
Or He gives both male and female children; and, He makes whom He will infertile - surely, He is All-Knowing, All-Powerful.
It is not that Allah speaks to anyone but by Inspiration, or from behind a veil or through a Messenger who will deliver you His will by His Leave. He indeed is Most High, Wise.

Thus, We have Inspired you the enlightenment; you were not aware of the Book or about the Faith. But We cause Our Inspiration as the Insight and Guidance to whom We will of Our bondmen; and, indeed you guide to the Straight Path.
This is Allah's Way. And Allah's is what is in the Heavens and the earth. Lo! Unto Him is the return of all affairs.
Ha Meem602
By the Book, Revealing!
Know that We have indeed given this Quran in Arabic.
And, it is in the Soul, with Us - the Most-High, Wise.
Would that We shall take away the Revelations from you because you had become sinful?
And how many a Messenger had We sent to nations before you!
But they did not but mock at every Prophet who came to them.
But We had destroyed those who were mightier than them; the examples of those of old have gone.
If you say to them, "Who Originated the Heavens and earth?" They will surely say, "He who is All-Powerful and All-Knowing, Originated them."
It is He who made the earth vast and made broad ways in it that ye may find the path.
And Who sends down the rain from the sky in a measure thereby reviving the dead land; and, thus will ye be raised.
He created all the pairs; and, He created for you the ships and the cattle to ride upon.

That ye may perch upon their backs; and, when you are in the saddle, remember your God's Mercy more, and that you shall say, "Purity be to God, who made these subservient to us when we had no power over them."
And, "Surely we are to return to our God."
And they make some of His servants, His children; surely, man is ingrate.
Or had He chosen of His creations daughters for Him and sons for you?
When a glad tiding is given to one with that which he equated to the Bountiful, his face turns black; and, he is filled with anger.
What! that which is adorned with the jewels, and that which cannot make clear arguments in any affair?
And they equate the servants of the angels of the Most Benevolent to females. Did they witness their creation? Their testimonies are kept in record for the questioning!
And they say, "Had the Benevolent willed we would not have worshiped them." They have no knowledge whatsoever of that; they only lie.
Or have We given them the Wisdom before so that they have the hold?
Nay, they say, "Verily, we saw our fathers upon a path, and we indeed follow their rituals."
Thus, We did not send a Warner ere ye to any town, but the wealthy in it said, "Surely, we saw our fathers upon a way, and we follow their footsteps."
He said, "What, even if I bring you a better way than the way you found your fathers upon?" They said, "We surely are rejecters in that with what you are sent."
Therefore We avenged them. Then behold, what was the end of those who belied!
And when Ibrahim said to his father and his folks, "I stay clear of what you worship!"
"Except Him who originated me; for He shall show me the Way."
And he made firm his say for their generations, that, they might return.
But I let them and their fathers enjoy for a period until there came to them the Truth and a Messenger, clear.
But when the Truth came to them, they said, "It is a manifest sorcery! And we certainly shall reject it."
And they say, "Should this Quran not be sent down to any respectable person of the twin cities?

Do these distribute the Favour of your God? But We measure for their sustenance in this world; and, We have raised in degree some, over some others so that they are made to serve; the Mercy of your God is greater than what they amass.

And were it not for that that the people would, as a whole, become of the disbelievers, We would have aggrandised with silver - the roof-tops and the stairways of the houses of disbelievers in the Benevolent. 603
And doors to their houses and couches whereon to recline.
And ornaments of gold; but these are the mere enjoyments of the present life, and the life to come from the God is, for the God-fearing.
Whoso blinds himself to the remembrance of the Most Benevolent, to him We appoint Satan for comrade.
And they obstruct him from the righteousness, but they think they are guided aright.
Until he comes to Us, when he will say, "Alas! The distance of the two Easts should have been between you and me." An evil comrade!
You avail not a benefit this day because you were unjust, and you will be companions in the torment.
So, can you make the deaf hear? Or can you guide the blind and he who is openly astray?
Whether We take you away, We shall requite them.
Or We shall show you Our Promise to them; surely We have power over them.
Hold fast to that which has been inspired to you; you indeed are on the right path.
Verily, it is a glad tiding to you and to your people; and, soon you will be brought to account.
And to those of the messengers We sent before you: Said, "Have We appointed deities to serve beside the Most Beneficent?"
We indeed sent Musa with Our Signs to Firaun and his chieftains. He said, "Verily, I am a Messenger of the God of the worlds."
But when he brought them Our Signs, lo, they mocked at it.
But each Sign We showed them was greater than the next; then We seized them with the torment that haply they might return.
And they said, "O Sorcerer! Entreat your God for us by the pact He has made with you. Surely we will be guided."
But when We removed their affliction, behold! they broke their word.
And Firaun said to his people, "Is not I possessing the authority over "Misr?" And beheld not ye, the rivers flowing beneath me?"
"Or am I not greater than he, the disgraced and scarcely makes things clear?"
"Why has he not been presented with golden bracelets or a band of angels not accompanied him?"
He treated his people lowly, and they submitted to him; and, thus they have indeed become a people surely transgressed.
So, when they angered Us We took retribution from them, and We drowned them all.
And We made them a precedent and an example for those after them.
And when Isa, son of Maryam was exemplified, the people laughed out.
And they say, "Who is better - our deities or is he? They take not him but for dispute; nay, they are people, contentious.
He is not but a servant on whom We blessed Our Favour and made him an exemplar for the people of Israel.
And had We willed, We would have made the angels to be the viceroys in the earth.
Verily, he is the Sign of the Hour! So, surely, have no doubt about that; and, follow me; this is the Straight Path.604
And let shaitan not forbid you; surely, he is to you an enemy avowed.
And when Isa came with clear Signs, he said, "Verily, I have brought to you the wisdom; and, I will clarify you certain of your affairs wherein are disputing. So fear Allah, and obey me."
Truly, Allah is my God and your God; so turn to Him, and this is the Straight Path.
But among them, the schismatics differed; so, for those who transgressed, suffer the curse of the day of torment.
Do they expect other than the Hour coming on them, of a sudden, while they perceive not?
Except the God-fearing, the friends on that day will be enemies one to another.
"My servants! Fear not ye, this day; nor will ye grieve."
Such are they who believed in Our Word, attaining Peace.
Enter the Paradise, well pleased - you and your companions!
Golden plates and bowls will come around them. And therein are what they wished for and comfort to their eyes. And, "You are immortal, in there."
And you inherited this Paradise, as recompense to that you were doing.
Therein for you are ample varieties of fruits wherefrom will ye eat.
Assuredly, the wrong-doers will be in the torment of Hell.
Nowise will it be lightened for them; and, therein are they in despair.
We have wronged them not, but they wronged.
And they will cry and say, "O the Guard! May your God finish us!" He will say, "Surely ye shall endure, forever."
Verily, We brought you the Truth, but most of you were averse to the Truth.
Or do they decide on anything? Nay, We decide.
Or do they think that We hear not their secret talks and what they plan in privacy? yes, but Our Messengers are with them, recording.
Say, "I shall be the first one to worship if the Benevolent One had a son."
Glorified be the God of the heavens and earth, and of the Wisdom of the Universes, from what they ascribe.
So, until they meet their Promised Day, leave them drowned in their play.
And He is the God of the heavens and the God of the earth; and, He is the Wise, the Knower.
Holy is He, with Whom is the Kingdom of the heavens and the earth, and what is in between them; and, with Him is the Wisdom of the Hour, and your return is unto Him.
And whoever they call besides Allah, have no authority to intercede, except those who bear witness, standing by the justice.
And if you ask them who created them, they will surely say, "Allah!" So, how then are they deluded?
And his saying, "Our God! These are a people who believe not."
So, slight them aside and seek Peace. Soon they will know.
Ha Meem605
By the Book, clear.
Verily, We sent it down on the Blessed Night, and We indeed are ever warning.
In it is determined, the wisdom of everything.
The Command is from Us; surely, We were ever sending.
A Mercy from your God; He indeed is the Hearing, the Knowing.
If you are steadfast, - the God of the Heavens and the earth and all in between them.
There is no God but He; He gives life and causes death. The God of you, and of your fathers, the ancients.
And they are playful, doubting.
So expect the Day, when the sky brings a visible smoke.
It will surround the humans, it is a painful torment.
"Our God, remove this torment from us; surely we will be believers."
How will their mere thoughts avail them, while a clear Messenger has come to them?
They turned their backs on him saying, "Tutored, Mad!"
Surely, We will avert the torment for a while; "surely, you shall return!"
One day, Our hold will be firm; surely We will avenge.
And We certainly put to trial the people of Firaun before them; and, a Noble Messenger came unto them.
Saying, "Give up to me Allah's servants; surely I am to you a trusted Messenger."
"And rise you not above Allah; surely, I have come to you with Clear Authority."
"And verily, I seek refuge in my God and your God that you shall not stone me to death."
"And if you do not trust me, stay clear of me."
He turned to his God saying, "These are a sinful people."
"Set out by night with my servants; certainly, you will be followed."
"And leave the sea divided, for surely they are an army to be drowned."
How many were the gardens and water springs that they left behind!
And the paddy fields and noble mansions!
And the pleasures wherein they took delight!
Thus it were; and, We made another generation to inherit them.
So, for them the sky and the earth wept not; nor were they respited.
And We saved the descendants of Israel from the humiliating torment.
And from Firaun; surely he was arrogant and one of the transgressing.
We indeed, knowingly chose them from the people of the world.
And We gave them the Signs wherein was a clear trial.
These men do say,
"We have nought but the first death, nor will we be raised again."
"If you speak truly, bring our fathers, yore."
Are they better? or the people of Tubba'u and those before them? They indeed were wrong-doers, and We destroyed them.
And We have not originated the Heavens and the earth and all in between in play.
We have not originated these but in truth; yet, most of them know it not.
Assuredly, the Day of Judgment is the appointed time for them all.
The Day when a friend avails not another in aught, and they will not be helped.
Except those upon whom Allah has Mercy. Surely, He is All-Mighty, Most Merciful.
Verily, Zaqqum, the tree-
Is the food for the sinners;
It will be as molten brass, seething in the stomach;
Like boiling water.
"Drag him away to the centre of the blazing Hell."
Then, "Pour the tormenting scalding water on his head."
"Taste it! You forsooth were the powerful, the glorified."
"Surely, this is which you were doubting about!"
"The God-fearing will be in safe place."
"Amidst Paradise' splendor and water springs"
"Seated, facing each other, in their grand garments of  'Sundhus and Isthabrak'.
Thus, We will join them with the companions having 'distinct vision'.
Secured therein, calling for fruits in kinds.
After the death before, therein, they will not taste the death; and He has secured them from the torment of Hell.
And your God's Grand Favour, and the Victory, Greatest!
That they might bring to mind, We made this easy, in your mother tongue.
Therefore expect ye; they are expecting too.
Ha Meem606
This Book has been sent down by the All-Mighty, the Most Wise.
For the believers, surely are the Signs in the Heavens and earth.
And in that He has originated you and in the spreading out of the living beings are the Signs for the believing people.
