And herein are the Signs: in the changing night and day; and, when Allah brings down Grace from the sky, thereby giving life to the dead land; and, in the ever altering nature of the breeze for those who mind.
These are the Signs of Allah that We inspire to you in Truth. Apart from Allah and His hadiths, i.e., the Truth, which other hadiths do they believe?
Woe to the lying sinners.
He lends ears to Allah's Signs elucidated to him; then he becomes headstrong and feigns as though he has not heard; so give him the good tidings of a chastising punishment.
If he knows any of Our Signs, he takes it in mockery; for him is a humiliating punishment.
Before them is Hell; and nought of what they had earned will avail them, nor, other than Allah, those they had taken as protectors - for them is a grave penalty.
This is the Straight Path. Whoever has rejected the path of their God, for them is the harshest punishment.
It is Allah who subjected the sea to you, and that by His Command the ships may run, and thereof you shall seek His Favour; and, that you may show thanks."
And He, by His Mercy, has subjected to you what is in the heavens and what is in the earth, and surely in it are, many a Sign for those who ponder.
Say to the believers, "Forgive those who believe not in the appointed Hour; to humans, He would recompense in a just manner for what they had earned."
Whoever is righteous, is only for his good, and whoever wrongs, his wrong is for him; then, to your God you will be returned.
We certainly gave the Book, the Law and the Prophethood to the descendants of Israel; and, We gave them luxury, and We made them above the populations of the world.

And We gave them the clear Command, but they differed after the clear proofs came to them out of envy; your God indeed will decide between them on the Day of Reckoning concerning that wherein they were at variance.
And We have set you on the commendable way; so follow it; and proceed not behind the caprices of those who do not know.
Surely they cannot extend you a help against Allah; and, verily the wicked do help each other. But to the God-fearing, Allah is the Protector.
This is a clear Proof, and a righteous path and a Mercy for the faithful.
Or, do the evil ones think We will make them equal with those who believe in righteousness? And, in life and death are they the same? Evil is their judgment.
Allah has originated the heavens and earth in Truth; that each one shall be recompensed justly for what he had earned, and they will not be wronged.

Did yo see who had taken his caprice as Godliness? And while he knows - Allah lets him go astray, sealed his hearing and heart, and has drawn a veil over his eyes. So, after Allah, who is there to Guide him. Will ye not then heed?
And they say, "There is no life apart from this world; we die, and we live, and nothing but the ageing destroys us; but, of that, they have no knowledge; they merely guess."
And when We show them Our Signs, all but what they argue with is this: "Bring us our forefathers, then, if you are truthful."
Say, "Allah gives you life, then gives you death, then He will gather you all on the Hour, wherein is no doubt - but most men do not know."
And the kingdom of the heavens and earth belong to Allah, and when the Hour arrives, liars will be the losers.
You will see each community kneeled. Each community will be called to its record. "This day, you will be recompensed for that you were doing."
"This is Our Record of you that shall speak the Truth. Verily, We were recording all that you used to do."
So, whoever were believing righteous, their God will make them enter His Grace. That is a clear Victory.
But to the disbelievers: "Were not My Signs shown to you clearly? Then you were unjust, waxing proud!"
And when said, "Indeed, Allah's Word is True, and doubt not about the Hour," you said, "We do not know what that Hour is, and we have only a surmise, and are by no means convinced."
All their evils will become manifest to them, and that with which they mocked shall surround them.
And it will be said, "We forget you this day as you forgot the meeting of this Day. Hell is your dwelling place, and there is not a helper for you."
"It is because you had taken Allah's Signs for jest and that the life of this world has deceived you." And, on this day, they will not be delivered from it, nor will they be forgiven.
So, Glory be to Allah, the God of the Heavens, the God of the earth and the God of the worlds.
And to Him is the Reverence in the Heavens and the earth. And He is the All-Mighty, the All-Wise.
Ha Meem607
This Wisdom has been sent down from Allah, the All-Mighty, the All-Wise.
We have not created the heavens and the earth and what is in between save but with Truth and for a term appointed; but, the unbelievers turned away from that whereof they were warned.

"Have you not considered that you call upon besides Allah? Show me what they have created of the earth? Or do they have any share in the heavens? Bring a Book before this, or any portion whose wisdom surpasses if you speak honestly."
And who is more astray than those who call upon besides Allah, that shall not answer them till the Last Day? And, they do not even hear their calling.
And when the humans are gathered, these will be their enemies, and they will deny their worshipping.
And whoever denied the Truth when it came unto them with Our revealing Signs to them, say, "It is a manifest sorcery!"

Or do they say, "He has forged it?" Say, "If I have forged it, you will have no power to help me against Allah. He is Best Aware of what you utter concerning it. Sufficient is He for a witness between me and you! And He is Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful."
"I am not a new one of the Messengers, nor do I know as to what will happen to me or to you; and, I follow not except what is inspired in me; and, I am but a plain Warner."

"Did you consider, when this has come from Allah, and when a witness from among the people of Israel says, "Similar it is!" and believes, - while you deny arrogantly?" Allah indeed will not guide the wrong doers.
The unbelievers, concerning the believers, say, "Had there been aught good, they would not have advanced to it ahead of us." And while they are not in guidance by it, say, "This is an ancient lie!"
Before this, the Book, given to Musa had been a Guidance and Mercy. And this Book in Arabic testifies to it that it warns the wrongdoers and gives glad tidings to the good-doers.
Surely, those who say, "Our God is Allah!" and are firm, they will have no fear, neither will they grieve.
They are the inhabitants of Heaven wherein they abide as a recompense for their good deeds.

And We enjoined upon man that he may be kind to his parents; his mother carried him with difficulty and delivered him in strain; and, her carrying and weaning him is thirty months; when he attains age and reaches his forty years, he will say, "God! Grant me Mercy to show thanks to you for Your Grace upon me and my parents, and that I may do good which pleases Thee. And, make my descendants, the righteous people. Verily, I turn to you alone; and, surely I am of those who submit to Peace.
We accept the best deeds of such inhabitants of the heaven and pass over their evil deeds; and, the word given to them is the Word, True.

But he says to his parents, "Fie upon you! Do you frighten me that I will be raised again when generations have passed away before me?" Both his parents said to him, "Why this woe on you! Believe! Verily, Allah's Word is True," seeking Allah's help. To this, he said, "All these are the fables of the ancients! "
The situation of these are the same as the nation of jinns and men who passed away before them, against whom the word has come true. Verily, they were losers.
And all gain a status from what they do - that He may recompense them for what they have done, and they will not be wronged.

And on the Day when the disbelievers are exposed to the Fire, said, "While living on the earth, you dissipated all the good things for a game; so, this day you are awarded with the humiliating chastisement for your unjust pride and aggression on the earth."
And, brethren of Aad. Though there have been Warners before and after him, he warned his people from atop the sand dunes: "Verily, I fear for you the doom of a Mighty day."
They said, "Did you come here to turn us away from our deities? If you are truly speaking, bring us that wherewith you threaten us."
He said, "The Wisdom is surely with Allah, and I convey to you that wherewith I have been sent. But I see you as a people ignorant."
Then, when they saw the clouds coming towards their valleys, they said, "This is the pouring clouds for us." "Nay, this is what you hastened for - the tempest - in it is the painful torment."608
"By the command of its God, it destroyed all things; so when the day broke, nothing was seen but the houses. Thus do We recompense the people given to sin.

And We indeed, gave them the luxuries that We have not provided you, and We had given them hearing, vision and hearts. But their ears, eyes and hearts did not avail them in aught while they were rejecting the Signs of Allah. And what surrounded them was that wherewith they used to mock at.
And We have indeed destroyed the cities round about you; and, We continually showed Our Signs that they might return.
Then why have the deities they had taken besides Allah as a means of approach, did not help them? Nay, they vanished from them - they were their lies and what they forged.
And when We turned some of the Jinns to you to hear this Quran - and when they came there, they said, "Silence!" When it was over, they returned to their people, warning.
They said, "Our people! We indeed listened to a Reading. It has been sent after Musa, confirming what was before it, guiding to the Truth and to a right path."
"Our people! Answer and believe in him who calls you to Allah; He will forgive you your sins, and deliver you from a painful torment."
"But whoso does not answer Allah's summoner, cannot frustrate Him in the earth, and has no protector apart from Him; those are in manifest error.
Allah, the Originator of the heavens and the earth and who was not fatigued by their creation, is able to bring life to the dead. Yes! He indeed has power over all things.
And when the rejecters are brought before the Fire, He will say: "Is it not True? They will say, "By our God, it is!" He will say, "Taste the torment rejection!"

"Observe patience as those steadfast of the Messengers! Do not hasten for them! When they see what they were Promised, on that day they will say, "They had not tarried for a second of a single day." It has to be clearly revealed! So, except the transgressors will any be destroyed?
Those who were rejecting and hinder Allah's Path, He has nullified their deeds.
But whoso believe and do good - and perceive that which has been revealed to the 'dignified', as the Truth from their God, He removes their evil from them, and sets their affairs aright.
For, they indeed follow the lies while the believers follow the Truth from their God; thus Allah strikes their similitudes for the mankind.

If you are forced to confront the disbelievers, make them hang their heads down; if they brave, tighten their fetters - until you subdue them. Then release them after a compensation from them, or out of mercy; this, if Allah had willed, He would have avenged Himself upon them. Allah tests you, some with some others; And whoever is killed in the path of Allah, never will He waste their deeds.
He will guide them, and dispose their minds aright.
And He will admit them into the Paradise He has made known to them.
O believers! If you help Allah, He will help you, and strengthen your stand.
Then, woe to those who reject; He will make vain all their deeds.
This is because they were averse to what Allah has sent down; so He made their deeds vain.
Beheld they not travelling on the earth, the end of those before them? Allah has decimated them; and, the like of it is for those who reject.
This is because Allah is the Protector for the believers, and that the rejectors have no protector.
Indeed Allah admits those who believe and do good things into the heavens beneath which the rivers flow; but the rejecters do enjoy and eat as the beasts; and, the Fire is their dwelling place.
And there were many a stronger nation than those who drove you out; We destroyed them and, there was not a helper for them.
So, is he who is on the clear path from his God, like him to whom his evil work is made fair-seeming, and such as follow their lusts?

Is the similitude of the promised Heaven for those who fear God is: there in are the rivers of clear water unpolluted, rivers of milk unchanged in taste, rivers of the grapes' juice which gives pleasantness to those who drink and rivers of honey. And for them are fruits from all kinds and forgiveness of their God, like the one who stays in the Fire forever and to whom will be given scorching water to drink, which cuts up their intestines?

And there are among them who hear you, but when they disperse, they say to those who have the wisdom: "What did he say just now?" Upon their hearts has Allah set the seal. And they follow not but their desires.
And those who are righteous, Allah increases them in Guidance and instils piety.
Do they expect aught other than the Hour coming on to them suddenly? Surely its Signs have come; so, how will the admonition help them after it has reached them?
So, know that there is no God but Allah, and seek forgiveness for your sins and for the believing men and women; and, Allah knows your activities and your resting place.

And the believers say: "Shouldn't it be that a chapter is sent down?" But if a chapter is sent down with a firm commandment that they shall endure for the cause, then, in whose heart is a disease, you will find them staring at you with a stare, as if one swoons of death. But it is better for them."
Obedience and kind words. So, when a matter is determined, and if they were faithful to Allah, then, it is well for them.
If you turn back, will you create confusion on the land and sever your bonds of kin?
Such as these whom Allah has cursed, and made them deaf and blinded their sight.
What! Do they not reflect on this Quran? Or are there locks on the hearts?
Surely, whoever turns away from the Straight Path knowingly, Shaitan made it fair-seeming to them and furthered them.
It is because they turn to those who reject that which Allah sends down and say: "We will follow you in certain aspects." But Allah knows their secrets.
So how shall it be when the angels capture their souls smiting their faces and their backs?
It is because they followed that which shall anger Allah and that they hated His satisfaction. So He made null their deeds.
Or do they think that Allah will not reveal to them the evil nature of those who have the disease in their hearts?
And had We willed, surely We would have shown them to you; you will know them from their marks, and certainly you will know them from their words. And Allah knows all that you do.
And We shall test you until such time that We knew who among you strive in patience. And We keep a watch over that you do.

And surely those rejecters who prevent from Allah's path and those who show obstinacy in disobedience to the Messenger after they knew well the Straightway, - they shall harm not in aught against Allah. And He will cause their works to fail.
O believers! Obey Allah and obey the Messenger, and waste not your deeds.
Allah indeed will not forgive them who while rejecting, prevents from Allah's way, and then, die as rejecters.
Do not compromise becoming weak while you are above them; Allah is with you - and He will not lessen your deeds.
Verily, the life of this world is fun and game, but if you believe and fear your God, He will bless you with your right; and, He asks not you, your wealth.
Even if He asks and presses you for it, you will be stingy; and, He will make plain your heart.

Behold! You are a people called to spend in Allah's cause; but, there are niggardly among you - whoever is stingy, Allah is Needless, and you are the needy. So, if you turn away, Allah will replace you with a new generation who are not your likes.
Surely We have given you a manifest Victory.
And that Allah shall forgive you, your wrongs of the past and the latter, and that He might Guide you by His Bountiful Mercy;
And that Allah shall help you with a Mighty Help;

And that they shall strengthen their belief in the Faith, Allah sent down Peace in the hearts of the believers; and, Allah's are the hosts of the heavens and the earth; and, Allah is the Knowing, the Wise.

That He may admit the believing men and women to the Paradises beneath which the rivers flow wherein to abide forever. He will remove all their evils, and ever is this, in the sight of Allah, the Mighty Victory.

Allah will punish the hypocritical men and the hypocritical women, and the idolatrous men and the idolatrous women; evil is hovering over them, and on them is Allah's wroth and the curse; and, He has prepared the Hell for them - the most evil a destination!
And Allah's are the hosts of the heavens and the earth. And Allah is Ever Mighty, Wise.
Surely We have sent you as a Witness, a Bearer of good tiding, and Warning.
That you may believe in Allah and His Messenger, succour Him, and Honour Him at dawn and in the evening.

Surely those who pledge before you, swear before Allah; Allah's watch is over that which they promise; so whoever breaks their oath, they indeed break to his self-destruction. And whoever performs his promise, for him is the swift and a generous reward from Allah.

And the ignorant who sit back will say, "Our properties and our households have pressured us to our duties; so, seek forgiveness for us." They say with their tongues that which is not in their hearts. Say, "If Allah wills upon you a harm or good, who shall have the authority in it against Him? Nay, Allah is All-Aware of what you do."

"Nay, surely you were of the belief that the Messenger and the believers shall not return to their families! And this was beautified for you; so you had an evil thought, and you have become a people wiped out.
And whoever believes not in Allah and His Messenger - then verily, We have prepared for the unbelievers a Blaze.
And Allah's is the kingdom of the heavens and the earth - He forgives whom He wills; He punishes whom He wills. Allah is Oft-Returning, All-Merciful.

When you set forth for the gains of the spoils, those who sat behind will say, "Permit us to follow you!" They wish to change Allah's Order. Say, "Follow not us! Thus has Allah said before." But they will say, "Nay, you are jealous of us." Nay! They are, but for a few, learn not.

They said to the ignorant, "You will soon be called against a formidable people; you shall stand up against them, or they shall obey you; then if you submit, Allah will reward you beautifully. But if you sit back as you had sit back before, He will punish you with a chastising punishment."

There is no blame upon the blind, nor upon the lame, nor upon the ill - and, whoso believes in Allah and His Messenger, He will admit them into Paradises beneath which the rivers flow. But whoever turns away, He will torment him with a severe torment.
When the believers swore submission to you, under the tree1, He Graced upon them tranquillity, knowing their hearts; and rewarded them a near Victory.609
And He made them gain innumerable booties. Allah is the All-Mighty, the Wise.
And, Allah Promise generous rewards to you that you shall receive. And He gave it to you swiftly and averted the evils of men from you; that it shall be a Sign unto the believers, and a Guidance.
Awaiting is another; you deserve it not yet. But Allah is surely protecting it. Allah has Power over all things.
If the unbelievers had fought you, they would have turned back and flown. Then, they would not have found any protection nor any help for them.
Thus, has been the Way of Allah - it has happened before; so, thou shalt not see any change in Allah's Way.
And it is He who sheltered you in Mecca, after making you victors over them; He restrained their hands from you and restrained your hands from them. Allah is Ever Watchful over that you do.

It is the unbelievers who kept you from the peaceful living place and prevented the offerings from reaching where it is intended. And had there not been the believing men and the believing women, you would have harmed them unawares. Thus, you would have been harmed by them without your knowledge; that Allah might admit you into His Grace. If only the believers had stayed clear, We would have severely punished the unbelievers.

When the unbelievers set in their hearts zealousness, the zealotry of pagandom, Allah sent down Shechina upon His Messenger and the believers, and strengthened them upon His Words, and they were worthy of, and befitted it most. And Allah is the Knower of all things.

Surely, to the Messenger, Allah has made His dream, real. Had Allah willed, you will indeed enter the Blessed place fearlessly and beautifully, with your hairs done neatly. And you shall not fear; therefore, He Knows that you know not - and He had Bestowed upon you a heartening victory.
It is He who sent His Messenger with the Guidance and the True Path, that it may overwhelm every other way of life, and Allah suffices as Witness.

Muhammad is the Messenger of the world. Those with him are stern with the unbelievers, and merciful towards themselves. You will find them considerate, humble, and seekers of Mercy and Satisfaction from Allah. And their mark is: Humility visible on their faces - this is the Sign of them in Thourat. And their mark in Injeel is: Like a grain. It sprouts and stands upon its stem, strengthening it. Then, it flourishes delighting the sowers, spreading out fortifying upon its stem by which Allah enrages the unbelievers - but whoever among them believe and do good deeds, for them, from Allah is the Word of Forgiveness and a Mighty Reward.
O believers! Advance not before Allah and His Messenger; fear Allah. Surely, Allah is the Hearing, the Knowing.
O believers! Raise not your voices above the voice of the Prophet, and be not loud in your speech to him, as you speak aloud to one another, lest your works will be lost while you are unaware.
Those who lower their voices before the Messenger of Allah, He indeed tests their hearts for God-fearing - for them is the Forgiveness and a Great Reward.
Those who call you from outside your rooms, the most of them do not understand.
And it would be better for them, had they waited until you come forth unto them. Allah is Oft- Forgiving, Most Merciful.
O believers! If a wrong-doer brings you a piece of news, be well-informed of it, lest you might wrong a community without knowledge, and then, you will be sorry for that you had committed.

Be informed - Verily, Allah's Messenger is with you. If he were to obey you in most of your affairs, it is you who will be distressed; but, Allah made belief dearer to you and beautified it in your hearts, and made hateful to you the rejection, wrong-doing and disobedience. Such are the Guided.
It is because of the Mercy and Blessing from Allah, and Allah is Knowing, Wise.

And if two sections among the believers fight, make peace between them; but then, if one of the disputes transgresses against the other, encounter the transgressors until it returns to the fold of Allah. And if it returns, make peace between them justly; surely Allah loves the just.
Surely the believers are brethren; so make peace between your brothers, and fear Allah that He might show Mercy on you.

O believers! Let not one party speak ill of another party, for they may be better than them; likewise women shall not, of other women for they may be better than them. And despise not one another, and insult not with nicknames because, after the belief, deriding one by nicknames is very evil. And whoever does not repent are the unjust.

O believers! Turn away from assumptions; surely, some are evil, and keep off from penetrating into others' lives; neither involve ye in backbiting. Would any of you eat the flesh of his dead brother? You will abhor it; so, fear Allah. Surely Allah Accepts repentance. He is the Most Merciful.

O humankind! We indeed originated you from male and female; and, that you may know one another We caused you to fall into communities and sects. Surely the most noble in the sight of Allah is the most God-fearing of you. Allah indeed is Well-Aware, All-Knowing.

The Arabs say: "We too believe in Allah!" Say: "You have not believed; but ye may say ye, a people satisfied in the ceremonies, for the faith has not entered your hearts. If you follow Allah and His Messenger, He will not reduce in aught of your good deeds. Allah indeed is Ever-Forgiving, Most Merciful."
Verily, the believers are those who believe in Allah and His Messenger, and who without a suspicion sacrifice in the path of Allah, their wealth and lives - such are truthful.
Say: "Do you teach righteousness to Allah? Allah knows well all in the heavens and the earth; and, Allah encompasses all things."

They count it as an honour to thee that they had accepted Peace. Say, "Count not that you had benefitted me by supporting righteousness; if you are truthful, it is Allah who has favoured you, causing you to believe in the path."
Verily Allah is the Knower of the secrets of the Heavens and the Earth. And Allah sees all you do.
Qaf - By the Noble Quran!
But they wonder that there has come to them a Warner Messenger from amongst them; so the disbelievers say: "It is a wonder!"
After our death, and have become dust? That is a far returning!
We know for sure the extent to which the earth has shrunken, and with Us is the Book, secured.
But they denied when the Truth came to them; so they are in a case confused.
Have they not seen the sky above them - How We have made it and adorned it? And that therein is not a flaw?
And We have expanded the earth and have planted thereon the mountains firm, and produced the beautiful nature pairing with one another.
A vision and a reminder for every servant who turns.
And We send down the blessed water from the sky creating thereby gardens and field grain of harvest.
And tall palm-trees with clusters of dates.
A soothing for the servants - and therewith We raise the town after it is dead; even so is the coming forth.
Denied before them - the people of Nut, and the men of Russ and Samud.
And Aad, Firaun and the brothers of Lut.
The dwellers of gardens, the people of 'Tubbau' - all tried to falsify the Prophets. So, my warning came true.
So, were We wearied by the first creation? Nay, but they doubt about the creation anew.
And We certainly created man, and We knew as to what his mind speaks to him; and, We are nearer to him than his life-vein.
And when a witness each records sitting on the right and the left.610
Not a word he utters without the watcher by him, recording.
The torment of death brings the Truth: "Wherever you ran trying to avert, is this."
And there will be the Call! That will be the Day of the warning!
Each soul will come with a bringer and a witness.
"You kept your eyes shut to this! We have removed your veil off you; so this day, clear is your vision!"
Then, the one with him would say: "Here! It is with me, ready!"
"Throw ye twain, every froward disbeliever into hell!"
"Disturber of the good, disquieter and doubter."
"He made another God with Allah; so, ye twain, cast him to a terrible doom."
His comrade would say: "Our God! I did not mislead him, but he was in far error."
He will say, "Engage not in argument before Me; I have surely forewarned you!"
"The Word is not changed with Me; I wrong not My servants."
On that Day We will ask Hell: "Are you full?" It will say, "Are there much more?"
And to the God-fearing, the heaven will be made nearer, not afar.
"This is the Word had been for you, and to each who guarded, fearing God."
Who fear the Benevolent in secrecy, and who turn to God with a returning heart.
"Enter it in Peace! This is the Day you will abide here, forever."
In it will be all they Wish, and much more is with Us.
And how many a stronger generation in valour than them had We destroyed before them; they ran into different towns; then, did they ever find a refuge?
Whoever has the heart and gives ears with intent, for him indeed is the Sign therein.
Verily, We Originated the heavens and the earth and what is in between in six periods; yet, no fatigue touched Us.
So observe Patience under what they say; and, Praise the Glory of your God before the dawn and before the dusk.
And Praise His Glory in the night, subdued.
And Listen on the Day, from him who shall call you from close.
On that Day they shall hear the blast in truth; that is the Day of coming forth
Surely, We give life, and We cause death, and you are to return to Us.
The Day when the Earth will split asunder from about them, hastening forth; that is a gathering easy for Us.
We know what they say; you are not a compeller over them; so, admonish with this Quran those who fear the Warning.
By that which scatters to dust;
By that which carry the load;
By that which sail smooth;
By those who distribute by Command -
Verily, what you are promised is True;
And the recompense is sure to happen.
By the sky full of beauty;
You art but in differing speech.
Whoever is turned away from it, is turned away.
The liars will perish.
They forget due to ignorance.
They say: "When is the Day of Recompense?"
That is the Day they will be tried over Fire.
"Taste your torment! This is that which you were seeking to hasten!"
Surely the God-fearing will be in the Gardens of Springs.
They will accept what their God has Blessed them with; they indeed were good doers before.
They sleep not in the night but a little.
And they would be seeking Forgiveness in the latter part of the night.
And in their wealth is a guarantee for the have-nots and the needy.
And on the earth are the Signs for those firm in Faith.
And in yourselves; will you then not perceive?
And in the heavens are what you were promised, and your sustenance.
Then, by the God of the heavens and the earth! It is as good a Truth as the words you utter is yours.
Has the Hadith-News reached you, of the respectable guests of Ibrahim?
When they came to him, said: "Peace be upon you!" He said: "May there be Peace!" 'These people are strangers!'
Even so, he went to his folks and brought a fat piece of calf.
And laid it before them. Said, "Will you not eat?"
Thereat, he had a sense of apprehension about them. They said, "Have no fear!" And they gave the good news to him of a wise son.
Then, hearing this, his wife came out before them crying smiting her face saying: "An old woman, and barren!"
"Thus does your God say; verily, He is All-Wise, All-Knowing."
He said, "O Messengers! What is your errand?"
They said, "We indeed have been sent to a sinful people.
"To send down upon them stones of clay.
"Marked by your God for the transgressors.
"So we had moved out the believers from their town.
"And we did not find but the folks of one house who are in Peace.
"We had left in this a reminder for those who fear a chastising punishment."
And in Musa - when We sent Musa to Firaun with Our clear Proof;
He turned his back with his court, saying, "He is a sorcerer or a man possessed!"
So We seized him and his hosts, and cast them into the sea. And he was the cursed.
And in 'Aad', when We sent against them the withering wind.
It did not leave without destroying to dust whatever it breezed past.
And to Samud, when it was said to them, 'Take your enjoyment awhile!'
Then they transgressed the Command of their God. So a deadly blast seized them while they stared.
They were neither able to stand nor were they could they receive help.
And, before them the people of Nuh: they were a people sinful.
And surely We created the heavens with powers, and surely We are the Expanders.
And We flourished the earth, so We are the excellent Preparers.
And We created everything in association that you may give thought.
So hasten towards Allah; surely I am to you a clear Warner from Him.
And set not gods with Allah; surely I am a plain Warner unto you from Him.
Even so not a Messenger came to those before them but said: 'a sorcerer; a madman!'
"Is it the manner they have exchanged?" Nay, they are people, insolent.
"So avoid them; you will not be disgraced."
"Remind them; the reminder profits the believers."
And I have not created the Jinn and the Humans except to serve Me.
I need nothing of their provisions, not do I desire they feed Me.
Surely it is Allah who Provides, the Mighty, the Ever-sure.
The evil doers will surely have the share like that of what their companions had; so let them not hasten Me.
So woe to the rejecters on their day, promised.
By the Thur!
By the Book inscribed.
By what has been explained.
By the house of ascent.
By the roof raised high.
By the sea filled with swell.
Surely the punishment of your God will come to pass.
There is none to avert it.
Upon the Day when the heaven shudders in tumult.
And the mountains will be blown away.
Woe that day unto the deniers.
Those who play at plunging.
On that Day they will be dragged with force to the hellfire.
"This is the fire which you used to deny."
"Is this magic, or is it that you do not see?"
"Burn therein; then bear with it or not - it is all one for you. You are only recompensed for that you were working."
Surely the God-fearing will be in the heavens and delight.
Rejoicing in that what their God has given them; and, their God had saved them from the torment of fire.
"Taste and drink to your hearts' content, for that you were working."
Reclining on the couches ranged in rows; and, We will join them with the people of vision.

And We will join them with those who believed and those descendants who followed them in belief; and, We will not deprive them of any of their works. Every man is a pledge for that which he has earned.
And We will provide them fruits and meat such as they desire.
They will serve cups to one another wherein is no prattle, no cause of sin.
There will be youths going around them, they will be like pearls, protected.
They will face one another, inquiring.
They will say, "When we were with our families, we were ever God-fearing."
"And Allah has been gracious to us, and saved us from the scorching wind."
"Indeed we used to pray unto Him before; and, surely He is the Beneficent,  the Merciful."
So, keep reminding them. By your God's grace, you are neither a soothsayer nor a madman.
Or, that they say, "A poet! By the time, we await his grief!
Say, "Await ye; indeed I too await with you!
"Or, are their minds drives them this way? Or are they an insolent people?
"Or do they say that you fabricated it? Nay, they shall not believe it!
"So, if they are true, let them bring a Hadith, Book like this!
"Or they were created without a thing! Or are they the creators?
"Or did they create the heavens and the earth? Nay, they are sure of nothing!
"Or do they possess your God's treasures? Or are these the controllers?
"Or do they possess the wisdom of authority by which they hear; if so let he who has heard bring a clear proof.
"Or has He daughters and you have sons?
"Or have you asked them wages and on that were they burdened?
"Or do they have the unseen and they write it down?
"Or do they want to plot? The rejecters are the surrounded?
"Or do they have God other than Allah? He is Most Pure from what they ascribe?"
If they see a fragment of sky falling, they would say, "A dense cloud!"
So leave them until they see their dreadful Day when they will lose all their senses.
On that Day none of their plots will avail them, and they will not be helped.
And for the wicked there indeed, is an added torment; yet most of them do not know.
And be patient for the decree of thy God - surely, you are in Our sight; so Glorify the Purity of your God when you rise.
And Purify the Glory of thy God in a part of the night and when the stars fade.
By the Star when it withers,
Your companion is not astray, nor is he in error;
Nor speaks out of desire.
It is naught but a revelation inspired.
The mightiest taught him.
Of such soundness, and he stood poised.
When he was in pure transcendence.
Then he drew closer, even closer.
Like the two points of a bow, or even nearer.
Then he revealed to His servants, all that he revealed.
His heart lied not of what he saw.
Will you then dispute with him as to what he saw?
And indeed he saw him again descending.
Near the tree of bounties.
Nigh which is the Paradise.
When the blessings covered the bounties.
The eyes swerved not nor get past it.
He indeed saw of the mightiest of his God's Signs.
Have you seen Laath and Uzza?
And the other, the third, the Manath?
What! For you the males, and for him the females?
If so, it is indeed an unjust division.

They are nothing but mere names that you and your fathers have spelt out; Allah has not sent down any proof to this; they indeed follow their surmises and desires. But there has come to them the straight path from their God.
Or shall man have all that he desires?
For, to Allah belongs this world and the Hereafter.
And how many an angel are in the heavens; yet, no one's intercession will avail aught except him about whom Allah is satisfied and pleased with, and allows.
Indeed the unbelievers in the Hereafter name the angels as if they are females.
They have no knowledge thereof; they follow only their surmises, and certainly, the surmises shall prevail not against the Truth.
So turn away from him who turns away from Our Remembrance, and who desires not except the life of this world.
Such is their sum of knowledge; verily, your God knows who has strayed from His Path, and Knows well the Guided ones.

And to Allah belongs whatsoever is in the heavens and whatsoever is in the earth, that He may recompense those who do evil for what they have done, and reward those who do good for what they have done.

Whoever guards against the sinful acts and the evil mind, except that which they do without knowledge - indeed, your God is ample in Bestowing Mercy. He knows well when He Created you from the earth, and when you were foetuses in your mothers' wombs. So do not praise your purity; Allah knows who among you is Pious.
Have you seen him - turned away?
He gave a little, then he stopped.
Does he possess the knowledge of the Unseen, and so he sees?
Or has he not witnessed what is in the Scripture of Musa?
Of Ibrahim, the accomplished.
That no one laden bears the burden of another.
And to man, he only lives by what he is striving at.
And for sure, his striving will be shown to him.
And then, he will be recompensed for it with the fullest recompense.
And the final end is with your God.
And He makes you smile, and makes you weep.
And verily, He causes death and brings life.
And surely, He created the male-female pairs.
From a discharged drop of liquid.
And, surely it is with Him to bring you back to life.
Surely He makes you endowed, needless.
And verily, He is the God of the blind faiths.
And that He destroyed the former Aad.
And Samud, he did not spare them.
And the people of Nuh before them; they indeed were ungodly and tyrannic.
And the overturned town, He overthrew.
Whatever has to surround them, surrounded.
So which of the Favours of your God do you dispute?
He is a warner of the warners of old.
The imminent is imminent.
None beside Allah can disclose it.
Do you then marvel at this Hadith-disclosure?
Do you laugh, and not weep?
And you proudly sport.
So surrender to Allah, and submit to Him!
The Hour has drawn nigh, and the moon split.
Yet if they see a Sign they slight it and say, "A known sorcery!"
And they cry lies, follow their desires; yet every affair is a settled matter.
And there has come to them many a deterrent warning;
Soulful Wisdom; yet warnings do not avail.
So turn away from them. Upon the Day when the Caller shall call unto a horrible thing.
With abased eyes, they will come forth from the tombs like scattering gross-hoppers.
They will hasten to the caller, and the rejecters will say, "This is a hard-day."
Before, the people of Nuh denied them; so, denying Our servant they said, "Madman', and was driven away.
Then he submitted to his God, saying, "I am certainly a loser; so, help me!"
So We opened up the gates of the heavens with the downpour.
And We gushed forth the springs of the earth; thus, the waters met for a matter decreed.
And We bore him upon that which was well-planked and well-caulked.
Thus, to reward him who was rejected, it was sailing in Our Sight.
And surely We left it for a Sign. Is there any that will remember?
How then was My chastisement and warning?
Verily, We have made this Quran easy for pondering; so, is there anyone who shall ponder?
Aad denied. How then was my chastisement and warning?
Lo! We let loose on them a screaming tempest, on a day of constant calamity.
Tearing away men like the trunks of palm trees torn up.
How then was my chastisement and warning?
Verily, We have made this Quran easy for pondering; so, is there anyone who shall ponder?
Samud denied the warnings.
They said, "Will we follow from among us a lonely man? Then we will only be in error and insanity."
Is it that upon him of all of us the message has been sent down? Nay, rather he is an insolent liar."
"They shall surely know tomorrow who the insolent liar is!"
"We will surely send a she- camel to test them; so watch them with patience!"
And tell them the water is divided between them and each shall drink water in his turn.
But they called their comrade; he took and hamstrung her.
How then was my chastisement and warning?
We sent upon them a single cry, and they were as the wattles of a pen-builder.
Verily, We have made this Quran easy for pondering; so, is there anyone who shall ponder?
The folks of Lut denied the warnings.
Lo! We sent upon them a storm of stones, save the family of Lut, whom We rescued in the last watch of the night.
As a blessing from Us; thus do We reward him who give thanks.
And he indeed had warned them of Our violent seizure, but they disputed the warnings.
And they demanded his guests from him, but We blinded them: "Taste My chastisement after My warnings!"
So in the early watches of the night, the lasting torment descended upon them.
How then was my chastisement and warning?
Verily, We have made this Quran easy for pondering; so, is there anyone who shall ponder?
And the folks of Firaun did receive the warnings!
They denied Our Signs, all of them; then We seized them with a seizure of the Mighty and All-Powerful.
Are the rejecters with you mightier than them? Or have ye immunity in the Scriptures?
Or do they say, "We are a host victorious?"
The hosts will all be routed and will turn and flee.
Nay, but their promised Hour is the Hereafter, and the Hereafter will be disastrous and bitter.
Surely the sinners are in error and insanity.
On the Day when they are dragged on their faces to the Hell, "Taste the smiting of the Hell-fire!"
We indeed have created everything in measure.
Our Command is not but as the blink of an eye.
We have destroyed the likes of you; is there then any that will remember?
And in the records are every deed of theirs.
Small or big, all are recorded.
Surely the God-fearing will be amid the gardens and rivers.
Upon the True Throne, near the Mighty King.
The Most Bountiful.
Taught the Quran.
He originated Man.
He explained to him in detail.
The sun and the moon to a reckoning.
And to Him do the plants and the trees surrender.
And he held the sky high, and He established justice.
That you shall not transgress.
So establish justice and be not unjust.
And the earth - He expanded it for His creations.
Therein are the various kinds of fruits and sheathed dates.
And the husk-covered grains and the flavorous much more.
So, which of the favours of your God will you both deny?
He originated human beings of clay like the potter's.
And created the jinns from the fire-flame.
So, which of the favours of your God will you both deny?
He is the God of the two ways of the earth, and the two ways of the heavens.
So, which of the favours of your God will you both deny?
He let forth the two seas; they meet.
There is a barrier between them; they shall not overpass.
So, which of the favours of your God will you both deny?
From both of them come forth corals and pearls.
So, which of the favours of your God will you both deny?
And His are the ships sailing in the sea loftily like mountains.
So, which of the favours of your God will you both deny?
All that dwells upon the earth shall perish.
And what remains forever is that which pleases your God, the full of Majesty and Honour.
So, which of the favours of your God will you both deny?
Those in the heavens and on the earth implore Him. His affair rise high every day.
So, which of the favours of your God will you both deny?
O ye twain! Soon Our respite for you will end.
So, which of the favours of your God will you both deny?
O company of Jinns and humans! If you have the power to cross the barriers of heavens and the earth, then overpass! Yet, you pass not without the Authority.
So, which of the favours of your God will you both deny?
Against ye twain shall be loosed a flame of fire and smoke, and you will have no defence.
So, which of the favours of your God will you both deny?
So, the skies will cleave asunder and it turns like the rose-oil.
So, which of the favours of your God will you both deny?
On that day, it will not be asked of the humans or the jinns concerning their sins.
So, which of the favours of your God will you both deny?
The sinners will be known by their marks and they will be taken by their forelocks and their feet.
So, which of the favours of your God will you both deny?
"This is the hell which the sinners called a lie!"
They will be going around between it and fierce, scalding water.
So, which of the favours of your God will you both deny?
And for him who fears facing his God are twin paradises.
So, which of the favours of your God will you both deny?
Abounding in branches;
So, which of the favours of your God will you both deny?
In them there will be two flowing springs.
So, which of the favours of your God will you both deny?
Therein of every fruit two kinds-
So, which of the favours of your God will you both deny?
They will be reclining on couches lined with the silk brocade, the fruits of the two gardens hanging low.
So, which of the favours of your God will you both deny?
In them will be insightful companions, modest - whom neither any man nor jinn corrupted before them.
So, which of the favours of your God will you both deny?
They will be like white pearls and corals.
So, which of the favours of your God will you both deny?
Is there any other than good wages for good?
So, which of the favours of your God will you both deny?
And besides them, there shall be two gardens -
So, which of the favours of your God will you both deny?
Dense green.
So, which of the favours of your God will you both deny?
Therein two springs, gushing forth-
So, which of the favours of your God will you both deny?
Therein fruits, and palm-trees, and pomegranates-
So, which of the favours of your God will you both deny?
Therein are the good and elegant-
So, which of the favours of your God will you both deny?
Insightful ones, guarded in cool pavilions-
So, which of the favours of your God will you both deny?
Uncorrupted by Jinn or humans before-
So, which of the favours of your God will you both deny?
Reclining on green cushions and fine carpets.
So, which of the favours of your God will you both deny?
Blessed are the Attributes of your God, owner of Majesty and Honour.
When the Event befalls;
There is no denying that it will befall.
It will abase, exalt.
When the earth will be made to shake with convulsions.
And when the mountains are made to crumble.
Then it will be dust spread out.
And you will become of three sections.
Then the companions of the right - who are those of the right?
And the companions of the left - who are those of the left?
And the foremost are the foremost.
They are those made the nearest.
In the Paradises of Bliss.
A multitude of the Foremost,
And a few of the later people.
On the lined couches.
Reclining on them facing each other.
Moving about them are young boys, eternal.
With the clear drink, filled up in goblets, ewers and a cup.
Their sensitivity is not lost nor will they lose sensibility.
And the fruit of their choice.
And the flesh of birds they may like.611
And the insightful, the Hurul Eins.612
Like unto hidden pearls.613
A reward for what they used to do.
Therein they shall not hear idle talk, nor cause of sin.614
Only the saying: "Peace! Peace!"
And the companions of the 'Right!' Who are the companions of the right?
Amidst the blessings,
Amid the gardens of fruits,
And in extended shades,
And the gushing springs,
And fruits in varieties,
They are endless, not forbidden,
And splendiferous couches.615
We shall create such womankind as an anew;
Pure from all unholy desires;
Kind, equitable;
Such, the womankind of the right-hand.
A multitude of those, foremost;
And all those of the right-hand!
And the people of the left-hand! Who are of the left-hand?
Mid the scorching air and the scalding water,
And in the thick of the burning smoke;
Neither coolness nor calmness;
They were indeed in luxurious pleasure before this!
And they persisted in grave sin;
And they were saying, "Is it sure, that we will be raised up again after our death and that we have become dust and bones?"
And our fathers, ancient?
Say, "The ancients, and the latter."
"On the appointed Hour, will ye all be gathered!"
"Then indeed - ye, the lying, the astray!
You will eat of the 'Zaqqum' tree.
And you will fill your bellies with it.
And worse, you will drink scalding water.
Lapping it down as thirsty camel.
This is their feast on the Day of Judgment.
We originated you; will you not then believe the truth?
Have you considered that which you emit?
Do you create it or are We the creator?
And We have caused the death among you; so, none can outstrip Us.
We will replace you with your like, creating you in a way you do not know.
You certainly know the creation of your first generation - then, will you not give a thought?
Have you considered that which you sow?
Do you make it grow or are We causing it to grow?
If We will, will make it refuse, and then you will be looking on, wondering.
"Lo! we are laden with debt."
"And we are forbidden."
Have you considered the water you drink?
Do you bring it down from the cloud or are We bringing it down?
Had We willed, We would make it bitter! So, why are you not thankful?
Do you consider the fire you kindle?
Is it you that made its wood or are We the makers?
We created it to reflect upon so that it benefits him who uses it.
So, praise the Glory of your God by His Attributes, Exalted.
But nay, I swear by the setting of stars!
If you know, this is a Mighty Truth.
Verily, this is a Noble Quran!
In this Book, it is well established.616
Except the Pure hearted, none shall reach upto it.
It is sent down by the God of the worlds.
Yet, are you mindless concerning this Hadith - Revelation?
Do you take your lies for your provisions?
At the Hour of death when it chokes the throat,
You are plain watchers at that time.
But We are closer to him than you; yet, ye see not.
So, if it is that you shall not be recompensed-
And if you speak the truth, why do you not revive him?
But if he is in the Nearness-
There shall be repose, ease and a blessed Paradise!
And if he is the companion of the right-hand,
O people of the right-hand! May you have Peace!
But if he was of those who lied and went astray-
He will be greeted with scalding water;
To be flung into the hell;
Surely this is the Eternal Truth.
So, praise the Glory of your God by His Attributes, Exalted.
Everything in the Heavens and the Earth Glorify Allah. He is the Mighty, the Wise.
His is the Sovereignty of the heavens and the earth; He quickens and gives death;  and,He is Able over all things.
He is the Preceder,  the Follower, and He is the Manifest and the Secret; and, He is the Knower of all things.

It is He Who intended that the Heavens and the earth be originated in six periods; then He set Himself upon the Kingdom. He Knows well that which enters the land, and sprouts out; and, that which is sent down from the sky and that which raises up to it. And He is with you wherever you are; and, Allah is Ever a Watcher over what you do.
The Kingdom of the sky and the earth is His, and all affairs shall return unto Him.
It is He Who causes the night to enter into the day, and the day to enter into the night; He is the Knower of all that are in the hearts.
Believe in Allah and His Messenger; and, in whatever He has made you inheritors, spend of it; for, those who believe and expend, for them is a high reward.
What is that with you that ye believe not in Allah when your Messenger calls you unto believing in your God Who has taken your solemn Covenant, if ye are believers?
It is He Who sends down upon His servant clear Wisdom to bring you to light from the darkness; and, Allah indeed is Most Merciful, Most Kind to you.

And what prevents you that you do not spend in the path of Allah? Allah's is the Authority in the heavens and the earth. No one among you is equal to those who were steadfast and spent before the victory; and, they are exalted in rank above those who spent after the victory; yet. Allah has Promised all a fair reward, and Allah is the Knower of all that ye do.
Who will give a beautiful loan for Allah's sake? He doubles it for him; and, for him is a Noble Reward!

On the Hour when you see the believing men and the believing women, you will see their light speeding in their front and to their right. "Today your reward is the Paradises beneath which rivers flow; therein you abide." That is the Mighty Triumph.

Upon the Day when the hypocrite men and hypocrite women shall say to the believers, "Look on us, so that we shall avail some light!" It shall be said, "Go back behind you and seek for a light!" Then there will be raised a wall between them having a gate, the inner side whereof is Mercy while the outer side thereof is punishment.

They will cry aloud to them, "Were we not with you?" They will say, "True. But you yourself to trial; you were expecting, suspecting; and until Allah's command came to pass, vain desires beguiled you; and, the deceiver has deceived you about Allah."
Therefore, today no ransom is accepted from you or from the rejecters; your abode is the Fire; it is most worthy for you. What an evil refuge!

Has the time not reached those who believed that their hearts trembled in fear at the thought of Allah and the Truth that has come down? And let them not become as those to whom the Book was given; their hearts have hardened after a long period has passed over them. And many of them are defiantly evil.
Know that Allah quickens the earth after its death; We reveal to you the Signs so that you will remember.
Surely, the alms giving men and women, and those who give a fair loan for Allah's sake - it shall be multiplied for them; and, they will have a generous reward.

And those who believe in Allah and His Messengers - they are the truthful and the witnesses in the eyes of Allah; they shall have their Reward and their Light. And those who reject and belie Our Signs, - they are the companions of Hell-Fire.

Know that the life of this world is but delusion, diversion and adornment; and, self-boasting and increasing the wealth and the children among you- the similitude for this is that of rain: the produces it brings forth rejoices the rejecters, but soon you see it drying up and turn yellow. Then it becomes decomposed; in the Hereafter, even severer will be the punishment. And there is Allah's Forgiveness and contentment. So the life of this world is not but delusion and mean enjoyment.

Race toward your God's Forgiveness and Paradise- its expanse is as the expanse of the sky and the earth; and, it is prepared for those who believe in Allah and His Messenger; that is the Mercy of Allah, and He Grants it to whom He Will. And Allah is Ever Ample-Giving.
It is not that whatever that happens in the earth or in you is Prescribed in a Record, before its occurring. Surely, that is easy to Allah.
And that you may not grieve over what is lost to you, and that you shall rejoice in what He has granted to you. Allah does not love those who are arrogant and boastful.
Such as are stingy, and bid men to be stingy; and, whoever turns away - verily, Allah is All-Sufficient, the Praiseworthy.

We indeed have sent Messengers with Clear Signs; and that, for the men to preserve justness, We sent down with them the Wisdom and the Revelation. And We created the Iron wherein is utmost destruction, but there are some advantages for the man; so that Allah may make evident those who help Him and His Messenger in secret.
And indeed We sent Nuh and Ibrahim, and among their descendants, We gave Prophethood and the Book; there are those who were guided. But many of them were defiantly evil.

Then, We made Our Messengers follow them; We made Isa, son of Maryam to follow and gave Injeel. We caused Kindness and Mercy in the hearts of those who followed him. But We have not ordained upon them to be hermits which they have invented- but for that, they may gain the pleasure of Allah. But they have not preserved it in the way they should have preserved. Then, We rewarded those of them who believed; yet, many of them are defiantly evil.

O believers! Fear Allah and believe in His Messenger; He will grant you twice His Blessings and give you a Light by which you will follow the righteousness; and, He will Forgive for you. Allah is Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.

That the people of the Book shall not doubt that they are not worthy to receive anything as Grace from Allah; and, know for sure that all Mercy is with Allah. He grants it to whom He is pleased with. Allah is Ever Most Gracious.

She who has disputed with you about her husband and has also pleaded with Allah, Allah has indeed listened to her cry; and, Allah has heard to both the disputes. Verily, Allah is the Hearer, the Seer.

Some among you say their wives as their 'mothers!' It is not that they are their mothers due to that. Whoever begot them are their mothers, but they surely say of what is loathsome and falsehood. But Allah is Most Relenting, Most Forgiving.

And whoever having said about their wives 'as their mothers', then comes to senses, before they resume their family relations, they shall free a slave - Allah admonishes you with this. And Allah is All-Aware of that you do.

If anyone has no means towards it, then before they touch each other they shall observe fasting for two consecutive months. If they cannot observe, then they shall feed sixty poor souls - that you may believe in Allah and His Messenger, and this is the limitation set by Allah. And whoever denies, for him is a painful torment.
Whoever opposes Allah and His Messenger, surely they will be disgraced as those before them were disgraced; We indeed have sent down Clear Warnings. And for the rejecters, is an abasing punishment.
On the day, when Allah gives them life and raises them all up, and then informs them of all that they did - though they would forget, Allah has recorded it. Then, Allah is Witness over all things.

Have you not observed Allah indeed Knows all in the heavens and the earth? In their secret council of three, it is not but Allah is the fourth among them; nor of the five, but He is the sixth. Nor lesser or greater than that wherever they are, but Allah is with them. Then on the Lasting Day, Allah will inform them of what they used to do. Surely, Allah is Cognisant of all things.

Have you not seen them, kept involving in the secret talks with sin and transgression against the Messenger despite the warnings that they shall not engage in the secrets? Then when they come forth to you, they say to you 'Peace', with which Allah is not pleased. And when they gather again secretly, they say to themselves, "Why has Allah not punished us for what we said?" Hell suffices them. They shall enter into it. What an evil destination!

O those who believe! If ever you engage in secret counselling, intend not sin and transgression, and disobedience to the Messenger while you are at it. But speak secretly to stay pious and to do good. And for Allah - unto Whom you shall be gathered - Fear Him!
The secrecy is from Shaitan to cast worry upon the believers; but without Allah's leave, he cannot cause any harm. So, may the believers, put their trust in Allah.

O believers! In a gathering, if you are said: "Move," move away; Allah will give you the place; and, when you are said: "Stand", then walk out; and, Allah will raise you in degrees who are believers and to whom the Wisdom of the Unseen is given. Allah is Aware of what you do.

O believers! If you are to talk to the Messenger in secret, do some charity before doing so; that is good and pure for you; but if you have no means to it - Allah is indeed Most Forgiving, Most Merciful.

Do you fear that you should have done good things before the secret counselling? Allah Forgives you even if you had not done it; so, keep up the sense of fear to your God, and for your purity give alms; and, follow Allah and His Messenger. And Allah Knows all ye do.
Have you seen him who keeps close relations, against whom Allah wrath is upon? They are neither of you, nor of them; and, wittingly they swear upon falsehood.
Allah has prepared for them a harsh punishment; indeed evil is that they are wont to do.
They bar the path of Allah using their oaths as a shield; so, for them is a disgraceful doom.
Their wealth and their people shall avail them aught against Allah; they are the companions of the Fire, wherein they abide forever.
On the Day when Allah raises them all up, they will swear to Him as they swear to you, and indeed would think they are on something. Surely they are the liars.
Shaitan has overcome them and made them forget, remembering Allah! They are the party of shaitan. The devil's party - surely, they are the losers.
Surely those who oppose Allah and His Messenger, they are among the people, abject.
Allah has decreed: "I and My Messengers will surely Overpower!" Allah indeed is All-Strong, Almighty.

You shall not find those who believe in Allah and the Lasting Day love them who have opposed Allah and His Messenger - they may be their parents, children or brothers; or, their relatives. In their hearts, Allah has strengthened their Faith; and, He has further strengthened them with His Ruh - the Soul. He will make them dwell eternally in the Paradises, beneath which the rivers flow. Allah is Pleased with them, and they are Pleased with Allah. And know for sure, it is Allah's Party, they are the Victorious!
Whatsoever is in the heavens and the earth Praise the Purity of Allah. He is the All-Mighty, the All-Wise.

It is Him, the first, to evict from their houses - those deniers of the people of the Book in the first mustering. But you never thought that they would leave; and, they too thought that their fortresses would surely protect them against Allah; but Allah cast terror into their hearts from a direction, unexpected. And they destroyed their houses with their own hands and the hands of the believers. So the people of Insight, remind ye!
And had Allah not decreed upon them their eviction, he would have severely punished them, in this world itself. And in the Hereafter for them is the torment of the Fire.
And they did breach with Allah and His Messenger; and, whoever breaches with Allah, - Allah indeed, is Severe in Retribution.
And that you destroyed the palm-trees, or that you left it standing on its roots is only by Allah's Leave, and that He abases the evil-doers.

And whatever that Allah gave from them unto His Messenger, - for this, you had neither spurred the horses, nor pricked the camels; yet, Allah surely gives authority to His Messengers, over whom He wills. And Allah has Power over all things.

What Allah extracted from the people of the town to His Messenger, belongs to Allah and His Messenger, for the near ones, for the orphans, for the needy, and for the righteous; and, that it shall not circulate within the wealthy ones among you! And accept that which the Messenger bids for you, and stay away from what he forbids; and, fear Allah. And Allah is Severe in Retribution.
It is for the emigrants who were driven out of their homes and possessions, seeking Allah's Mercy and His good Pleasure - they are helping Allah and His Messenger. They are the truthful ones.

And some others - those who have already set their houses up in Faith; they love the immigrants, expelled from their homes; and, in their hearts, they will not be in need from that has been bestowed on them; despite their poverty they will prefer them above themselves. Such as they, saved from the stinginess, are the successful.

And to those who come after them: they will say, "Our God! Grant us and our brothers who preceded us in Faith, Pardon! And allow not enmity in our hearts, towards the believers! Our God, You are the Most Kind, Most Merciful."

Have you not seen the hypocrites? They said to their unbelieving brethren among the people of the Book, "If you are driven out, we too will surely go out with you; and, we will never surrender to anyone; and, if they fight against you, we will truly be your helpers. But Allah bears witness, 'they surely are liars!'

If they are driven out these will not go out with them; and, if they are fought against, they will not help - and, even if they help, they will turn their backs on you and flee. Then, they will not be helped.
Truly in their hearts the fear of you is more, than for Allah; and, this is that they are people, senseless.

They will not come together to fight with you except behind the heavily fortified fortresses or a great wall; and, amongst them rivalry and enmity are terrible. You think their unity is formidable; but their hearts are scattered; and, this is that they are people without knowledge.
As some, before them, nearer - they suffered for their vileness. And for them is a painful punishment.
Like the example of Shaitan: he says to man, "Disbelieve".  And when man disbelieves, he leaves him and says, "I am free of you; lo! I fear Allah, the God of the worlds!"
So, the end for both is the eternal dwelling in the Fire; that is the recompense of the evildoers.
O, ye who believe! Fear Allah; let everyone remember what ye have sent forth for your reckoning; and conduct ye, fearing Allah. Allah surely knows what ye do.
And do not be like those who have forgotten Allah, because He has made them forget themselves. These are the worst sinners.617
Not equal are the inmates of the Fire and the owners of the Paradise. It is the owners of the Paradise who have achieved the Felicity.
Had We sent down this Quran on a mountain you would have seen it tremble and rent apart for fear of Allah. We reveal examples to the man that haply he may give a thought.
He is Allah! No God other than He. He is the Knower of the Unseen and the manifest. He is the Most Generous, the Most Merciful.

He is Allah, than Him there is no other Allah. The Sovereign King. The Most Pure. The Giver of Peace. The Grantor of Faith. The Protector. The Exalted. The Controller. The Magnanimous - Allah is Most Glorious, above all that they ascribe to Him as partners.
He is Allah - The Originator. The Perfecter. The Creator. Unto Him is All the Glorious Attributes. All that are in the Heavens and the Earth Glorify Him. He is the All-Mighty, the Most Wise.

O ye who believe! Take not those who are My enemies and your enemies as your earnest friends that you may reveal the hidden Truth to them. They hate the Truth that has come to you, and they drive out this Messenger and you because you believed in your God, Allah - if only you had set out to fight in My Cause and to My Good Pleasure! Because of your friendliness you disclose the secrets, but I am Aware what you conceal and what you make plain. So, whosoever of you does that among you, he verily has strayed away from the right way.
If they have a chance against you, they will be your enemies and harm you stretching out their hands and tongues. And they long for you to disbelieve.
On the Day of Judgment, your near and dear ones shall avail you nought; justice will be done between you; and, Allah is ever a Watcher over what you do.

There is indeed a perfect example for you with Ibrahim and those with him: they said to their people, "We have certainly cleared of that which you call upon besides Allah; and, we have rejected you. And until you become faithful to Allah, the only God, there has arisen hostility and hatred forever between us and you." And Ibrahim, but said to his father, "I have no power to prevent aught from Allah against you; but surely I will pray Allah for you, Forgiveness." And, he said, "Our God! We put our trust in Thee, and unto Thee is our return."
"Our God! Make us not a trial to the rejecters. And our God! Forgive us. Verily, Thou art the Mighty, the Wise."
There is a perfect example in them for those who believe in Allah and the Last Day. But whosoever turns away - for sure, Allah is Needless, Glorious!
Allah may cause affection with those of them against whom you have enmity; Exalted is Allah. Allah is Most Forgiving, Most Merciful.
Allah forbids not you to do good and deal justly with those who did not obstruct you in your way, and who drove you not from your houses. Surely Allah loves those who are just.

Verily, what Allah forbids is the affection you might develop for those who fought against you in your way, and drove you out of your homes and helped to drive you out. So whosoever make friends of them, they are the unjust.

O believers! If the immigrant believing women come to you, you shall check them; Allah Knows their Faith; so, if you come to know they are believers, send them not back to the disbelievers for such women are not lawful to those men, and those men are not lawful to such women. And no blame is on you that you give the women their dowry and make them of your household. And you shall not forcibly retain the wedlock of the disbelieving women; and, you can ask them that you had spent on them - this is the ordainment of Allah and the decision between you. And Allah is the All-Knowing, the All-Wise.

And those of your wives who have fled you and joined with the disbelievers - then, when you get the spoils of war, give them whose wives have fled, equivalent to that what they had spent on them. And fear Allah upon whom you had placed your Trust.

O Prophet! Accept the oath of the women when they come to you and pledge before you - that they shall not ascribe a partner to Allah, that they shall not steal, that they shall not indulge in prostitution, that they shall not kill their children, and that they shall not bring to public what they fantasies between their hands and legs - and when they swear that they will not act against the good of you. And seek forgiveness for them. Surely, Allah is Ever-Forgiving, Most Merciful.

O believers! Love not the people against whom is the wrath of Allah. It is because they indeed have lost all hopes of the Hereafter as the unbelievers have lost hopes of those who are lying dead in their tombs.
All that is in the Heavens and the Earth glorifies Allah. He is the Mighty, the Wise.
O believers! Why do ye say that ye do not do?
To say what you do not do is most hateful in the eyes of Allah.
Allah loves those who fight in His Way in ranks as though they were a building well-compacted.

And remember when Musa said to his people, "O my people! Why do ye harm me while ye know well I am a Messenger for ye from Allah?" So when they slipped, Allah made their hearts slip; and, Allah does not guide the transgressors.

And remember when Isa, son of Maryam said, "O People of Israel! By that that I have come to rectify the Taurat before me, - and that I shall give glad tiding about a Messenger after me by name 'Ahmad - The Honorable', I have come to you as a Messenger of Allah. But when he brought to them 'Clear Signs', they said, "It is manifest magic!"
Who is more unjust than he who forges against Allah when he is called to the 'Path of Peace!' And Allah will not guide a wrong doing folk.
They desire to blow out the Light of Allah with their mouths; but Allah will perfect His Light, though the unbelievers are averse.
It is He Who sent His Messenger with the Guidance and the Truth to outstrip all the other ways of life, though the disbelievers are averse.
"O believers! Shall I show you a trade that will deliver you from a painful doom?"
Believe in Allah and His Messenger, and strive justly in the path of Allah with your properties and lives; that is most beneficent to you if you know.
He will forgive you your sins and will make you enter the paradises beneath which the rivers flow; and, the fragrant eternal Paradise of Adnu; that is the Mighty Blessing.
And there is another that you long for; the Help and the near Victory from Allah. So, give good omen to the believers!

O believers! Become helpers for Allah, as those  who said, "We are your helpers for Allah", when Isa, son of Maryam turned to his followers and said, "Who will help me for Allah!" Then, a party of the people of Israel accepted, and another party rejected; So, We helped the believers against their enemies - so, they became the victors.
All that is in the heavens and the earth glorify Allah, the Sovereign, the Holy One, the Mighty, the Wise.

It is He Who sent to the people ignorant, a Messenger from among them that he may make clear His Signs to them and purify them, and that he may teach them the Book and impart Wisdom - lo! they were in manifest error before that.
And for the latter generations who have not yet joined them. He is the Mighty, the Wise.
That is the Blessing of Allah; He Bestows it upon whom He is pleased with. And Allah is Grand Gracious.

The similitude of those who shall not rehearse the Book after its commandment, is as the likeness of the ass carrying loads of books. Wretched is the likeness of the people who deny the Signs of Allah. Allah guides not people who are evil.
Say: "O people of Israel, wish your death if you say you are dearer to God than any other people, and if you are truthful."
But they will never wish it for what their hands have sent forth. And Allah is All-Aware of the unjust.
Say: "The death - which you flee from shall surely meet you; then you will be returned unto Him, the Knower of the secrets and the plain. Then He will inform you of what you were doing."
O believers! When you are called for the congregation on the day decided, to strengthen allegiance to Allah, leave your trading, and hasten to remember Allah. That is better for you if you know.
Thus having strengthened your belief in Allah, spread out on the earth, seeking only Allah's grace. And, that you may be victorious, keep up the remembrance of Allah ever often.

Say, "And, among them are they who if they find an amusement or trade, they rush to it leaving you standing. What is with Allah is better than the fun and transactions; and, Allah is the Best Provider."

The hypocrites come to you and say, "We will testify you are surely the Messenger of Allah." "Allah knows you are His Messenger." But Allah is a witness against them, says, "They are the lying hypocrites!"
They use their oaths as shield to bar from the path of Allah; verily, what they do is evil.
This is because they believed and then became unfaithful; so their hearts were sealed, and therefore they understand not.

If you see them their persons will surprise you, and when they speak you will give ears; but they are people like the uprooted tree, supported. They feel every single sound is against them - they are the enemies. So, 'ever be careful with them!' Allah will destroy them; where then do they turn?
And when it is said to them, "Come, Allah's Messenger seek pardon for you",  you will see them turning away their heads in pride.
Equal it is for them, whether you seek pardon for them or not. Verily, Allah will never forgive them; Allah will not guide the evil-living people.
Those are they who said, "Spend not for those with the Messenger of Allah until they part away from him." Allah's are the treasures of the heavens and the earth, but the hypocrites do not understand.
They say, "If we return to the city, the arrogant will surely drive the humble away from it." But all glory belong to Allah, His Messengers and the Believers - yet, the hypocrites do not understand.
O believers, let not your wealth and your children deviate you from the remembrance of Allah - and, whoever do so, they are the losers.

Spend among yourselves from what We have blessed you with before the death comes upon one of you, and he says, "O my God, will you delay me this awhile? If so, I too will give charity and become of the good doers."
But Allah delays not to anyone if the Hour has reached - Allah is the Knower of that you do.
All that is in the heavens and all that is in the earth praise the Glory of Allah. His is the Kingdom. His is the Praise. And He is powerful over everything.
He, it is who created you. There are among you who deny Him, and there are who believe in Him. And, Allah is Ever a Watcher over that you do.
He has created the heavens and the earth in Truth. And, He originated you, and fashioned you in the best formation. And unto Him is your abode.
He knows what is in the heavens and on the earth, and He knows what you hide and what you make plain; and, He Knows all in your breasts.
Has not the news come to your about the rejecters of faith, before? Then the suffered the penalty of their deeds; and, for them is a painful chastisement.

This is because their Messenger kept coming to them with sure Signs; then, they rejected and withdrew saying, "Shall a mortal guide us?" Allah is needless of them. And, Allah is Needless, All-Praiseworthy.
The rejecters think they will not be raised up. Say; "Nay! By my God, you will be indeed raised up. Then you will be surely informed of that you used to do; and, that is easy for Allah."
Therefore believe in Allah, and in His Messenger and the Light We have sent down. Allah is Well-Acquainted with all ye do.

The day of gathering - The Day He gathers ye all. That is the Day that brings loss. But whosoever believes in Allah and does righteous deeds - He will clear him of all his evils, and will cause them to enter the heavens beneath which rivers flow; they will abide therein forever. That is a Mighty Blessing.
But those who deny and cry lies to Our Signs are the inmates of Hell wherein they abide forever. What a wretched destination!
All incidences that happen about is not but by the leave of Allah; and, Allah guides the heart of him, who believes in Him. Allah is Well-Informed of everything.
So, follow Allah, and follow this Messenger; if you turn away withdrawing - what is with Our Messenger is, to reveal.
Allah - there is no God but He; and in Allah let the believers put their trust.
O believers! Surely among your wives and children, are your enemies. Therefore, be guarded against them - and if you forgive, ignore and endure them, verily, Allah is Most Forgiving, Most Merciful.
Trials are your wealth and children. But Allah, - with Him is the Reward, Mighty.
So, behave fearing Allah as much as possible, listen to what He says and follow Him; and, help among yourselves - that is better for you. And those who are saved from stinginess, are the victors.
