If you loan Allah a virtuous loan, He would multiply it for you, and He will Forgive you. Allah is Appreciative, Forbearing.
Knower of the Unseen and Manifest. The Mighty. The Wise.

O Prophet, say: "If you divorce your wives, pronounce it in such a manner, proper to calculate their waiting period. Fear Allah, your God; and, send them not from their houses except that they did indulge in open indecency, nor should they step out - such is the ordainment of Allah. Whoever disobeys Allah's Ordainment, he certainly harms himself. And you do not know that Allah may, even after this, create a way for them.

Therefore, when the time draws close, then keep them honorably, or part from them honorably. And keep two righteous among you as witnesses and establish your testimony for Allah. That is a good tiding for those who believe in Allah and the Last Day. But, he who guides him fearing Allah, for him is the way from Him.

For him, He Bestows expansive life from whence, he never expected. And whosoever put his trust in Allah, He shall suffice him. Verily, Allah attains His Purpose. Verily Allah has set a measure for everything.

And among your women if you doubt concerning their regular periods or those who have stopped menstruating - their waiting period is three months. And, for the carrying women their waiting period is until they bring forth their burden; and, whosoever fear Allah, He makes their life comfortable.
This is Allah's Command, and He has sent it down. Whosoever fears Allah, He absolves him of his sins and makes his reward, glorious.

Make the women live in your place according to your means, and trouble them not so as to make their life difficult; and, if they are pregnant fulfil their needs until they bring forth their burden; and, if they feed for you, be even more generous. Preserve justice among you; but if there is a difficulty, then another woman can feed.

Those who have a comfortable living, let them give liberally; but whosoever's life is straitened, let him give out of what Allah has provided him. And, Allah will not try anyone beyond what He has provided them - after the stress, soon Allah will bring ease.
How many a nation was insolent toward the command of its God and His Messengers - and, We reckoned it with a harsh reckoning and punished it severely.
Thus it suffered for its evil-works, and the end of its deeds were in loss.
Allah has prepared a painful punishment! So, the believers who know, fear Allah. Now Allah has sent down unto you, a reminder.

And, from Him a Messenger - He exemplifies Allah's Revelations to you, to bring forth the believing good-doers from darkness to light. And, Allah admits those who believe in Allah and does righteousness into paradises beneath which the rivers flow; therein their abode, eternal. Verily, Allah has given them a beautiful provision.

It is Allah who has Originated the seven heavens and of earth their like - that you may know, Allah indeed has power over and that He encompasses by His Wisdom, all things. And, between them constant are His Commands, descending.
O Prophet! Why have you prohibited that Allah has permitted for you, satisfying your companions? Allah is Most Forgiving, Most Merciful.
Allah has permitted you to break your covenants. Allah is your Master, and He is the Knowing, the Wise.618

And, when the Prophet confided some news to one of his wives, she revealed it; but Allah made it known to him. Of it, he made known some and ignored much of it. When he enquired certain of it, the woman said, "Who revealed it to you?" He said, "The All-Knowing and the All-Perceiving revealed it."

If only you two seek forgiveness for this from Allah, for both of your hearts have evidently inclined; and, if ye help each other against him, surely Allah is his Protector - and then, his helpers will be Jibreel, the good-hearted believers and the angels.
If he ever divorces you - Allah will replace you, giving him far better ones, who are - peace-loving, devout, pious, penitent, humble, traveling, widows and maids.

O believers! Protect you and your household from the Fire. Its fuels are humans and stones, over which are the angels, strong and severe; and, they disobey not in what Allah has Commanded them, but they do as they are Commanded.
O ye deniers! This day, say not any excuse. You are only being recompensed for what you were doing.

O believers, seek forgiveness from Allah; your God will remove you of your sins and make you enter the paradises beneath which the rivers flow; and, Allah will not disgrace the Prophet and those who believed with him on that Day. Their Light will far advance to their front and on their right. They will say, "Our God! Perfect us our Light and Forgive us. Lo! Thou art over all things, Able."
O Prophet! Strive against the rejecters and the hypocrites, and be stern with them. Their refuge is the Hell, an evil destination.

Allah sets forth an example for those who disbelieve - the wife of Nuh and the wife of Lut. They were under two of Our faithful slaves, but they betrayed them. So, they availed them naught against Allah. And it was said, "Enter ye with those who enter the Fire!"

And Allah sets forth an example to those who believe, the wife of Firaun. She said, "My God, grace me with a palace in the Heavens; save me from Firaun and his deeds; and, keep me from the people, unjust!"
And Maryam, the daughter of Imran: she has guarded her chasteness, so We breathed Our Ruh in her. And, she confirmed Our Words and the Scriptures and became of the obedient.
Blessed is He with whom is the Kingdom and He, over all things, Able.
He Created death and life to try you who of you is the best in deeds. He is the Mighty, the Forgiving.
It is He who Created the seven heavens in layers. You will not find a blemish in the Creation of the Benevolent. And, see again clearly. Do you find any defect?
And see again, and again - your vision will return to you fatigued and minimized.
And verily, We decorated the nearest sky with embellishments, and We made them flaming stones against Shaitans. And We have prepared for them the torment of blazing fire.
And whosoever rejects their God, for him is the punishment of Hell. That is an evil refuge.
When they are flung therein - its boiling sound, they will hear its disgusting noise.
It comes nigh with bursting anger. When each people was pushed therein, its guards will say to them: "Did the Warner not come to you?"
They will say, "Yes, indeed a Warner came to us; we cried lies saying, "Allah has not sent down anything; you are only in a great error."
They will say, "If only we had heard or listened, we would not have been among the companions of blazing fire."
They will accept their sins; so curse the companions of the Blaze.
Surely, those who fear their God in secret - there awaits them Forgiveness and a high Reward.
And, keep your word secret or proclaim - surely, He is the Knower of what is in the breasts.
Does not the Originator know? He is All-Subtle, All-Aware.
It is He who made this earth luxurious to you; spread out in all its directions and dwell under His Blessings. And your return is unto Him.
Are you without fear that He, the Sovereign would not cause you to plunge into the earth, the while it convulses?
Or are you without fear that the Sovereign will not send hailstorm against you? You will soon know how My Warning is.
And those who were before them were too denying; then, how was My warning?
Do they not see above them, the birds flying with their wings spread out and closing. But for the Benevolent, naught holds them. Surely, He Sees everything.
Or who is this that shall be a host for you to help you but for the Benevolent? The rejecters are only in delusion.
Or, if He has stopped providing you, who will give them to you? Nay, but these persist in insolence and frowardness.
Who is better guided - the one who crawls fallen upon his face? Or the one who walks upright on a straight path?
Say: "It is He who Originated you and gave the listening and the vision, and the perceiving hearts; but very little do you show thanks."
It is He who made you spread throughout the earth, and unto Him you shall be mustered.
And they say: "When is the promise, if you are truthful?"
Say: "The knowledge is with Allah, and I am but a plain warner!"
Then, when they see it nigh at hand, the faces of the deniers will be awry, and it will be said, "This is that for which you were calling!"
Say: "Have you considered: whether Allah causes my death and those with me or grants us Mercy, who will save the disbelievers from the painful torment?"
Say: "He is the Most Benevolent. We believe in Him. And we put our trust on Him - soon you shall know who it is that is in clear error."
Say: "Have you considered: if your water is sucked into the earth, who will bring it forth as springs?"
Nun - By the pen and what they inscribe,619
By your God's Grace, thou art not insane.
And you will indeed receive the goodly reward, eternally.
And verily, you possess the grand soul.
So soon you will see, and they will see-
Which of you is insane;
Your God knows which of you is astray from His Way, and He knows well who is Guided.
So obey not the deniers.
They desire to compromise if you compromise.
And heed not every mean swearer;
Every backbiter, slanderer;
Hinderer of the good, guilty aggressors, malefactor;
Cruel therewithal, base-born.
Because of his immense wealth and progenies,
When Our Signs are revealed to him, he says, "Tales of the ancients!"
We shall brand him on the snout.
Lo! We tried them as we tried the companions of the garden when they vowed they would pluck its fruits in the morning.620
And made no reservations.
So, while they were sleeping, the visitation from your God visited it.
And in the morning, it was a black, barren land.
'Come forth betimes upon your tillage, if you would pluck!'
So, they departed whispering together,
'No poor man shall enter it today upon you!'
They went forth betimes, strong and determined-
But when they saw it, they said, "Lo! We are lost!"
"Nay, we are to suffer privation!"
Said the most moderate of them, "Did I not say, 'why do you not give glory?'"
They said, "Glorious is He, our God; we were indeed the people, evil."
Then they turned, one against another, in blaming.
They said, "Woe to us! We were indeed transgressors."
"Our God will exchange for this, even a better provision; and, we surely turn to our God."
Such is the punishment. And if they did but know, the punishment to come is greater.
Indeed, for the God-fearing, with their God are the Gardens of Bliss.
What, shall We make those who opt for peace as the criminals?
What has happened to you? How do you decide?
Or have you a Book wherein you read?
That you shall indeed have, through it whatever you decide?
Or do you have the covenant from Us that whatever you decide surely shall hold good for you until the Last Day?
Ask them, which of them will guarantee that!
Or do they have partners? If they speak truly, them let them bring their partners.
On the Day when they will lose the power of ankle, they will be called to obey the Commands - they will not be able to do.
Disgrace will cover them even as they lowered their sights; but, there was constant call upon them to surrender to the command of Allah when they were healthy.
So, leave Me and those who belie this Hadiths - the Truth. We will draw them on little by little whence they know not.
And I shall respite them, but My decision is firm.
Or you asked them a wage, and so they are weighed down with debt?
Or is the Unseen theirs, and so they write down?
So, wait for your God's call; become not as he, of the fish; and, when he called upon, in deep anguish,-
Had his God's Mercy not reached him; he would have been cast upon the wilderness, being despised.
But his God chose him, and placed him among the righteous.
And when the rejecters hear you reminding, they indeed are well-nigh to strike you down with their glances. Surely he is a man possessed!
And it is naught but a reminder to all the worlds.
The Inevitable Reality.
What is the Inevitable Reality?
And what will inform you what is the Inevitable Reality?
Samud and Aad cried lies to the Striking Calamity.
So, as for Samud, were destroyed by the Screamer.
And as for Aad, were destroyed by a violent wind, furious.
He compelled it against them seven nights and eight days unabated; so, you will find them overthrown as stumps of uprooted palm trees, fallen.
So, do you find any of them left?
And Firaun, and those before him and the town overthrown did persist in evil.
And they disobeyed the Messenger of their God; so, He seized them with an extreme grip.
Lo! When the waters rose, We bore you upon the ship.
That you may reflect upon it, and that you may listen with care.
So, when the first call is blown;
And when the earth and the mountains are thrown out and made to crumble, crashing into each other;
Then, on that Day, the Inevitable shall come to pass.
And the sky will split asunder, for upon that day it shall be frail.
And the angels shall be on its boundary, and upon that Day eight shall bear the Command of thy God above them.
On that Day you shall be exposed; not one secret of yours concealed.
So, as for him who is given his record in his right hand, he will say, "Take, read my book!"
"Verily, I believed I shall have to meet my Reckoning!"
So, he shall be in a pleasing life.
In a Noble Garden,
Its clusters nigh to gather.
Eat and drink well pleased, for that you did long ago, in the days gone by.
But as for him who is given his record in his left hand, he will say: Lo! My record should not have been given to me!
"And I had not known the day of Reckoning."
"Would that it was all over?"
"My wealth has not availed me;
"My authority has gone for me."
"Seize him, and fetter him!"
"Then cast him into burning hell!"
"Then into a chain of seventy cubits' length insert him.
"He indeed did not believe in Allah, the Most High;
"Nor did he support the feeding of the needy;
"So, not for him this day, a friend;
"Neither any food saving foul pus;
"None will consume it but the sinners."621
So, I swear by that you see;
And by that you do not see.
Surely, this is the word from the Messenger, Noble.
And this is not the word of a poet; little do you believe.
Nor the speech of a soothsayer; little is it that ye receive.
A sending down from the God of the Worlds.
And, had he invented against Us any sayings-
We would have seized him by the right hand,
And then, severed his life-artery.
And not one of you could have held Us off from Him.
So, this is a reminder for the God fearing.
And We know there surely are those who deny among you.
And lo! It is a grief for the deniers.
And verily, this is the Truth of Certainty.
So, praise your God by His Attributes.
A questioner questioned to know the chastisement about to happen.
Upon the rejecters, which none may avert.
From Allah's ways of ascent.
The angels and the Soul ascend unto Him in a day whose span is fifty thousand years.
So, endure with a goodly patience.
They indeed see it far away.
But We see it very near.
The sky will become as molter brass.
And the mountains, as cotton.
A friend will not enquire about another friend.
They will see it before their eyes - the sinner, on that day, will wish to ransom himself from the punishment of that day, by his children-
And his wife, and his brother-
His kindred who sheltered him-
And all that are on the earth, if then it might save him.622
Not so. For, verily it is a blazing fire.
Snatching away the scalp.
Calling him who withdrew and turned away.
Who amassed and hoarded.
Verily, man is every hasty.623
Fretful when an evil touches him.
And niggardly when a good touches him.
Except those who are devoted to righteousness.
And who are steadfast in righteousness.
And those in whose wealth, is a portion determined;
For those who seek and the needy.
And those who believe in the Last Day.
And those who fear the punishment of their God-
Verily, it is not that their God's punishment is not to be feared.
And those who guard their dignity,
Except from their companions and what their right hands own, for thus they are not blameworthy.
So, whoever trespass, they are the offenders.
And those who keep their pledges and their covenants-
And those who stand fast as witnesses;
And those who guard, by being prayerful,
Such will be in the gardens, dignified.
What is that with the rejecters? They rush towards you.
From the right and the left, in throngs.
Does every one of them desire to enter the blessed Paradise?
Nay, We indeed have created them from that they knew.624
So, 'By the God of the risings and the settings', We are able.
That We will change a far better people in their place; none shall surpass Us.
So, let them play and plunge until the meet their Day, promised.
Verily, on that Day, they will hastily raise forth from the graves as racing to a destination.
Their sights will lie flat, the disgrace surrounding them; that is their promised Day.
We indeed sent Nuh to his people saying, "Warn your people before a chastising punishment comes upon them."
He said, "O my people, I am unto you a clear warner."
"Call upon Allah alone; fear Him, and obey me."
"He will forgive your sins, and He will respite you to an appointed term; and, when His time arrives for sure, it will not be delayed - if only you knew."
Then he said, "My God! Surely I called to my people by night and by day."
"But my call has only increased them in flight."
"And whenever I called them to Your forgiveness, they thrust their fingers into their ears; and, they covered them with their clothes. And they are obstinately arrogant and proud."
"Then I called to them with certainty."
"And then I spoke to them in open and in secret."
And I have said, "Ask forgiveness from your God. He indeed, is ever All-Forgiving."625
"He will loose heaven upon you in torrents.
"And He will succour you with wealth and children. And He will create gardens for you and create for you rivers.
"What is that with you that you look not for Grandeur in Allah!
"Surely He created you in various stages.
"Have you not given thought how He has created the seven heavens in layers?
"And He has set the moon therein as an Illumination and the sun as a Light.
"And Allah fashioned you out of the earth.
"Then He will make you return unto the earth and raise you up again.
"And Allah has made the earth expansive for you.
"And made highways in it for your journey."
Nuh said, "My God, surely they disobey me; and, they follow those whose wealth and children have not increased them but in the loss."
"And they plot a mighty plot.
"And they say, 'leave not your deities; and, surely desert not Wadd, Suwaau, Yaghusu, Yaooq and Nasr'."
"And surely they have led many astray; so, increase not except the path astray for these unjust."
Because of their sins they were drowned and then thrust into the Fire, for they found not besides Allah, any helper.
Then Nuh said, "My God! Leave not a single rejecter of them on this earth!"
"If you leave them, surely they will mislead Your servants; and, they will breed not except rejecting libertines."
"My God! Give forgiveness to me and my parents, and those who enter my house with belief, and the believing men and the believing women. And increase not the wicked in aught but destruction."
Say: "It has been revealed to me that certain among the Jinns have listened and said, 'we surely heard an amazing Quran'."
'It shows the straight path, so we believe in it. And we will ascribe no partner to our God.'
'And exalted is the Nobleness of our God; He has taken neither wife nor son.'
'But the fools among us say unfair words against Allah.'
'And we were of the view that the men and jinn will never lie against Allah.'
'But the men among the human beings were indeed seeking refuge in men among the jinns, and so, increased them in their arrogance.
'And certainly they had thought as you think that Allah will never raise anyone up.'
'And we attempted towards the sky, and found it filled with stern guards and burning flames.'
'We used to sit at the vantage points to overhear; but now whoever tries so will find a fiery blaze in wait for him.'
'And we indeed know not whether their God has destined punishment for those on the earth or has he intended for them guidance.'
'And surely with us are those who are righteous and those who are not so; moreover, we were followers of different sects.'
'And we understand that we cannot escape Allah in the earth, neither be able to frustrate Him by flight.'
'And we believed when we heard the guidance; therefore, whoever believes in his God will fear neither deprivation nor oppression.'
'And certainly among us that submit to Peace, and among us are the evil ones. Whosoever is inclined to peace are they who have attained guidance.'
The evildoers have become the firewood of Hell.
If they are steadfast upon the guidance, We will surely water them plentifully.626
That We might try them thereby. So, whoever turns away from the remembrance of his God, He will thrust him into severe chastisement.
And verily, heartfelt surrendering is only for Allah; so, Appreciate not anyone besides Allah.
And surely, when the servant of Allah turned to Him, they became about him in throngs.627
Say: "I only call upon my God, and I will not assign a partner unto Him.
Say: "I possess no power over you, either for hurt or for rectitude.
Say: "Surely, no one can protect me from Allah, neither will I find a refuge besides Him.
Say: "But to reveal from Allah, and to convey His Messages. So, whoever disobeys Allah and His Messenger, for him is the Hell-Fire, wherein such will abide.
Until, when they see that which they are promised, then they will know whose helpers are weaker and low in counts.
Say: "I know not whether what you are promised is nigh or my God has set a period for it."
The Knower of the Unseen! He reveals not His Unseen to anyone.
Except whom he has approved of the Messengers; and, assuredly He sends guards before him and guards behind him.
For reassurance that they had plainly conveyed the Message of their God - and while He encompasses all they possess, He has controlled everything by numbers.
O you under the covering.
Keep up the remembrance during the night, except a little.
Relax in it a half or a little less in it.
Or a little more - and Quran, reflect upon it clear and composed.
Soon We shall surely send down upon you a Mighty Word.
Rising at night indeed merges with the Oneness and purifies the word.
Surely in the day you have prolonged activities.
But remember your God's Attributes and ever stay turned towards Him.
The God of the rising and setting; there is no God but He, and so, keep Him alone your refuge.
And bear with what they say and stay away from them as a dignified.
Leave Me to those who cry lies, those of ease; and, leave them to a respite.
Verily, with Us are the fetters and the Hell.
And food that chokes and painful torment.
On that Day the earth and the mountains shall rock violently and the mountains will become a heap of running sand.
Surely We have sent unto you a Messenger as a witness over you, even as We sent to Firaun a Messenger.
But Firaun did disobey the Messenger; so, We seized him with a severe penalty.
So, if you reject how you will save on that Day that will make even the children grey-headed?
The sky will split apart; His Promise shall be performed.
Verily, this is a reminder; so, whoever wills, may he follow the guidance towards his God.

Verily, your God knows that you and those with you do remember Allah, close to two-thirds of the night; or half therein; or one-third thereof. Allah is the appraiser of the day and the night, and He knows you shall not be able to value it; and, so He has turned unto you - therefore, recite Quran as clearly as possible that you might rehearse it. Again, He is aware there are those among you who are ill, who are journeying seeking Allah's grace, and those who strive in the cause of Allah. So, have ease as you reflect, keeping up in Allah's remembrance, while you ever involve in charity. And give a beautiful loan for Allah's sake. Whatever you send forth for you, as good deeds, you will find it with Allah, a thing most grand, and a wage most noble. And seek forgiveness from Allah. Verily, Allah is Most Forgiving, Most Merciful.
O thou in the garment,
Raise up and warn!
And glorify your God.
Keep your garments neat.
And impiety abhor!
Help not expecting to gain greater.
And for your God, be patient.
And when the Call will be made,
That Day will be the hardest one.
For the deniers, not easy.
Leave Me to him whom I have created alone.
And I gave him expansive wealth;
And children to be by his side!
And furnished for him, all easiness.
But he desires I add him more to it.628
Nay! He indeed is insolent towards our Messages.
Soon I shall make him ascend to a deadly peak.
He indeed plotted and acquired;
Death seize him! How he could acquire!
And so, death seize him! How he could acquire!
And he plotted again;
Then he was angry, and mad.629
Then he turned away and became arrogant.630
Then he said, "It is naught but a bewitching magic!"
And, "It is not but the words of a mortal being!"
I will cause him to enter the 'Saqar!'
And what will inform you what 'Saqar' is!
It leaves naught; it spares naught.
Over it are nineteen.

And We have not placed as guards over the Saqar-hell but the angels. And We have made their numbers as only a test to those who reject - that the people of the Book may confirm, and the believers may strengthen their affirmation; and, that the people of the Book and the believers may not doubt. And that those in whose hearts is disease and the disbelievers shall say, "What does Allah intend by this as an example?" Thus Allah sends astray whom He will; and, guides whom He will. And none will know your God's hosts except Him. And this is naught else than a Reminder unto humanity.
Nay. And I swear by the Moon;
And, by the Night - as it withdraws;
And, by the dawn - as it brightens;
It indeed, is one of the mightiest things.
As a warning to the humanity;
whoso among you wish to go forward or withdraw.
Each one is held in pledge for that he earns.
But for the companions of the right hand;
In the gardens - they will exchange.
Concerning the sinners;
What made you enter the Saqar-hell?
They will say, "We were not in the Remembrance of Allah,
"And we did not feed the poor,
"We stayed drowned with the drowned,
"And we were denying this Day of Reckoning -
"Until the certainty reached us."
So, intercessions of intercessors shall avail them naught.
Then what is with them that they turn away from the Reminder?
As if they were frightened asses.
Fleeing - before a lion.
But each man of them desires he received a spread out scripture.
No, they did not fear the Hereafter.
Not so, verily this is a Reminder.
Then whoever wills shall remember it.
But unless Allah wills, they shall not perceive; He is worthy to be feared. He is worthy to Forgive.
I swear by the Day of Resurrection;
And, by the cursing Soul;
Does man think We cannot assemble his bones?
Nay, We can perfect his very fingertips.
Nay, man desires to give the lie to what is before him.
He says, "When is the Day of Resurrection?"
So, when the sight becomes dizzy;
And the moon becomes hazy;
The sun and the moon will be merged.
On that Day, man will say, 'Whither to flee?'
Alas, no refuge!
On that Day, the place of refuge is only with thy God.
On that Day, man will be informed of what he has sent before and left behind.
Nay, man is ever a witness against himself.
Even though he puts forth his excuses.
So move not your tongue in haste.
Indeed, upon Us is the putting together thereof and guiding thereby.
So, when We establish it a Guidance, follow the Guidance.
Then upon Us is its revelation.
But ye, people, impulsive.
So, you ignore the Hereafter.
Upon that Day, the faces shall be radiant.
Looking toward their God.
And upon that Day the faces shall be dark.
Certain of a wreaking Calamity to befall them.
Nay, when, reaches the throat.
Said: "Which is the magician?"
But he is sure that it is the parting.
And ankle will intwine with ankle.
On that Day, is the driving toward your God.
For he neither believed, nor did he humble.
But he cried it lies, and he turned away.
Then he joined his folks, proud.
Be cursed! Curse be upon you.
Then be cursed! And curse be upon you.
Does man think he will be left roam at will?
Was he not a despised drop, emitted?
Then He raised him to a higher degree, then he Created him in perfection.
Then from it He Created the companions: the male and female.
Is He not able to give life to the dead?
Has not there been upon man a while in the space in which he was nothing to be mentioned?631
Verily We created man from a drop essence! And that We shall try him, we made him hearing and seeing.632
Surely We showed him the Way for which he is either grateful or ingrate.
Verily We had prepared for the rejecters: the chains and shackles, and the burning Hell-Fire.
Surely the righteous will drink of a cup whose mixture is Camphor.
It is a Spring wherefrom the servants of Allah will drink and they will make way for its flow abundantly.633
They are those who fulfilled their promises. They feared the Day whose evil will be spread out.
And for the love of Him, they will feed the needy, the orphans and the prisoner.
We feed you only for the pleasure of Allah, and we desire not recompense from you, no thankfulness.
For we fear from our God a Day of wrath and distress.
So Allah will deliver them from the distress of the Day and give them radiance and joy.
And rewarded them for their patience, the gardens and silk garments.
They will recline upon the couches; therein they shall neither see sun nor chill.
The shades thereof will be close upon them, and the clustered fruits thereof will bow low.
Goblets of silver will be passed around them, and beakers of crystal.
Crystal clear -  beakers made of silver, to an exact measure.
And they will be offered to drink a cup mixed with Zanjabil.
And therein is a spring, called Salsabeel.
Immortal youths shall go about them; you would think them be scattered pearls.
And if you could see, you will see therein pleasant bounties and the Grand Kingdom.
Upon them will be garments of green silk and brocade, and they will be decked with silver bracelets; and, their God will give them to drink a pure drink.
Behold, this is a  reward for you, and your striving is appreciated.
Surely it is We who sent down this Quran upon you by stages.
So wait for the Command of your God and obey not any of the sinners or ingrates.
Keep purifying the Attributes of your God, morning and evening.
And during the night surrender to Him and glorify His Attributes through the livelong night.634
They indeed desire to hasten, and so, they leave behind them their day, laden.635
It is We who created them and preserved their standard; and, if We wish we will exchange their likes.
Surely this is an admonition. So he who will, take guidance towards his God.
Yet, unless Allah wills you shall not. Allah indeed, is Most Knowing, Most Wise.
He admits to His Grace whom He will, and for the wrong-doers He has prepared a painful chastisement.
By that sent forth in gusts,
By the wind that blows furiously,
By the dispersers dispersing,
By those who distinguish,
By those who set forth thinking -
Forgiveness or warning;
Surely that which is promised to you shall befall.
And when the stars shall be extinguished,
And when heaven shall be split,
And when the mountains are blown away,
And when the time is appointed for the Messengers -
Until when are they delayed?
Till the Day of Judgment.
Which will inform you what the Day of Judgment is.
On that Day, woe to them who deny -
Did We not annihilate those before you?
And then, We will make the latter to follow -
Thus is Our Way with the criminals.
On that Day, woe to them who deny -
Did We not create you from mean drop?
Then We planted it in a place, secure.
For a term determined.
Thus made; excellent Makers are We.
On that Day, woe to them who deny -
Have We not made the earth embracing you?
For those alive and the dead?
And We firmly set therein souring mountains, and sated you with sweet water.
On that Day, woe to them who deny -
Depart to that to which you cried lies.
Proceed toward the threefold shadow.
No cooling nor shelter from the blaze.
Surely it throws sparks as huge mansions.
It will indeed be like yellowish camels.
On that Day, woe to them who deny -
This is the Day they cannot speak;
Neither be permitted to say excuses.
On that Day, woe to them who deny -
This is the Day of Judgment, We have gathered you and the men of old -
So, if you have plot, then plot against Me.
On that Day, woe to them who deny -
Indeed, the God-fearing will be amid the shades and springs.
And such fruits as they love to taste.
Eat and drink pleasantly for that ye did.
Surely thus do We reward the good-doers.
On that Day, woe to them who deny -
"Eat and take your joy a little -  you are sinners!"
On that Day, woe to them who deny -
When it is said to them, "Humble,! They will not!".
On that Day, woe to them who deny -
So, which Hadith-Reminder will they follow after this?
Of what do they ask one another?
Of the tidings of the Unseen.
On which they are at variance.
Nay, they will soon come to know.
Again, they will soon come to know.
Have We, not well-spread the earth?
And caused the mountains, fount-heads?
And We made you, companions.
And We made your sleep, repose.
And We made the night, a garment.
And made the day, your living.
And made above you, the resolute seven.
And We appointed a guiding light.
And We sent down the torrents from the dark clouds.
To bring out the grains and plants thereof.
And the gardens luxuriant.
Verily, the Day of Judgment, is time-prepared.
Upon the Call, you will come forth in ranks.
And the sky will open into gateways.
The mountains shall vanish and become as a mirage.
Surely, the Hell is awaiting,
An abode for the transgressors.
While abiding therein eternally -
They will not taste therein coolness nor drink.
Save scalding water and pus.
Just recompense.
For lo! They were never of the belief in the Reckoning.
And they belied Our Signs, crying lies to them.
And We have registered everything in a record.
So taste! We shall not increase for you aught, save, the torment.
Verily, for the God-fearing, is a grand victory.
Gardens and vineyards.
Pure-hearted companions of equal ranks.
And a full cup.
Therein they shall hear no vain utterances, nor cry of lies.
A high-reward from your God with a reckoning, just.
The God of the heavens and the earth, and everything in between: the Most Bountiful - none shall have the power to speak to Him.
On the Day when the Soul and the Angels stand in ranks - none shall speak except whom the Bountiful allows; and, he will speak the Truth.
That is the True Day. So whoever wills, may he, take unto His God, a resort.
Surely, We warn you of an impending torment; the man will see on that day what his hands have sent forth; and, the rejecters will say. "Woe to me! I should have been dust."
By those who force capture,
By those who wind up with ease,
And by those who swim, gliding,
And by those who race in advance.
By those who govern every affair.
On that Day when there are convulsions in succession;
And the successions shall continue-
Hearts on that Day, shall tremble.
Their eyes shall lie flat.
They say, "Will we indeed be restored to our original state?"
"What, after our bones have become decomposed?"
"If so, that restoration will be a great loss!"
But that shall be a single Call.
And behold! they will be raised up.
"Did Musa's 'Hadith-history' reached you?"
When his God called to him in the sacred valley of Thua-
"Go to Firaun! Surely he has transgressed;
And say, "If he still has the mind to repent."
"Then I will show you the Way toward God, and you will become fearing."
So, Musa showed him a great Sign.
But he denied and disobeyed.
Then he turned away and strived.
Then he gathered and proclaimed.
"I am your God, Most High!"636
Allah seized him with the punishment for the ultimate from the start.
Surely therein is a Sign for the God-fearing.
Are you stronger in Creation or the sky He built?
He raised its vault and ordered it.
He made its night dark and its day bright.
Then He spread out the earth.
Therefrom He brought forth its waters and its pastures.
And the mountains He set firm.
A provision for you and your cattle.
So, when the greatest Catastrophe comes;
Upon the day when man shall remember what he has striven.
Then Hell will stand forth to him who sees.
Then as for him who was insolent -
And chose the worldly pleasures -
Lo! Hell is the abode.
And as for him who has guarded from low desires, fearing to stand before his God -
Lo! The Paradise is the abode!
They will ask you about the Hour: when it shall berth.
What art thou about, to mention it?
Its decision rests with your God.
Thou art but a warner unto him who fears it.
Lo! On the Day when they see it they shall know they had not tarried for a part of the evening or morning.
He frowned and turned away,
Because the one who cannot perceive came to him,
But do you perceive he might have had the clarity?
Or the admonition would have reminded him to his benefit.
But he who disregards -
Unto him you pay regard;
Yet, it is not your concern if he purifies not.
But as for him who came to you earnestly,
Fearing-
You turn away from him.
Nay! Because verily, this is an admonishment.
So, whoever is earnest, will remember.
In the Books, Noble.
Placed High; Preserved Pure.
Recorded by the Recorders;
Noble, Righteous.
Woe to man! What an ingrate!
From which He created him?
Created him from a drop, and perfected-
And He made his way Easy.
Then He causes him to die and makes him dust.
Then He will raise him again when He Will.
No, man has not fulfilled His bidding.
So let man consider his food.
Verily, it is We who send down the rain;
Then We cleave the earth, rendering it apart;
Then We caused the grain to grow therein.
And vines and vegetables;
And olive and dates;
And dense gardens;
And fruits and eatables;
That it shall be fruitful to you and your cattle.
So when the mighty Call is sounded;
At that moment, man will take to flight; leaving his brother-
Abandoning his mother, father-
Deserting his wife and children-
On the Day, to each one his situation will be enough.
On the Day, some faces will be bright;
Brilliantly radiant and joyous.
But on the Day, some other's faces will be dusty;
Stark darkness will cover them;
They are the rejecters, the evil ones.
When the sun is covered up,
And when the stars shall fall,
And when the mountains are overthrown,
And when the habitation straitens,
And when the wild animals are mustered,
And when the seas are aflame,
And when the Souls are gathered,
And when there is the questioning - why it was buried alive,
As to the reason why it was killed,
And when their deeds are made open,
And when the sky is removed,
And when Hell is set blazing,
And when Heaven is brought nigh,
Each will know what it has brought with it.
So, By that which withdraws-
That which advances shall vanish.
And By the night that recedes,
And By the Sighing of morning freshness -
Surely, this is the Word from  a Messenger, Noble.
Powerful, being in mighty rank with the All-Sovereign.
Honorable, trustworthy.
And your companion is not mad.
He indeed saw him while he was crystal clear.
And he does not hesitate to reveal of the Unseen.
And it is not the word of the accursed Shaitan.
Whither then go ye?
It is an admonition to people of all the worlds-
To him who wishes the Straight Path.
Yet, you shall not seek it unless Allah, the God of the worlds Wish.
When the sky is cleft asunder,
And when the stars fall,
And when the seas are swept aside,
And when the graves are opened,
Each soul shall know what it has sent forth and what it has left behind?
O man! What deceived you from obeying your God, the Most Generous?
He Originated you, Created you, and Perfected you.
He positions you, in the status He decides.
Yet, you deny the Hour.
And surely, over you are the guards.
The Noble, Recorders.
They know what you do.
Surely the righteous will be in the Paradise 'Nayeem'.
And the evil-doers will be in Hell.
They shall enter it on the Day of Execution.
And they shall not hide away from it.
Which will inform you of the Day of Execution?
And which will inform you of the Day of Execution?
On the Day one shall not avail another; on that Day, Allah's is the Sovereignty.
Woe to the stinters,
When they buy from the people they take in full measure;
But when they give, they reduce the measure and weight.
Have they not considered they shall surely be raised up?
For a Mighty Day-
When man will stand before the God of all worlds-
So, the record of the evil-doers is in Sijjin.
Which will inform you of what Sijjin is-
It is a sealed record of the deeds.
On that Day, woe to them who deny -
They cry lies to the Day of Judgment.
And none shall cry lies to it, save the insolent transgressor.
When Our Inspirations are revealed plain, he says, "Tales of the ancients!"
Not so! But what they earned has rusted upon their hearts.
No indeed, upon that Day, they shall be veiled from their God.
Then, verily, they shall burn in Hell.
Then it will be said, "This is that you cried lies to."
Nay, But the Record of the Righteous is in Illiyyun.
Which will inform you of what Illiyyun is.
It is a Sealed Record of the good deeds.
The Near ones shall be its witness.
Surely the righteous will be in the Paradise Nayeem.
They will be witnessing in Peace.
You will recognize from their brilliance endowed faces.
They will be given to drink of the juices from the purest fruits.
Its seal is Pristine; so, whoever wills let them wish.
And its taste is of Tasneem.
It is a gushing Spring; and, of it the Near ones will drink.
The criminals, surely were mocking at the believers.
And when them, passed them by, pass mocking glances - one to another.
And when they return to their households, they return with pride.
And when they see they will say: "Surely, these are them in error."
"They have not been sent as Guardians."
But on that Day, the believers will have the last laugh at them.
They will be witnessing in Peace.
"Have the rejecters been recompensed for that they used to do?"
When the sky is split asunder,
And as commanded, when it submits to its God,
And when the earth is spread vast-
And when it casts forth all in it and empties-
And as commanded, when it submits to its God,
O Man, you strive toward your God with a firm striving, and you will meet Him.
So whose record of his deeds is given in his right hand,
His questioning will be easy;
And he will return to his people in joy.
But whose record is given behind his back,
He will cry, 'Woe to me!'
And he will burn in Hell.
Surely he joyously lived with his people.
He was of the surety, 'I will never return!'
Nay, his God indeed was ever watchful of him.
And I swear by the setting glow of the ruddy sky-
And by the night, and that it gathers.
And by the full moon-
You shall indeed be raised in ranks by stages.
So what ails them, that they believe not!
And when guided are they by the Signs, they submit not to the guidance.
But the rejecters cry lies.
And Allah knows all well that they conceal;
Warn them of a painful torment.
Save those who believed and were righteous - for them is a goodly wage, eternal.
By the sky holding the planets,
And by the promised Day,
And by the witness and upon the witnessed,
Killed were the Men of the Pit-Fire,
The fire abounding in fuel.
When they sat by it,
And were themselves witnesses of what they did to the believers;
They avenged them not but for that, they believed in Allah, the All-Mighty, the All-Laudable.
Unto Him is the Kingdom of the heavens and the earth; so, Allah is the witness over all things.
Those who are not in penitence over their persecution of the believing men and believing women, indeed, for them is the doom of Hell; and, the doom of burning Fire.
But those who are believing and righteous, for them are the Paradises beneath which rivers flow. And that is a Great Attainment.
Surely severe is the Grip of your God.
Verily, He it is who Originates, and Creates.
And He is Most Forgiving, Most Kind.
Sovereignty is His, the Magnanimous.
Effecter of what He Will.
Has the Hadith-the Truth of the army reached you?
Of Firaun and Samud?
But the rejecters persist in crying lies.
And Allah encompasses them from behind.
Nay, this is Quran, the Noblest.
Preserved in the Noble Soul.
By the sky and the Night Star,
What shall inform you, what the Night Star is!
The piercing star!
